name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Freshly picked bouquet
description: Fresh fragrant flowers are always a rarity\, as is true love.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Bathhouse bedchamber key
description: The key to the bedchamber shared by the bathwenches at Adam's bathhouse.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Ornate Cuman bow
description: The Cuman riding bows are one of the lighter bows\, easy to handle even from the horse's saddle. Their strength comes from the layering of different materials similar to better crossbows. This piece is exceptionally well crafted and therefore slightly stronger than normal.

name: Reinforced bludgeon
description: A wooden bludgeon reinforced with blunt spikes that can quickly turn anyone's face to a bloody mash. A weapon like this can put a swift end to any tavern brawl or absent-minded traveller's life.

name: Bag of nails
description: Half a pound of metal nails. Theresa would be very happy.

name: Dagger mace
description: A fine\, agile weapon with a dangerous tip forged into the shape of a dagger. No pauper can get his hands on a weapon like this\, unless he steals it.

name: Short gambeson
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Sketch – Racing horseshoes
description: A blacksmith's horseshoe sketch. Because every master had to start somehow.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: The Art of the Sword I
description: A skill book on Sword combat.

name: Duelling longsword
description: A perfectly balanced sword with a slender blade for true sword masters. The longsword is a noble weapon for swordfighting and a quick way to send any fool to the other side.

name: Smugglers's map
description: A map I found on a dead smuggler in the Kuttenberg underground.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Dried valerian
description: To be found on forest paths\, in mires and peat bogs and everywhere that ground is damp.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Wreath
description: A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days\, such as the wedding day.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Ancient moonshine
description: A bottle of moonshine that's been hidden in the caves beneath Trosky since the castle was built. It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Lord Polner heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Smoked perch
description: Perch or other fish are healthy\, you should eat a lot of them. You can season fish with spices and coat it in flour. Then fry it in butter. Finally\, sprinkle it generously with fried onion and serve with bread.

name: Smoked hare meat
description: Hare meat is tender\, tasty and healthy. Only hares aren't very big\, so it might not fill your belly.

name: Ius regale montanorum II
description: An abridged copy of the Royal Mining Law on Courts.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Eyebright
description: Grows on pastures and heaths and in all places where there is light enough\, as well as wet ground.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Dried apple
description: Nothing special\, but at least it will not spoil.

name: Steel skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Rare book from Sedletz
description: A precious volume that the customs collector Matthew stole from the Sedletz monastery.

name: Lords of Semine knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Short chainmail
description: Shortened chainmail shirt with long sleeves.

name: Guild Longsword
description: The guild longsword is a magnificent weapon crafted to celebrate the founding of the Kuttenberg swordfighting brotherhood. It was subsequently adopted as their emblem. The master swordsman\, who leads the brotherhood\, wears it at his side only on ceremonial occasions. Most of the time\, it adorns the great hall of the Kuttenberg swordfighting house.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Voulge
description: A polearm commonly used by foot soldiers. A virtuous knight would not touch such a weapon\, but for a city patrol it is an invaluable tool for establishing order and respect in even the most crime-ridden places.

name: Noble's bascinet
description: A helmet with a klappvisor in a fashionable round pattern. It is much better adapted to the face\, so it is easier to breathe and the knight has a better view to the sides through the folded visors.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Key to the Sedletz mortuary
description: A rusty key to the Sedletz mortuary.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Sack of scrap
description: Lots of indispensable and undoubtedly necessary things in one place.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Ginger
description: You won't find this exceedingly rare plant anywhere else but in the apothecary.

name: Grimey skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Blacksmith's hammer
description: If a blacksmith doesn't have a hammer\, the first thing he must forge is a hammer\, but...

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Recipe for Lion perfume
description: A strong but short-lasting perfume. Substantially increases charisma for short periods\, but reduces charisma if combined with another perfume.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Training longsword
description: A wooden longsword that can bruise but not kill. For those who are serious about swordsmanship\, this is an invaluable tool for practicing.

name: Poppy
description: It is found abundantly in fields and furrows as a bothersome weed.

name: Commemorative coin
description: A dirty and worn-out grosch that someone hid for luck in the foundations of the building.

name: Stinky hat
description: A hat that smells really bad. I don't know what happened to it at the celebration\, and I don't want to know. I'll never put it on my head.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Roasted piglet
description: A piglet roasted on a spit. Fat helps when you get drunk.

name: Apple
description: An apple a day keeps the apothecary away. It's not terribly nutritious\, but stays fresh a long time.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Herring
description: Herring can be smoked\, roasted\, pickled or boiled. It's very tasty\, but one of the boniest fish there are.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Unbalanced die
description: A playing die someone tried to load to his advantage\, but didn't do a very good job.

name: Dried dog meat
description: When the damned mutt just won't stop barking… Not for the faint of heart.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Smoked cheese
description: Smoked cheese never gets old\, whether it's made from cow or sheep milk.

name: Beggar's coat
description: A beggar's overcoat is all patch and almost falling apart. Still\, in a pinch\, it's better than nothing.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Thieves' notes
description: A parchment with drawings of thieves' symbols and explanatory notes.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Golden initial brooch
description: Try putting a beautiful brooch like this on a beggar's skirt and you'll be thrown straight into the jail. You could be king and no one would believe it belongs to you. Clothes make the man\, as Lord Capon and I already know.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Skalitz axe
description: An axe made by the skilful hands of a blacksmith in Skalitz\, it always seems to find its way to the one who drinks the most.

name: Sharpshooter's bolt
description: A balanced bolt with good range and high accuracy.

name: Pitchfork
description: If nothing better is at hand\, at least this will do. A simple but effective tool\, which is as good for pitching hay as it is at stabbing the enemy where the sun don't shine.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Dried perch
description: Perch or other fish are healthy\, you should eat a lot of them. You can season fish with spices and coat it in flour. Then fry it in butter. Finally\, sprinkle it generously with fried onion and serve with bread.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Lambskin shoes
description: Shoes made of the finest lambskin leather\, belonging to the wife of Captain Frenzl of Suchdol.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Old tunic
description: A dark faded tunic. Once dressed\, the wearer becomes invisible... but more likely\, no one will want to look at him.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Gamekeeper's letter
description: A nostalgic letter from the former gamekeeper to Peter of Pisek.

name: Letter from Sigismund
description: A short personal letter from Sigismund.

name: Wine for Capon
description: Good red wine for Lord Capon. The road to Nebakov will be long and one's throat can dry up during the siege of the castle.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Longsword Absolver
description: A beautiful and at first sight excellent long sword. Such a weapon is guaranteed to attract a crowd of scoundrels.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Teachings of Peter Waldo
description: A skill book on Scholarship.

name: Short gambeson
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Nuremberg gauntlets
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmiths. Finger gloves of hourglass shape made with metal decoration and brass lining.

name: Jewish hat
description: A pointed yellow hat\, also called a Judenhut\, is a strange and hard to miss head covering for Jewish men.

name: Scaled skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Products of Skilled Hands IV
description: A skill book on Craftsmanship. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: The Kingdom of Bohemia
description: A brief history of the Kingdom of Bohemia.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Tied jester's hose
description: These colourful trousers are worn by jesters and generally eccentric people. The higher quality suggests that whoever had them made was very serious about their insouciance.

name: Hand wrap
description: A hand wrap is a strip of cloth wrapped securely around the wrist\, palm and base of the thumb. It helps to protect the hand and wrist against injuries caused by blows\, serving both to keep the joints aligned and to compress and lend strength to the soft tissues of the hand during a fist strike.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Oakgall ink
description: Dark liquid made from crushed oak galls and gum Arabic\, used for writing on parchment.

name: Bell-shaped kettle hat
description: The most common shape of kettle hat\, popular among the poor squires. It consists of two parts joined together by iron rivets\, and therefore isn't as expensive as a helmet forged from a single piece.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Brocade
description: You won't believe it\, but brocade and broccoli have a common basis in the Latin word broccus - pointed. Why? Nobody really knows.

name: Sheep ear
description: An ear from a lost sheep\, which the shepherd Smoliek needs as proof that he did not sell it.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Rose hip wine
description: Grapes of wine growing on a rose bush! Tastes miraculously and increases your health!

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Cream
description: Cream has always been a luxurious additive to sauces\, whether sweet or savoury.

name: Bandit's treasure map
description: I've seen this map before...

name: Painter's Guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The three bowls of paint are a well-known symbol of the Kuttenberg painters who decorated knights' shields and painted the frescoes in the royal palace.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Couters
description: Simple elbow pads. You can suffer all sorts of injuries in combat\, so it's best to protect yourself however you can.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Alchemist's key
description: A key I found on a weird alchemist hiding in the ruins of the Rabstein fortress.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Tied jester's hose
description: These colourful trousers are worn by jesters and generally eccentric people. The higher quality suggests that whoever had them made was very serious about their insouciance.

name: Key to the Cellar of All Saints' tavern.
description: The key to the cellar of the All Saints tavern.

name: Drinking water
description: Drinking water in a skin.

name: Fechthalle key
description: Key to the Fechthalle.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Wine
description: House wine.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Old hideout map
description: A map disclosing the location of the secret store of Innkeeper Beikovetz's former band of thieves.

name: Stinking perfume
description: Its smell makes your toes curl.

name: Bonnet
description: The tied cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Noble's pouch
description: Pouches can be worn on the belt and usually hold small items such as food\, bandages or potions\, which are then more quickly available when one wants to use them.

name: Knight's pouch
description: Pouches can be worn on the belt and usually hold small items such as food\, bandages or potions\, which are then more quickly available when one wants to use them.

name: Hunter's pouch
description: Pouches can be worn on the belt and usually hold small items such as food\, bandages or potions\, which are then more quickly available when one wants to use them.

name: Wanderer's pouch
description: Pouches can be worn on the belt and usually hold small items such as food\, bandages or potions\, which are then more quickly available when one wants to use them.

name: Osina's key
description: Key to blacksmith Osina's chest.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Bonnet
description: The tied cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Silver swap-out badge
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>reroll a die of your choosing</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Golden cross ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. The poor man should be careful not to get a noose for selling it.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Old Town of Prague knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Horseman's pick
description: The horseman's pick is a light riding axe with a spike. Used correctly\, it's a good friend in a pinch. Its sharp point can cut through armour\, its blade through any shield.

name: Brunswick's map I
description: A map leading to part of Brunswick's armour.

name: Hungarian pavese
description: A cavalry pavese with Hungarian symbols.

name: Scorched key
description: The key I found clutched tightly in the hand of a skeleton inside a burnt-out house in Opatowitz.

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Guisarme
description: An excellent long weapon for infantry and anyone who prefers to keep their opponent at bay. The secret of its true power is hidden in the tight formation of the trained men who\, with its help\, can resist even a charge of knightly cavalry.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Jewish hat
description: A pointed yellow hat\, also called a Judenhut\, is a strange and hard to miss head covering for Jewish men.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Seneschal Ambrose's decree
description: An appointment decree of Knight Ambrose to the honourable role of the Seneschal of the Knights of the Cross with the Red Star with the seal of the Grand Master.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Plain laminar gauntlets
description: Simple arm and forearm armour composed of individual lamellae supplemented with elbow guards called couters.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Kuttenberg oath book
description: One of the copies of the oath book from the Kuttenberg town hall. It records the oaths of the councillors and town officials.

name: Village hazel bow
description: A homemade weak bow made of hazel wood. It's not very strong or accurate\, but it'll do for a rabbit or a fox.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Marathon IV
description: A skill book on Vitality. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Silver brooch
description: Why do people succumb to vanity? Man should think more of his salvation than of earthly goods. Especially when there are people who need them more than he does.

name: Smoked venison
description: Well smoked venison tastes great\, you just need to use the right kind of wood.

name: Suchdol pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek\, owner of the Suchdol fortress.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Rowel spurs
description: Riding spurs\, also called rowels\, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal\, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.

name: Ambrose's cross
description: A small wooden cross carved by the old hermit Ambrose.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Emmeram's hunting sword
description: An excellent hunting sword of the master butcher Emmeram from Kuttenberg.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Mathematician's die
description: A die loaded based on the work of a forgotten mathematician. It may be better suited to solving equations than playing dice.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Old key
description: A key I found lying around near the closed mine. And what could it be for?

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Butcher guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The axe was awarded to the czech butchers by king John of Luxembourg\, because they opened the gates of Prague for him with their axes. From there\, the Kuttenberg Butchers' Guild also adopted this symbol.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Vojta's scarf
description: This yellowed rag which smells of sweat and fish\, is probably used by Vojta as a scarf.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Pinot Grigio 1401
description: It has a nice golden colour\, but the taste is not all that impressive. It's more of an average vintage.

name: Book on the nobility of the bow
description: A book by the noble Ctirad of Loretz on why the crossbow will never replace the bow. Can be read from level 10 of the Marksmanship skill.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Mended cuirass
description: This cuirass has been in a fight before... and not for the first time. Battered\, full of patches\, but still a piece of metal that can make the difference between life and death for an unheralded warrior.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Monastic Rule of Saint Benedict I
description: On monastic obedience and the monastic abbot.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Soaked map
description: A soaked map\, completely illegible. This won't be leading me anywhere.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Short butcher apron
description: A short linen tunic complete with a butcher's apron.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Sketch – Carpenter's axe
description: Heavy work axe used by carpenters for working beams. If there's no better weapon at hand\, it can become a tool of revenge.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Enhanced wounding arrow
description: A well-balanced arrow with a serrated arrowhead to increase damage and bleeding.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Hand wrap
description: A hand wrap is a strip of cloth wrapped securely around the wrist\, palm and base of the thumb. It helps to protect the hand and wrist against injuries caused by blows\, serving both to keep the joints aligned and to compress and lend strength to the soft tissues of the hand during a fist strike.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: The Rule of St. Dismas IV
description: A skill book on Thievery. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Silver warlord's badge
description: Using this badge will grant you <strong>50% more points</strong> this round. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: On the Adamites or Naked Worshippers
description: About the Adamite sect and their unpleasant end.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Real documents about Anna of Waldstein
description: Documents proving the questionable dealings of Lady Anna of Waldstein.

name: Deer rump
description: Delicious hind leg meat. The topside cut makes for the best roast. Dice the rest and boil it in salted water. Now to make a good sauce to go with it\, crumble some bread in beer\, add a little vinegar and cook it with some pepper and cloves\, if you have them. Pour the sauce on top of the cooked venison and garnish with baked apples. This is how Severin the Younger advises deer to be prepared.

name: On Saint Wilgefortis
description: On Saint Wilgefortis or Starosta.

name: Smoked beef tenderloin
description: Great meat suitable for many dishes. It is best served with a white cream sauce.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Chamomile decoction recipe
description: Sleep heals you faster and if good quality\, Energy replenishes faster while sleeping.

name: Bacon
description: Fine smoked bacon\, filling and pleasing.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Janosh's sausage
description: Janosh's homemade sausage\, thoroughly smoked and properly seasoned. You don't want to know what it's made of.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: On the Cumans
description: A book on the Cumans.

name: Gemstone ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get a noose for selling it.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Sketch – Falchion
description: An older cousin of the broad-bladed sword. A somewhat outdated weapon for some\, perhaps\, but there's nothing like tried and tested methods on the battlefield.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Straw hat with ribbon
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. Decorated with a ribbon\, such headgear certainly looks more cheerful.

name: The Art of Demosthenes III
description: A skill book on Speech. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Hidden valuables
description: Valuables that someone from Bohunowitz hid in a pigeon coop.

name: Treasure Map - Third
description: It leads a man to what he most desires. That is\, if he most desires treasure…

name: Piercing bolt
description: A bolt capable of piercing a variety of armours.

name: Armourer's kit
description: A set of tools for repairing metal parts of armour\, chainmail and quilted armour pieces. Includes a hammer\, pliers\, twine and some replacement chainmail and oil.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Riding boots - high
description: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process\, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle\, such as messengers and grooms.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Cuman helmet with a mask
description: A foreign pointed helmet with a visor in the form of an iron mask. Cumans are said to have adopted it from wild nomads called Kipchaks\, who are said to drink mare's milk from buffalo horns and live far out on the eastern steppes. The face with moustache perhaps represents some mythical progenitor of all these nomads.

name: Bag of Holy nails
description: This bag allegedly contains nails from Saint Peter's cross\, and perhaps even Christ's!

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Poacher's hunting knife
description: A hunting knife\, which the poacher from Slatego had in his possession. Evidence for the huntsman. A dog may be able to sniff out its owner's encampment.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Short butcher apron
description: A short linen tunic complete with a butcher's apron.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Kyiv helmet
description: A foreign helmet of a peculiar shape originating from the eastern steppes\, worn by the Cuman horsemen. It is feared because it is associated with raiders who have burned many villages.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Innkeeper Havel's ledgers
description: Records of movements\, purchases and sales of goods at The Emperor Charles tavern.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Nuremberg gauntlets
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmiths. Finger gloves of hourglass shape made with metal decoration and brass lining.

name: Poacher's gear from Lower Semine
description: Equipment of the poachers from their camp in Lower Semine. Evidence for the huntsman.

name: Wreath
description: Wreath of meadow flowers. It looks nice\, it smells nice\, but it doesn't last very long. Plus\, it can attract bees.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Thunderstone
description: A finely polished stone of dark colour\, endowed with magical powers. It's said to bring good luck and protect from all evil.

name: Kuttenberg bread
description: Stay well fed\, eat Kuttenberg bread.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Milanese plate leg armour
description: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge\, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.

name: Chicken
description: A dead chicken… it looks a little reproachful. To soothe your hunger and lift your spirits with a good meal\, roast a young chicken. Then boil some bread in red wine with parsley\, sage\, mint and lavender. Strain this sauce through a cloth and pour it over the roasted chicken. Finally\, sprinkle it lightly with cinnamon or ginger.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Smoked salami
description: Spicy smoked salami. It smells great and tastes even better.

name: Knight's contract
description: The contract between the Knight Taras Mura and Father Richard from Old Kutna.

name: Noble's plate legs
description: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability\, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Istvan's chaperon
description: A black chaperon whose owner I sent straight to Hell. Someone left it on the spot Istvan landed.

name: Florian's unfinished letter
description: Knight Florian's unfinished poem for an unknown lady.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Mail coif
description: This is a unique clothing asset for an important character. If you got it in game\, report it!

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Knights of the Cross hood
description: A hood with the emblem of the famous Order of the Knights of the cross.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Black arrow
description: An arrow with black crow feathers.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Dried deer ribs
description: Best to make a roast out of it and serve it with a fruit sauce. However\, make sure to bake it just long enough and be careful not to dry out the meat too much.

name: Lords of Holohlavy heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Hugo's die
description: A die of the most loyal regular at the Hole. It bears his likeness.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Milanese cuirass
description: An excellent piece from the Italian armoursmiths. Thanks to the perfect tempering and fine surface cannulation\, the sheet metal used can be much lighter and yet just as durable. The cuirass is composed of two parts that fit together perfectly to form an impenetrable shell on the knight's body.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Lost Charter for King Sigismund
description: A letter sent by the Praguers to King Sigismund containing their agreement.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Milanese plate leg armour
description: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge\, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Lucky die
description: When fortune smiles on you\, smile back. Otherwise you'll look suspicious

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Plate knight gauntlets
description: Better hand protection is a must in combat because as they say: hands go first in any fight.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Mended cuirass
description: This cuirass has been in a fight before... and not for the first time. Battered\, full of patches\, but still a piece of metal that can make the difference between life and death for an unheralded warrior.

name: Wagoner's die
description: According to legend\, this die belonged to the famous Roman charioteer Arnuldus\, whose tactics consisted of tiring his opponents or lulling them to sleep.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Watermelon
description: Watermelon\, the biggest berry to be found in the Holy Roman Empire.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Zdena's ring
description: A ring I found on the deceased Zdena. I don't recognise the family crest on it.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Footpad's bow
description: A footpad's bow is shrouded in mystery\, but there is no doubt that it is intended for hunting villagers and less well-equipped merchants.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Reinforced sword guard
description: A cross guard\, also known as quillon. It serves to protect the swordsman's hands from the opponent's blade. It can also be used to execute a grappling hold or strike to an unprotected face. In sword making\, it is put on the blade's tail before the hilt is made and the pommel is put on. In cheap weapons made by poor blacksmiths\, it will loosen over time and begin to clink unpleasantly.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Gold ring from Margaret
description: A gold ring that Margaret gave me as a pledge. It originally belonged to her mother.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Women's brooche
description: It's the way of the world that clothes and especially jewellery make the woman. And how many slaps have been given cause of women's pride and men's vanity!

name: Wide straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: How Good Mead is Brewed
description: How Good Mead is Brewed in home conditions

name: Bavarian plate legs
description: A leg protection consisting of forged plates of sheet metal suitably fit together. Such armour protects the warrior's entire leg\, but its weight depends on the craftsmanship of the maker.

name: Glass container
description: A strange little bottle made of coloured glass\, the kind that is definitely not made anywhere nowadays. It's probably a very old object\, but it's hard to say where it came from.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Recipe for Mintha perfume
description: A weak but long-lasting perfume. Slightly increases Charisma for a long period\, but reduces Charisma if used with another perfume.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Wide straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Life in the Saddle IV
description: A skill book on Horsemanship. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Smoked pork tenderloin
description: Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat\, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water\, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion\, add wine\, vinegar\, juniper\, caraway\, cloves\, pepper\, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil\, add the meat\, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time\, while basting with wine.

name: Prague letter to King Sigismund
description: A letter sent by the Praguers to King Sigismund containing their agreement.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Dried chicken
description: If you find out someone killed all the chickens in your backyard\, the only thing you can do is make jerky.

name: Forgotten contract
description: An important-looking document\, signed by a number of people\, yet someone simply left it here.

name: Von Bergow knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Roe deer meat
description: Good red meat\, not as prized as deer\, but not everyone can tell them apart. Prepare it the same way you would any other venison. If you have both deer and roe meat\, cut up the roe meat into sauce and cook it\, roast the deer meat on the fire.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Spearman Training IV
description: A skill book on Polearm combat. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Parchment with drawings
description: A crumpled parchment with strange symbols drawn on it.

name: Sketch – Work axe
description: Lightweight axe designed for work in the woods or on the farm. An invaluable tool for all woodcutters\, but also for angry people who don't have a better weapon at hand.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Magdeburg plate arms
description: Protection of the whole arm and forearm by precisely fitted metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass and artistic ornaments.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Marksman's bolt
description: A bolt with great range and high accuracy.

name: Gold doppelganger badge
description: Using this badge will double the point value of your last throw. Can be use <strong>three times per game</strong>.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: City of Prague heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Sad Greaser's die
description: A blue die mirroring the sadness of its original owner.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Work axe
description: Lightweight axe designed for work in the woods or on the farm. An invaluable tool for all woodcutters\, but also for angry people who don't have a better weapon at hand.

name: Coin sword pommel
description: The end of the hilt of the sword. It is struck against an iron tang\, which is then hammered and the pommel is thus fixed. It serves mainly to balance the whole weapon and as a counterweight to the long blade. In swordfighting\, it prevents the weapon from slipping out of the hand\, but it can also be used to grip and extend the hilt of the sword. Some swordfighting techniques use the pommel to deliver crushing blows to the opponent's face.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Effects of Grasses and Herbs
description: Various ailments and their herbal treatment.

name: Frilled colourful dress
description: A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.

name: Master Menhart's longsword
description: Long sword of the swordmaster Menhart from Frankfurt. According to his own words\, he received it from his teacher the day he became a sword master. The weapon itself honours both the bearer and the maker. Truly a masterpiece!

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Zizka's chalice
description: A chalice from some sort of bandit expedition. It seems to have a sentimental value for Zizka.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: White feathers
description: You shouldn't brag about your own feathers\, but this isn't mine. On the other hand\, who would I brag to?

name: Smoked beef
description: This is how you make meat dumplings. Finely chop your beef\, or better yet\, crush it in a mortar\, if you have one. Add the parsley\, egg and salt\, knead well and add some flour for thickening. Then artfully form the dumplings and fry them in lard.

name: Magic arrowhead
description: The magic arrowhead from Karel the Arrow's head.

name: Cooked boar rump
description: You can serve boar leg with rosehip sauce or cabbage\, but never cook it the same way twice in a row.

name: Moonshine recipe
description: Henry's home-brewed moonshine. A strong drink that is sure to put you in a good mood.

name: Tall kettle hat
