description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Dried roe deer meat
description: The best thing to eat while staring into the fire in the evening.

name: Knight's axe
description: A knight's battle axe. A dexterous weapon that can pierce good armour or crush the bones underneath with its spike. It also has a pointed tip to finish off tougher opponents.

name: Poleyn
description: Simple knee pads that can be part of full armour. They are most often worn separately by those who cannot afford more expensive armour or who would be unnecessarily restricted in their movement by it.

name: The Tale of Melusine II
description: The second part of the Luxembourg legend of the fairy Melusine.

name: Ordinary coat with crest
description: A plain coat\, made in red and white and decorated with symbols of Kuttenberg.

name: Nuremberg bascinet
description: A helmet with a german klappvisor is an example of the highest armourer's art. It is easy to breathe in and through the widened visors it is much easier to see to the sides.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Maleshov fortress key
description: Key to the entrance of the great tower at Maleshov fortress.

name: Smoked wolf meat
description: Only eat wolf meat in an emergency and always keep it in flames for a long time beforehand so that all the evil is burned away. Also\, you must never eat too much of it\, for then you may become afflicted by a bad disease or a cruel curse.

name: Red tournament shield
description: Shield made for the Kuttenberg tournament. Compared to a regular shield it is considerably lighter\, which is of course compensated by its durability.

name: Sauerkraut
description: Well-aged sauerkraut can cure any ailment. It is said that those who eat it regularly will avoid all kinds of diseases\, including the plague.

name: Saxon bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor of an older drop-shaped pattern. The helmet is fitted with a wide chainmail aventail\, so it protects the whole head and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Wreath
description: A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days\, such as the wedding day.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: A peculiar poem
description: Will it lead me to the Holy Grail?

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Apple
description: An apple a day keeps the apothecary away. It's not terribly nutritious\, but stays fresh a long time.

name: The Czech Campaign to Lombardy II
description: The second part of the glorious deeds that the Czech wariors distinguished themselves with by Milan.

name: Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
description: A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.

name: Trosky pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord von Bergow\, owner of Trosky Castle.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Lords of Nebakov kite shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Poleyn
description: Simple knee pads that can be part of full armour. They are most often worn separately by those who cannot afford more expensive armour or who would be unnecessarily restricted in their movement by it.

name: Nest key
description: I found this key not far from the Lower Semine mill in a nest in a clearing.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Old bones
description: The old bones of Ambrose's dead brother John.

name: Battle longsword
description: A heavier long blade will last longer and won't break easily\, but it must be balanced by a much larger pommel. This sword is designed for actual battle rather than a quick sword fight.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Hairpin of bone
description: It would certainly adorn any hair\, be it ravishing raven\, velvety auburn\, angelically fair or suspiciously red.

name: Sketch – Broadsword
description: A light sword with a wide blade and a thin tip\, it stings like a wasp sting.

name: Cooked lepiota
description: Cooked lepiota has a delicate taste and is used by the poor to substitute meat.

name: Key from chest by Sedletz
description: A key that someone keeps in a chest by the front wall of Sedletz Monastery.

name: Kuttenberg knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Cautious cheater's die
description: A die modified by an expert. It is precisely loaded\, but also inconspicuous.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Flea-ridden blanket
description: A dirty blanket full of fleas. Great for infesting a bathhouse.

name: Hand wrap
description: A hand wrap is a strip of cloth wrapped securely around the wrist\, palm and base of the thumb. It helps to protect the hand and wrist against injuries caused by blows\, serving both to keep the joints aligned and to compress and lend strength to the soft tissues of the hand during a fist strike.

name: Dirty hood
description: A hood left at the bathhouse by a drunk.

name: On the Composition of Alchemy IV
description: A skill book on Alchemy. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Hounskull bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor. It has been pejoratively nicknamed the dog's snout because of its strange shape\, but it is easier to breathe in it and is more durable than its older models.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Peach
description: A juicy sweet fruit with a fine fuzz that makes many a young man feel amorous.

name: Crayfish
description: You can make crayfish soup as follows. Boil it in boiling water\, remove the claws and tail and take the meat out of them. Crack the shell\, add butter\, set the pot on the fire and let it simmer. When the dish turns red\, strain it through a cloth and make it into a soup or a sauce; finally\, add the meat you took out earlier.

name: Gold Emperor's badge
description: Using this badge\, you will gain <strong>triple points</strong> for every <strong>1+1+1</strong> dice combination. Emperor's don't lose.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Nail fragment relic
description: A tiny fragment of St Catherine's fingernail wrapped in embroidered linen. Princess Catherine of Egypt was martyred by the Roman Emperor for her unwavering faith in Christ. It was a terrible torture. The martyr was tied between two spiked wheels and torn alive. But God intervened and destroyed the hideous machine\, and Catherine had to be beheaded with a sword. The pious Emperor Charles IV enforced the feast of this martyr in the Bohemian kingdom because he believed she had helped him turn the hopeless course of the Battle of San Felice into a glorious victory.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Moonshine
description: Strong alcoholic drink. Watch out for the hangover!

name: Reforged Radzig Kobyla's sword
description: A sword forged by my father for Sir Radzig Kobyla\, which was later stolen by that scoundrel Istvan Toth.

name: Wanderer's robe
description: An overcoat is made of thicker fabric and is designed for long journeys in bad weather. It is recommended by nine out of ten wanderers who have reached their destination.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Rounded pewter jug
description: Drinks served from pewter dishes taste a little strange\, but the pitcher sparkles and that's all that matters!

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Potion for little Otto
description: A potion found in the cradle in von Bergow's chamber. What will his sons grow up to be when he pours them this?

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Spined kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal and therefore slightly more durable\, but still unnecessarily heavy. Its spin makes it better able to withstand blows to the head\, but it needs to be supplemented with a quilted hood or collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's cheeks or neck on its own.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Page with nursery rhyme
description: A page torn from a book. There's an unusual rhyme written on it.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Wine seedlings
description: Young grapevine seedlings from the monastery garden. It smells pretty good. I wonder how does such a seedling taste like?

name: Saxon Hauberk
description: A long chainmail shirt with short sleeves covering only the arms of its wearer.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Couters with rondel
description: Simple elbow pads with round rondels. Unless one can afford better armour\, every protection counts.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Cracklings
description: What could be better than freshly roasted pork cracklings? Especially with a tankard of ale.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Gunsmith's kit
description: A set of tools for maintaining firearms\, mainly cleaning the barrel as there's not much else you can do with it.

name: Master's handgonne
description: A handgonne is a firearm that uses gunpowder to shoot small pieces of metal or stone. A thick metal barrel with a handle is attached to a wooden stock\, similar to a spear\, for example. Fire through the powder stopper detonates the main charge in the barrel and shoots the projectile out. It is fired by a lit cord\, a red-hot iron wire or in a worst case scenario\, a burning stick. This handgonne has a barrel forged from iron and is therefore less durable than those cast from bronze. Any living being hit with this weapon is sure to no longer be living.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Cooked blue crayfish
description: Cooked blue crayfish. The healthiest thing you can eat.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: The overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the noblemen's subjects and the army\, is decorated with the coat of arms of the Lord von Bergow.

name: A book of humourous anecdotes.
description: Gold decorated book in red leather. Rosa Ruthard asked me to bring her this book from the Maleshov fortress.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Worn rosary
description: One of the most common types of counter. It doesn't count money\, but something quite different.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Roasted peas
description: A tasty humble dish of pre-sprouted roasted or baked peas.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: New test arrow
description: Placeholder weapons. If you see this in game\, report it!

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Valerian
description: To be found on forest paths\, in mires and peat bogs and everywhere that ground is damp.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: The Rule of St. Dismas II
description: A skill book on Thievery. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Katherine's shoe
description: I wonder where the other one is?

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Excerpt from wedding contract
description: Another excerpt from the draft of the wedding contract between Lord Semine and Bailiff Thrush.

name: Axe from Skalitz stub
description: This axe is done choping. First Kunesh\, then Jezhek. The chain of unfortunate fate is broken with you.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Cooked apple
description: They say an apple a day keeps the sawbones away. When you boil them it makes for a tasty treat.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Smoked sausage
description: A sausage slowly smoked in beechwood.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Dried venison
description: It will last a long time\, and it will be also easier to hide from the suspicious gaze of the huntsman.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Quark kolach
description: For those who aren't fans of poppy seeds or nuts\, a quark kolach is the best of all.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Plums
description: Delicious fruit with fragrant flesh. Watch out for the sharp pit inside!

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Jester's disguise
description: A colourful coat decorated with jingle bells and an equally colourful jester's hood are worn by the minstrels in an attempt to attract the audience's attention. Be careful not to burst out laughing.

name: Frilled veil
description: Veils\, or also veils or shawls belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Sketch – Common sabre
description: An unusual curved blade used by nomads on fast horses in the middle of the Hungarian steppes and the remote Arabian deserts. It can be swift and excellent for offense and defense. Every good Christian should beware of losing his head to such a weapon.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Bell-shaped bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet protecting the whole head except the face\, so it looks a bit like a bell. Very often used by marksmen because the face is not covered by any visor and it is easy to see the target.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Human skull
description: Dust you are and to dust you shall return. The skull serves as a reminder of the transience of human life.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Sketch – Farmer's horseshoes
description: A blacksmith's horseshoe sketch. Because every master had to start somehow.

name: Miners' crossbow
description: A beautifully decorated and masterfully made crossbow for the traditional popinjay competition. Everyone would love to have one\, but this one is mine now.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Mushroom picker's knife
description: Lost and found again.

name: Dried sage
description: Can be found in pastures and on hillsides.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Scratched message
description: A piece of parchment with a message full of despair.

name: Raven feathers
description: You shouldn't brag about your own feathers\, but this isn't mine. On the other hand\, who would I brag to?

name: Key to Musa's chest
description: Key to Musa's chest in the military camp.

name: Praguers' hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Hauberk long
description: A long\, chainmail shirt with sleeves covering the arms and forearms.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Smoked boar tenderloin
description: A prime piece of a boar meat\, juicy and tasty. Prague burgher Havel of Silberstein liked it very much and used to prepare it in a special way called wild boar on venison.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Bowman's Brew recipe
description: Improves your Archery skill and\, if good quality\, reduces loss of Stamina while aiming.

name: Skull Crushers II
description: A skill book on Heavy Weapons combat. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Beggar's coat
description: A beggar's overcoat is all patch and almost falling apart. Still\, in a pinch\, it's better than nothing.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Strange dragon bone
description: This is supposed to be a piece of a dragon\, but I'm not sure which part this bone comes from.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Tournament longsword
description: A longsword for swordmasters is a noble and damn dangerous weapon. Like the tongue of a viper\, it can cut the thread of life in an instant. This blade is designed primarily for tournaments\, but in a more fierce battle it could quickly come to naught.

name: Cheater's noose
description: Fortune spins around and you're once down - once up. Once you win big at dice\, and then at the end of the rope you'll hang ignominiously.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Composite kettle hat
description: A simple kettle hat composed of several pieces of plate. It protects especially against blows from above and therefore it is good to wear it together with a padded coif or a full collar. The advantage is certainly its lower price.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Beggar's coat
description: A beggar's overcoat is all patch and almost falling apart. Still\, in a pinch\, it's better than nothing.

name: Herb Paris
description: It may be sought in deep woods.

name: Crusader cloak
description: Brand new cloak with the Crusader's Red Cross symbol. It was only recently buried in the ground\, unlike the rest of the old papers.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Knight's notes III
description: Notes of the knight Taras Mura\, found in the mines near Old Kutna.

name: Silver cross with insignia
description: A decorated cross is made from silver\, but one can certainly pray without precious ornaments.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Fried snow
description: This delicacy has great sentimental value.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Pear
description: The pear is a symbol of generosity\, goodness and modesty. On top of all that\, it tastes great too.

name: Map from chest by Sedletz
description: A map I found in a chest beneath the wall of Sedletz monastery.

name: Decorative pins
description: A pin here\, a pin there...

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Guild Longsword
description: The guild longsword is a magnificent weapon crafted to celebrate the founding of the Kuttenberg swordfighting brotherhood. It was subsequently adopted as their emblem. The master swordsman\, who leads the brotherhood\, wears it at his side only on ceremonial occasions. Most of the time\, it adorns the great hall of the Kuttenberg swordfighting house.

name: Blacksmith's defender
description: Although it looks quite ordinary\, this sword is well forged and perfectly balanced. This is the kind of weapon a blacksmith makes for battle\, not for show.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Dried hare meat
description: There's even less of that little bunny now\, but at least it won't spoil so fast.

name: Horse hide
description: Horsehide is known for its good tensile strength yet considerable softness. It is commonly used to make halters\, bridles\, belts or even saddles and saddlebags.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Milanese gauntlets
description: Fingered gauntlets in a typical hourglass shape. The individual fingers are protect a series of folded iron slats.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Father Dietrich's rosary
description: It is said that the priest once survived several days alone in the wilderness\, to face pagan superstitions with his faith. This very rosary helped him overcome fear and find light even in the darkest moments.

name: Cooked deer ribs
description: Best to make a roast out of it and serve it with a fruit sauce. However\, make sure to bake it just long enough and be careful not to dry out the meat too much.

name: Bell-shaped kettle hat
description: The most common shape of kettle hat\, popular among the poor squires. It consists of two parts joined together by iron rivets\, and therefore isn't as expensive as a helmet forged from a single piece.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Mended cuirass
description: This cuirass has been in a fight before... and not for the first time. Battered\, full of patches\, but still a piece of metal that can make the difference between life and death for an unheralded warrior.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Half plate legs
description: Partial leg protection\, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who\, for some reason\, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea\, though.

name: Monastic Rule of Saint Benedict II
description: On Monastic Obedience and the Monastry Abbot.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Dry Devil's longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Kolda's axe
description: Lightweight axe designed for work in the woods or on the farm. An invaluable tool for all woodcutters\, but also for angry people who don't have a better weapon at hand.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Weak Lullaby potion
description: Reduces Energy to 0 and decreases perception.

name: Skull Crushers III
description: A skill book on Heavy Weapons combat. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Noble's bascinet
description: A helmet with a klappvisor in a fashionable round pattern. It is much better adapted to the face\, so it is easier to breathe and the knight has a better view to the sides through the folded visors.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Salami
description: Spiced salami. Smells great and tastes even better.

name: Sack of waste
description: A lot of indispensable and undoubtedly necessary things in one place.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Kuttenberg market book
description: One of the copies of the market book from the Kuttenberg Town Hall. It contains a list of markets and regulations for merchants.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Footpad's hideout map
description: A map of the old hideout of Innkeeper Beikovetz's disbanded gang of robbers.

name: Recipe for Marigold decoction
description: Gradually heals part of your health. Helps against hangover\, or cures it immediately if good quality.

name: Demon droppings
description: Are these actually demon droppings or just ordinary charcoal?

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Saint Antiochus' die
description: The Saint Antiochus' die always rolls a 3. Not 2. And especially not 4.

name: Recipe for Nighthawk Potion
description: You will see better in the dark and your Energy will deplete slower or if good quality\, not at all.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: City of Prague pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Cobweb
description: An essential building feature of every human dwelling and a source of food for spiders and some magical elixirs.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Weeds
description: That crap grows everywhere\, especially where it's not supposed to.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: The Rule of St. Dismas I
description: A skill book on Thievery.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Milanese cuirass
description: An excellent piece from the Italian armoursmiths. Thanks to the perfect tempering and fine surface cannulation\, the sheet metal used can be much lighter and yet just as durable. The cuirass is composed of two parts that fit together perfectly to form an impenetrable shell on the knight's body.

name: On the Prince Electors
description: About how the Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire is elected.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Nebakov jail key
description: The key to the jail at Nebakov Fortress.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: The Peculiar Siege of Prague
description: How Prague was besieged by several armies and how the siege was ended without any bloodshed whatsoever.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Scapular with insignia
description: A tiny pendant\, usually worn around the neck or wrapped around the wrist\, is associated with praising the Virgin Mary and other saints.

name: Beaked kettle hat
description: Iron hat with a wide brim. It covers the head well and at the same time\, thanks to conveniently placed cut-outs\, does not restrict the view\, which is an advantage especially for foot marksmen.

name: Lamp
description: They say it's darkest under a candlestick\, but have you ever seen the shadow this lamp casts?

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Scaled skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Plate knight gauntlets
description: Better hand protection is a must in combat because as they say: hands go first in any fight.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Praguers' riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Frankincense
description: It is often used in Christian ceremonies. Incense is mentioned back in the Bible and was used by the ancient Egyptians and later by the Romans. The smoke from this rare plant resin has a soothing effect on the human body\, but it can also lift the mood and surprisingly increase attention. Its smoke can make one very dizzy and make dreams seem real. This is also why frankincense is considered a rare magical raw material.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Silver badge of headstart
description: Use it to get a <strong>moderate point lead</strong> at the start of the game.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Punches\, Kicks and a Few Slaps IV
description: A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Master's Studies II
description: A skill book on Scholarship. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Ordinary Praguers' coat with crest
description: Plain red and white coat with the emblem of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Beef kidneys
description: Tasty and healthy. Fry them in fat or roast them on the fire. Just like with other offal\, you need to take care not to consume too much and too often. They also make for an excellent dog feed.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Leaf-shaped couters
description: Simple knee pads called couters with a leaf to improve protection against slashing blows.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Half plate legs
description: Partial leg protection\, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who\, for some reason\, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea\, though.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Cooked beef tenderloin
description: Great meat suitable for many dishes. It is best served with a white cream sauce.

name: Fork
description: Some still believe that the fork is the devil's invention and stick to the old tried and tested spoons.

name: Frikadelle
description: An unsightly mixture of meat and lead. Inedible.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Sword of Sir Valentine
description: A perfectly authentic replica of the sword with which the knight Valentine once accompanied the Abbot of Sedletz to the Holy Land.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Knacker's gloves
description: A gift from Ignatius the knacker. Gloves made of fine deerskin are flexible and retain feeling in the fingers\, making them perfect for grave digging or perhaps even thieving.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Sack of charcoal
description: A bag of supplies.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Hashtal's chest key
description: The key to a chest holding thieves' equipment.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Cooked pork
description: You can make a delicious pastry with pork. Salt the meat and boil it until tender. Slice apples\, add eggs and pepper\, add to the meat and continue cooking. Mix the flour with the wine\, add the eggs and cream\, put a little saffron on top\, and knead a good dough. Place the meat on top\, cover with the pastry and then bake until golden brown.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Cobblers' Guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The symbols of the kneipp and leather shoes are the emblem of the Kuttenberg guild of shoemakers and novices.

name: Passionate mushroom-picker's hood
description: As soon as you put the hood on\, the scent of mushrooms hits your nose. Or is it mould? Either way\, this hood has faithfully served many mushroom pickers before you. With it on your soldiers\, you're sure to know which mushrooms are a sensation to the taste buds and which will send you to an early grave.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Undigested bone
description: A human bone chopped with an axe.

name: Italian hauberk
description: Lightweight short chainmail shirt with shortsleeves.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Voivode's letter of safe conduct
description: A letter of safe conduct issued by Sigismund of Luxembourg himself\, giving the bearer the right of free movement and the privilege to judge his own subjects according to customary law\, not the law of the land.

name: Even die
description: A die loaded in favour of even numbers

name: Broad longsword
description: A perfectly balanced long sword with a wide blade is the gold standard. What it lacks in speed it makes up for in durability.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Key to the ruins of Slatego
description: The key to the door of the Slatego ruins\, where the gravedigger Ignatius has a trap for wild animals.

name: Hendl's chest key
description: The key to Hendl's chest.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Walnut kolach
description: Flour\, butter\, honey\, salt\, egg yolk\, cream\, walnuts… and the miracle is done. It just melts on the tongue\, tastes great whether hot or cold.

name: Cheap wine
description: A bitter young wine. Though it may not be the tastiest beverage\, it'll still wash away all your troubles.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Gall
description: A thick\, yellow to dark green fluid\, bitter to the taste\, that is formed in the liver\, whence it travels via the bile ducts to the small intestine\, where it takes part in the digestion process\, primarily by helping absorb fats. Suitable for mixing potions.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Composite kettle hat
description: A simple kettle hat composed of several pieces of plate. It protects especially against blows from above and therefore it is good to wear it together with a padded coif or a full collar. The advantage is certainly its lower price.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the military\, is decorated with the coat of arms of the Kingdom of Hungary.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Noble's bascinet
description: A helmet with a klappvisor in a fashionable round pattern. It is much better adapted to the face\, so it is easier to breathe and the knight has a better view to the sides through the folded visors.

name: Milanese plate leg armour
description: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge\, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.

name: Jester's disguise
description: A colourful coat decorated with jingle bells and an equally colourful jester's hood are worn by the minstrels in an attempt to attract the audience's attention. Be careful not to burst out laughing.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Old letter about the Order's commandery fire
description: An old letter to Seneschal Ambrose from a mysterious informer. It seems that Ambrose was once on the trail of a fire at the Order's commandery in the Old Town of Prague.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Dagger
description: The dagger is the knife's more dangerous cousin. Most of the time it's used for slicing cheese or apples\, however\, it comes in very handy if you need to creep up on someone and dispose of them without attracting attention.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Wisdom tooth die
description: A playing die made from a wisdom tooth.

name: Zinek's forged key
description: A copy of the key that opens the chest of stolen goods at the Troskowitz Rathaus.

name: Letter for Buresh
description: Letter for Buresh

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Silver badge of resurrection
description: When a throw doesn't go your way\, use this badge to <strong>throw again</strong>. Can be used <strong>twice per game</strong>.

name: Jasper beads
description: Stones the colour of blood are said to have a calming effect\, help concentration and help women with their worries.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Grimey skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Tin badge of fortune
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>reroll a die of your choosing</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Adam's chambers' key
description: The key to Adam's sleeping quarters in the loft.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Broken arrow
description: As long as it served\, it had purpose.

name: Chemise
description: A chemise that was left at the bathhouse after the celebrations.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Dried thistle
description: Thistle grows in roadside ditches\, in clearings and where there is shade and relief from strong sunlight.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Leek
description: A distant relative of garlic. It whets the appetite and is a garnish to any vegetable soup.

name: Cooked lamb
description: This cooked lamb is melting on your tongue.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Frankfurt steel
description: Steel is an alloy of iron\, carbon and other elements\, and is the main raw material for the manufacture of weapons and armour. It is valued for its hardness and durability\, but it is also very flexible\, a quality that a good blacksmith must know how to work with.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Horse meat
description: It is well known that eating horse meat is not recommended and it should only be eaten in case of extreme emergency\, if there is nothing else to soothe your stomach.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Sketch – Horseman's pick
description: The horseman's pick is a light riding axe with a spike. Used correctly\, it's a good friend in a pinch. Its sharp point can cut through armour\, its blade through any shield.

name: Painter's Guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The three bowls of paint are a well-known symbol of the Kuttenberg painters who decorated knights' shields and painted the frescoes in the royal palace.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Aketon short
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: The Art of the Sword IV
description: A skill book on Sword combat. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Letter from von Aulitz's wife
description: A short letter from the wife of Markvart von Aulitz.

name: Suchdol pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek\, owner of the Suchdol fortress.

name: Half plate legs
description: Partial leg protection\, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who\, for some reason\, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea\, though.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Italian Court Armoury key
description: Key to the armoury of the Italian Court.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Antler shards
description: Antler pieces\, most likely the remnants of a much more formidable hunting trophy. They can be sold or used to mix potions.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Letter to unknown servant
description: A letter to an unknown servant\, who clearly can read.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: The Czech Campaign to Lombardy I
description: The first part of the glorious deeds that the Czech warriors distinguished themselves with at Milan.

name: Scaled skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Pepper
description: Those who can't afford it don't need it; those who can likely pay handsomely for it. Pepper comes from far eastern countries and is brought over by merchants on their rickety ships.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Gotzlin's chest key
description: The key to Gotzlin's chest that he gave me as a reward.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Sketch – Noble's hunting sword
description: The hunting sword – originally made for hunting wildlife\, nowadays often carried by wealthy burghers\, as they aren't allowed to carry a noble's sword at their side.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Scapular with saint
description: A tiny pendant\, usually worn around the neck or wrapped around the wrist\, is associated with praising of the Virgin Mary and other saints.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Copies of the poems of Margrave Prokop
description: Florian's copies of the verses of Margrave Prokop of Luxembourg from his captivity in Pressburg.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Order of the cross knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Magdeburg plate arms
description: Protection of the whole arm and forearm by precisely fitted metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass and artistic ornaments.

name: Chicken coop key
