description: Key hidden in a chicken coop in Mesoles.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Three-legged cup
description: The three-legged cup is really hard to drink from\, but it makes you look like you're consuming a mystical elixir.

name: Found horseshoe
description: Finding a horseshoe on the ground is said to be a very lucky sign. Especially if I've lost it myself before.

name: Couters with rondel
description: Simple elbow pads with round rondels. Unless one can afford better armour\, every protection counts.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Ornate tin pitcher
description: Drinks served from pewter dishes taste a little strange\, but the pitcher sparkles and that's all that matters!

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Engraved silver ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A poor person should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Hunting bolt
description: A bolt suitable for hunting game.

name: Bavarian plate legs
description: A leg protection consisting of forged plates of sheet metal suitably fit together. Such armour protects the warrior's entire leg\, but its weight depends on the craftsmanship of the maker.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Golden chalice
description: I'll just have one cup and go.

name: Excerpt from the Legend of Christianus
description: About the miracles born from the remains of St. Wenceslas.

name: Short gambeson
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Canzoniere
description: A collection of poems by Petrarch.

name: Cooked onion
description: A nice onion can improve any dish.

name: Florian's silver ring
description: The silver ring of Knight Florian Lomnicz\, which he received from a young lady as a token of her favour.

name: Noble's sword
description: A sword for the noble and those who think they can pass themselves off as such. Its beauty slightly exceeds its combat qualities\, but it is still a superb weapon.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Mustard
description: A rare spice from the southern lands.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Noble's hunting sword
description: The hunting sword – originally made for hunting wildlife\, nowadays often carried by wealthy burghers\, as they aren't allowed to carry a noble's sword at their side.

name: The Art of the Sword II
description: A skill book on Sword combat. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Basics of Philosophy
description: A very worn and battered tome. Can be read from level 10 of the Scholarship skill.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: My dream diary
description: A diary of dreams of Otto von Bergow.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Scribe's message
description: A piece of paper from the scribe Erazim posted next to his door at Trosky.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Lords of Leipa heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Cooked wolf heart
description: Wolf heart may be useful for some evil sorcery\, but a true Christian should not eat such a thing even if he were starving.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Village elm bow
description: A homemade stronger bow made of elm. Elm wood is flexible and hard to split\, so it is excellent for making very precise bows.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Hauberk long
description: A long\, chainmail shirt with sleeves covering the arms and forearms.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Shoe soup
description: Tastes like a boot sole.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Weak Bane poison
description: Makes running impossible and reduces Health by 110 in 60 seconds. More suitable for poisoning cooking pots than applying to weapons.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Strip die
description: Legend has it this die will help you undress many a wench.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Horschan mines account ledger
description: Copy of the account ledgerof the royal mines in Horschan.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Victoria's scarf
description: A nicely decorated piece of good fabric.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Margaret's gold ring
description: The gold ring that Margaret gave me as a pledge. It originally belonged to her mother.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Fur-lined hat
description: A fur-lined hat is favourite among the sholars andwise doctors.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Magdeburg plate arms
description: Protection of the whole arm and forearm by precisely fitted metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass and artistic ornaments.

name: Life in the Saddle II
description: A skill book on Horsemanship. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Cooked venison
description: Preparing venison is a lengthy process\, but the taste is worth it.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Maleshov chambers key
description: Key to the noble chambers in the Maleshov fortress.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the subjects and the army\, is decorated with Kuttenberg symbols.

name: Pork
description: There are many ways to prepare pork. Just be careful not to burn it or undercook it!

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Stolen shoe
description: Some write poems out of love\, others steal shoes…

name: Simple headband
description: Coloured or embroidered strips of fabric or ribbons are a cheaper alternative to crowns and headbands\, popular especially among the poorer classes.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Cooked beef
description: This is how you make meat dumplings. Finely chop your beef\, or better yet\, crush it in a mortar\, if you have one. Add the parsley\, egg and salt\, knead well and add some flour for thickening. Then artfully form the dumplings and fry them in lard.

name: Turnau beer
description: Turnau beer is known far and wide for its light taste and fruity aroma. An expert will recognise the lower bitterness and fermentation.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Spearman Training I
description: A skill book on Polearm combat.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Executioner's sword
description: It whistles through the air\, one last attempt to scream\, and then silence forever.

name: Adult's skull
description: A skull I dug up\, from a grave under the walls of Kuttenberg.

name: Letter from an unknown noble
description: A short letter from an unknown Moravian nobleman.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Poacher's knife from Slatego
description: A poacher's knife found in the Slatejov forests. Evidence for the huntsman. A dog should be able to sniff out its owner.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Henry's Mintha perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 5 for 40 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 5.

name: Strong Lion Perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 7 for 5 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 7.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Riding cuirass
description: Solid front plackart with a thin bar to prevent the tip of a polearm from slipping into the noble neck. The cuirass is made of tempered sheet metal to withstand the potential impact of a spear in a frontal collision of a knight's ride.

name: Hauberk long
description: A long\, chainmail shirt with sleeves covering the arms and forearms.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Bull pen key
description: The key to Arnoshtek's pen.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Barrel chest key
description: Key to the chest with the explosive barrel.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Roe deer loin
description: A tasty and not too fatty piece. As with other game\, the best meat comes from younger animals. It is advisable to let it hang out for some time before butchering\, as there is still too much blood in a freshly killed animal\, which makes the meat unnecessarily tough.

name: Lords of Hradetz knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: A collection of somewhat bawdy poems
description: A book of titillating verses.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Tachov maypole
description: A wreath from the top of the Tachov maypole. It was the pride of the whole village up until recently\, but now I have it. I reckon it'll be used as decoration in Olbram's cottage soon enough.

name: Colorful festive dress
description: A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Barnabas' ring
description: A silver ring from Captain Barnabas.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Italian chalice
description: A golden chalice gifted to the vineyard by one Pippo Spano of Ozora.

name: Clove
description: Rare eastern spice from the Silk Road for delicious sauces.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Miller's recipe
description: The miller's renowned venison recipe.

name: Smoked boar meat
description: A piece of lightly spiced boar meat with an unmistakable taste.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Recipe for Artemisia potion
description: Increases strength and\, if good quality\, reduces how much Stamina it costs to attack and defend.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Dried trout
description: Dried trout must be seasoned well\, then it is a long-lasting delicacy.

name: Fable of the Fox and the Pitcher
description: How the vixen found a pitcher and how resentment and anger led her to her death.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Noble's plate legs
description: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability\, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Broken pickaxe
description: Useless on its own\, but the iron could be put back into circulation.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Sulphur wicks
description: Smells like Hell itself.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Plain laminar gauntlets
description: Simple arm and forearm armour composed of individual lamellae supplemented with elbow guards called couters.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Field crossbow
description: A well-made war crossbow. Its folded arms give it such strength that even with a lever called a Goat's leg\, it is difficult to draw quickly. This crossbow is found in abundance on the battlefield\, though it will not penetrate good plate armour. Anything else\, however\, it can penetrate like nothing.

name: Boar rump
description: You can serve boar leg with rosehip sauce or cabbage\, but never cook it the same way twice in a row.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the subjects and the army\, is decorated with coat of arms of Ruthards.

name: Pig skin
description: Tanned pork leather. What it loses in natural strength it makes up for in durability and distinctive softness. That's why tailors use it for lining\, for finer cases and for book covers. That's the only way it won't tear.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Simple bonnet
description: A simple bonnet is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Carefully wrapped handgonnes
description: A pair of hand cannons wrapped in waxed canvas. Something's rattling\, but it's probably just ammunition. I have to bring them to Zizka at the agreed ambush site.

name: Hounskull bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor. It has been pejoratively nicknamed the dog's snout because of its strange shape\, but it is easier to breathe in it and is more durable than its older models.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our joint effort.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Pepper
description: Rare Arabic spice for a delicious flavour.

name: Hungarian heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Old coins
description: Antique coins with latin writing bearing the resemblances of pagan emperors from ancient Rome.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Boiled pork liver
description: Fatty pork liver\, a delicacy of courts and backyards. But it should be prepared first. Perhaps by frying them with onions in butter\, then pouring black beer over them and adding pieces of bread.

name: Toledo steel
description: Toledo was already a city of blacksmiths and sword makers in the days of the ancient Holy Roman Empire. But the secrets of the local craft have been closely guarded by the local guilds for centuries. Toledo's steel is considered to be some of the finest that can be found.

name: Fastening material
description: A mixture of nails\, rivets and wires. Everything a good blacksmith needs to hold his work together.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Onion
description: An onion: healthy\, juicy and fresh.

name: Golden cup
description: Even sour wine tastes good from a golden goblet.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Sigismund's orders
description: Orders from Sigismund\, the sly fox\, to his followers. Letter confidentiality is an important institution\, but I'll make an exception this time.

name: Zavish's chest key
description: The key to Zavish's chest.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Letter from Vavak
description: Letter from Vavak

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Bardiche
description: A simple pole weapon for those who need to keep the enemy and the cities' scum at bay. Its original blade is joined with a hook for tripping enemies' legs and pushing ladders off battlements.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Lords of Leipa shield
description: A shield with the coat of arms of the Lords of Leipa\, which I found at the Nebakov castle.

name: Odd die
description: A die loaded to favour odd numbers. Most of the time.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Smoked venison
description: Venison is the bounty of nobles' hunts and poaching expeditions.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Torch
description: May it be a light for you in dark places\, when all other lights go out.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Dead man's right boot
description: The right boot of a dead miner. Boots for burial are just for show\, not for walking. One hopes.

name: Mutton
description: You can make a good meal like this. First\, roast some meat on a spit. Take some white bread\, wine and plums and make a black sauce out of them. Add the roasted meat and sweeten with honey. Serve with lard and baked apples and sprinkle with almonds.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Lords of Hradetz knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Wormwood
description: Abundant grows on roadsides and in fields.

name: Boletus edulis
description: An estimable fruit of the Bohemian lands\, tasty boiled or roasted\, with meat or porridge.

name: Argonautica
description: The famous myth of the voyage of the hero Jason and his retinue on the ship Argo to Colchis in search of the Golden Fleece and the tragic story of the love of Jason and the princess Medea\, written by the poet Apollonius of Rhodes.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Tavern drawing
description: According to a legend told by a merchant\, this drawing was made years ago by the famous Master Theodoric himself at the King Charles Inn in order to pay his debt to the innkeeper.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Toledo steel sword
description: A good blade of Toledo steel created from the broken sword of a dead hermit

name: Holy Trinity die
description: A consecrated die commemorating the Holy Trinity\, especially by rolling threes.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Cooked chicken
description: A dead chicken… it looks a little reproachful. To soothe your hunger and lift your spirits with a good meal\, roast a young chicken. Then boil some bread in red wine with parsley\, sage\, mint and lavender. Strain this sauce through a cloth and pour it over the roasted chicken. Finally\, sprinkle it lightly with cinnamon or ginger.

name: Goose quills
description: Geese were used to guard property. No wonder\, since they're always angry\, as scribes are always plucking their feathers.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
description: A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Krizhan's treasure map
description: A map leading to an abandoned mine shaft. And what's inside? We'll see…

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Eight-sided sword pommel
description: The end of the hilt of the sword. It is struck against an iron tang\, which is then hammered and the pommel is thus fixed. It serves mainly to balance the whole weapon and as a counterweight to the long blade. In swordfighting\, it prevents the weapon from slipping out of the hand\, but it can also be used to grip and extend the hilt of the sword. Some swordfighting techniques use the pommel to deliver crushing blows to the opponent's face.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Hungarian knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Sketch – Battle longsword
description: A heavier long blade will last longer and won't break easily\, but it must be balanced by a much larger pommel. This sword is designed for actual battle rather than a quick sword fight.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Burgher's hunting sword
description: A hunting sword is the faithful companion of every huntsman and poacher. Commonly used for finishing off hunted game\, but can come in handy when chopping woodchips for a campfire.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Brunswick's map II
description: A map leading to a part of Brunswick's armour.

name: Key to Tibor's prison
description: Key to the room in the barn.

name: Executioner's axe
description: A lightweight\, well-forged war axe. The blade forged into the point replaces the spike\, which can be used to cut through the ring armour and the belly underneath.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Dried feverfew
description: A plant that is widely cultivated and used to reduce fever. In many languages\, therefore\, its name refers precisely to this beneficial property.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Opportunity
description: The sword worned by Vauquelin Brabant. Although he had been looking for opportunities all his life\, for him\, their window had closed for good.

name: Skull fragment relic
description: A small fragment of flat bone said to come from the skull of Saint Margaret. In ancient times\, the Roman Emperor persecuted all Christians and had many of them cruelly martyred. Margaret was reported by her spurned suitor to the prefect\, accusing her of secretly professing faith in Christ. In prison\, the devil himself appeared to the virtuous maiden in the form of a dragon and devoured her\, but she overcame him with the help of the cross. She survived drowning and burning by fire\, so they finally had to behead her. A few relics of this martyr were supposedly given to the Czech King Premysl Otakar by the Pope himself after his victory over the Hungarians.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Milk
description: A jug filled to the brim with fresh milk.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Poleaxe
description: A knight's battle axe on a pole designed especially for noble warriors\, because its forging cannot be entrusted to any village blacksmith. A terrible crushing and slashing weapon\, it can cut through even the best armour like a knife through butter.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Hangman's hair
description: This talisman from the body of a hanged man is said to bring good luck to thieves.

name: Aim and Fire! IV
description: A skill book on Marksmanship. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Letter for Markold
description: A letter for Markold of Louny. It might be of interest to a few other people...

name: Beer
description: Liquid bread\, a satisfying drink that also fills the belly. Don't overdo it\, lest you succumb to alcoholism.

name: Apollonia skeleton's key
description: Key I found in the hands of a skeleton in Apollonia.

name: Poleyn
description: Simple knee pads that can be part of full armour. They are most often worn separately by those who cannot afford more expensive armour or who would be unnecessarily restricted in their movement by it.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Letter for Anna of Schweidnitz
description: A letter from Francesco Petrarca to Anna of Schweidnitz.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Bearded axe
description: The bearded axe is a battle axe which is a simple tool in its origin\, but it can chop down shields as well as trees.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Deer heart
description: A well-prepared heart is a real delicacy for true gourmets. Slice the heart in two and clean it\, then marinate it in a mixture of red wine\, vinegar\, pepper and onion. After some time\, coat it in flour\, quickly fry it\, then and bake until soft.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: War hammer
description: A really heavy war hammer designed to break through knights' armour. It can take a lot\, but one has to be skilled with it to make it serve him well. It is used with a shield in a hard melee battle\, where there is no telling what blow will fall where.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Boiled horse meat
description: A proper chunk of boiled horse meat. You don't come across something this juicy and nutritious every day!

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Marathon III
description: A skill book on Vitality. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Butcher's apron
description: A long inner tunic joined with butcher's apron.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Chainmail gauntlets
description: Fingerless chainmail gloves with tempered sheet metal are an older type of armour and therefore cheaper to produce than plate gloves. Unfortunately for archers\, and especially archers\, they lack any advantages.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: The Strength of the Knight III
description: A skill book on Strength. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Steel
description: Steel is an alloy of iron\, carbon and other elements\, and is the main material for the manufacture of weapons and armour. It is valued for its hardness and durability\, but it is also very flexible\, a quality that a good blacksmith must know how to work with.

name: Embroidered heater coat
description: A coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons. It is decorated with the symbol of Kuttenberg.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, is decorated with the coat of arms of the Lords of Leipa.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Aqua Vitalis recipe
description: Reduces loss of health and slows bleeding.

name: Leaf-shaped couters
description: Simple knee pads called couters with a leaf to improve protection against slashing blows.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Cooked beet
description: Beet is a very healthy vegetable. Cooking it does not change anything.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Sketch – Duelling longsword
description: A perfectly balanced sword with a slender blade for true sword masters. The longsword is a noble weapon for swordfighting and a quick way to send any fool to the other side.

name: Cooked cabbage
description: Cooked cabbage can be served with meat\, in soups or just on its own.

name: Skull Crushers IV
description: A skill book on Heavy Weapons combat. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Leached coal
description: Charcoal produced in charcoal mills and further leached for a long time to improve its alchemical properties.

name: Premolar die
description: A playing die made from a premolar tooth.

name: Arrow from Karel's Head
description: A shaft with an arrowhead\, which I pulled out of the head of the dead Karel\, whom folk called Arrowhead. It's supposed to be magical\, but I have my doubts.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Sketch – Knight's axe
description: A knight's battle axe. A dexterous weapon that can pierce good armour or crush the bones underneath with its spike. It also has a pointed tip to finish off tougher opponents.

name: Poppy seed kolach
description: A good poppy seed cake is beneficial to all the senses. It calms and soothes. Quick\, one more piece before it's banned for being too delicious!

name: Decorated field crossbow
description: A war crossbow made by a true master\, beautifully inlaid with bone and polished wood. This beauty may not look like it belongs in combat\, but it can pierce chainmail armour as well as weaker plate armour. She stretches herself with an iron contraption called a Goat's foot\, because no one can stretch her strong shoulders with their bare hands.

name: Dried horse meat
description: If you have to slaughter a horse\, at least let its meat last as long as possible and not go to waste.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Lords of Hradetz knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Jakesh's compensation
description: Jakesh's compensation for all the hardships he caused Bozhena and Pavlena.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Vostatek's empty waterskin
description: Empty waterskin of the hunter Vostatek. It reeks of an undetermined alcohol.

name: On Simony
description: Treatise of Master Jan Hus on the Papal Simony.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Jewish veil
description: Wearing covered hair by married women is not just a matter of Christian tradition. Jewish women are also required by halakha to wear scarves or hats covering their hair after marriage.

name: Wenceslas IV
description: About King Wenceslas IV and how he reigned badly and ended even worse.

name: Meaningless moonshine
description: This moonshine can get cause you a lot of trouble\, and not just an upset stomach.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Riding cuirass
description: Solid front plackart with a thin bar to prevent the tip of a polearm from slipping into the noble neck. The cuirass is made of tempered sheet metal to withstand the potential impact of a spear in a frontal collision of a knight's ride.

name: Key to Vidlak poacher's chest
description: Rusty key to a chest in the camp of the Vidlak poacher.

name: Silver badge of transmutation
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>change a die of your choosing to a five</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Golden tournament shield
description: Shield made for the Kuttenberg tournament. Compared to a regular shield it is considerably lighter\, which is of course compensated by its durability.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Heavy crossbow
description: The heavy siege crossbow is used for shooting soldiers defending castle walls. The strong iron limbs have a considerable draw weight\, therefore a hand crank must be used to load it. A bolt fired from this weapon can easily tear through plate armour.

name: Cracked skull
description: Dust you are and to dust you shall return. The skull serves as a reminder of the transience of human life.

name: Old pointy spindle
description: It looks a bit dangerous.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Sack of flour
description: A sack of flour\, as it was ground in the mill. Now we need to keep it dry and out of reach of rats.

name: Life in the Saddle III
description: A skill book on Horsemanship. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Solid gold ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.

name: Lord Borumlaca's bond
description: You need to keep track of money. Especially the money we don't have.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Torn piece of dress
description: A torn piece of cloth. Looks like the hem of a girl's dress. A dog could probably find the owner by it.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Sheep stomach
description: This may not be the most popular meal ever\, but what can you do. The best way to prepare it is to fill it with whatever you like or have on hand\, sew it up and then boil it for a long time. A dish prepared in this way is very compact and portable and therefore suitable for travelling.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: Cooked deer heart
description: A well-prepared heart is a real delicacy for true gourmets. Slice the heart in two and clean it\, then marinate it in a mixture of red wine\, vinegar\, pepper and onion. After some time\, coat it in flour\, quickly fry it\, then and bake until soft.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Strong Mintha Perfume Effect
description: Increases Charisma by 3 for 30 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 5.

name: King's die
description: An annointed head has no need of a loaded die\, since he is always right and can never lose.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Straw hat with ribbon
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. Decorated with a ribbon\, such headgear certainly looks more cheerful.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Troskowitz beer
description: This beer is brewed by the innkeeper Betty herself and some say that maybe she should stop.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Minter's tools
description: Minter's tools. Property of the Italian court.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Kuttenberg longsword
description: A beautiful sword of the highest quality\, the ultimate master weapon! It was made by Enderlin\, a swordsman from Kuttenberg\, as a copy of the sword of the Kuttenberg swordfighting guild. For the greater glory of Kuttenberg\, Master Enderlin then donated it as a reward for the winners of the Kuttenberg Tournament.

name: Dried dandellion
description: Grows everywhere as a weed\, but mostly on grassy slopes and meadows it is to be found.

name: Milanese plate leg armour
description: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge\, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Cooked beef tongue
description: Beef tongue for lunch – a joy for the whole family.

name: Weak Dollmaker poison
description: Makes running impossible and reduces all weapon skills by 2.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Hazel longbow
description: A longbow made of young hazel wood. While it may not be the strongest longbow\, but it can still handle small game or the occasional cheeky bandit.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Forged documents about Anna of Waldstein
description: Forged documents covering up the questionable dealings of Lady Anna of Waldstein.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Stray dog soup
description: Soup from a stray dog that used to cheer up the defenders of Suchdol during hard times.

name: Linen
description: Every blank canvas should be filled.

name: Unlucky die
description: Sometimes Lady Luck is on your side\, sometimes she isn't. With this die\, she most likely isn't.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Mintha perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 2 for 20 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 5.

name: Small brass crucifix
description: The small brass cross is a symbol of Christian modesty\, because no one takes any wealth with them to the next world.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Silver cup
description: Essential equipment for every conscientious drinker. Silver\, as is known\, is good for your health!

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Engraved gemstone ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A beggar should be careful not to get the noose for selling it.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Riding cuirass
description: Solid front plackart with a thin bar to prevent the tip of a polearm from slipping into the noble neck. The cuirass is made of tempered sheet metal to withstand the potential impact of a spear in a frontal collision of a knight's ride.

name: Cooked hare heart
description: It might look awful\, but offal and entrails are all healthy\, the heart most of all. You can fry or boil them or add them to soups. The main thing is to use everything and not waste any of the carcass.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic\, adds flavour and will heal any ailment as well as seasoning many dishes. But raw it burns the tongue.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Recipe for Lead shot gunpowder
description: Gunpowder used to fire lead shot that even the best plate armour can't stop at close range.

name: Cutlery knife
description: Part of the kit of every experienced cook and inexperienced killer.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Smoked roe deer loin
description: A tasty and not too fatty piece. As with other game\, the best meat comes from younger animals. It is advisable to let it hang out for some time before butchering\, as there is still too much blood in a freshly killed animal\, which makes the meat unnecessarily tough.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Hazel longbow
description: A longbow made of young hazel wood. While it may not be the strongest longbow\, but it can still handle small game or the occasional cheeky bandit.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Poppy seed kolach
description: A good poppy seed cake is beneficial to all the senses. It calms and soothes. Quick\, one more piece before it's banned for being too delicious!

name: Radzig Kobyla's longsword
description: A sword forged by my father for Sir Radzig Kobyla\, which was later stolen by that scoundrel Istvan Toth.

name: Capon's poaching kit
description: Equipment of the poaching nobleman Hans Capon. Evidence for the gamekeeper Varel.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Nettle
description: It can be found abundantly by water\, on the edge of woods and in the furrows of fields.

name: Beggar's coat
description: A beggar's overcoat is all patch and almost falling apart. Still\, in a pinch\, it's better than nothing.

name: Recipe for Fox
