description: Improves speech and speeds up reading if good quality. Also increases the amount of experience gained if best quality.

name: Vinegar from Loretz
description: Someone fucked up and let the wine ferment all the way down to vinegar.

name: Dried belladonna
description: It grows in clearings and in leafy woods\, but it is best not to seek it at all.

name: Wreath
description: A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days\, such as the wedding day.

name: Cooked garlic
description: Although raw it burns\, cooked it is beautifully sweet and flavours meat and vegetables.

name: On Composition of Explosives
description: Miller Kreyzl's finished book with personal dedication to Hermes Trismegistos.

name: Riding cuirass
description: Solid front plackart with a thin bar to prevent the tip of a polearm from slipping into the noble neck. The cuirass is made of tempered sheet metal to withstand the potential impact of a spear in a frontal collision of a knight's ride.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Wine
description: Excellent wine\, the consumption of which can lead to fun\, song\, drunken blabbering\, loss of memory and empty purses.

name: Nuremberg bascinet
description: A helmet with a german klappvisor is an example of the highest armourer's art. It is easy to breathe in and through the widened visors it is much easier to see to the sides.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: The New Council by Smil Flashka of Pardubice
description: On the council of beasts\, which advised the King how to rule well and for the good of all.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Knight's war hammer
description: The war hammer is considered by many to be as noble a weapon as the sword\, since it is used where there is no room for swordplay and hard blows need to be dealt. The war hammer is therefore designed to penetrate armour and crush bones in the heat of battle.

name: Kettle hat
description: A simple iron helmet for all poor squires. It is usually a good idea to wear it with a quilted hood with a collar\, as the helmet alone does not protect the cheeks or neck of the warrior. But it's cheap and can be repaired literally on your knee.

name: Cooked boar kidneys
description: Kidneys are healthy if you do not eat them too often. Stew them and serve with some mushrooms.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Brunswick's map IV
description: A map leading to a part of Brunswick's armour.

name: Beef tongue
description: Raw beef tongue is a piece of perfectly lean meat.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Master huntsman's hose
description: A proper hunter doesn't pull down his pants before a ford!

name: Recipe for Buck's Blood
description: Increases stamina and increases stamina regeneration if good quality.

name: Recipe for Aesop potion
description: Increases riding and dog-handling skills. If good quality\, animals will take less notice of you and dogs won't bark at you.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Short gambeson
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Dried eyebright
description: Grows on pastures and heaths and in all places where there is light enough\, as well as wet ground.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Dried herb paris
description: It may be sought in deep woods.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Rusty axe
description: Useless for any job. But the iron could be put back into circulation.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Sigismund's wine
description: Wine from Sigismund's personal stock. Sweet\, probably italian...

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Curd cheese
description: The goodness of curdled milk. Very valuable and nutritious food.

name: Nuremberg bascinet
description: A helmet with a german klappvisor is an example of the highest armourer's art. It is easy to breathe in and through the widened visors it is much easier to see to the sides.

name: Strong bandage
description: A longer strip of clean cloth that can safely stop bleeding.

name: Henry's sword reforged
description: A sword forged by my father for Sir Radzig Kobyla\, which was later stolen by that scoundrel Istvan Toth.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Bull paint
description: A colour darker than the night itself. It will stand out very nicely on a white bull. And most importantly\, it won't wash off easily.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Jan's letter
description: Charter with the seal of the Lords of Suchotlesky.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Towards Flexibility of the Body II
description: A skill book on Agility. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: On Old Father Czech
description: How the Czechs came to their homeland.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Knight's notes I
description: Notes of the knight Taras Mura\, found in the mines near Old Kutna.

name: Rondel scullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Old chest key
description: The key from the overgrown shelter not far from Trosky.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Hard boiled egg
description: Breakfast of champions\, like from the caring hands of Goodwife Hanka.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Hourglass gauntlets
description: The most commonly used type of iron gloves whose name refers to their typical hourglass-like shape. It protects not only the hand\, but also part of the forearm of the fighter.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Candle
description: A candle made out of left over beef or mutton fat by a handy soapmaker or butcher.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: River pearl necklace
description: Captivating\, velvety\, shiny river clam pearls arranged nicely next to each other. Tempts the most virtuous woman to vanity.

name: Ordinary coat with crest
description: A plain red and white coat with the coat of arms of the Kingdom of Hungary.

name: Marathon II
description: A skill book on Vitality. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Basics of Gardening
description: Everything you ever wanted to know about gardening but were afraid to ask. Can be read from level 5 of the Survival skill.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Winning horseshoe
description: The memory of a great victory.

name: Homemade hunting sword
description: A dreadful skull opener or a mere result of the tortured mind of a clumsy journeyman who abused the blacksmith's craft to create such wickedness and called it a hunting sword?

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Eldris's notes on gunpowder
description: A document in which Eldris\, the gun forger\, records the supply routes of gunpowder.

name: Ornate mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Ordinary die
description: An ordinary playing die.

name: A suspicious bag
description: This is a unique clothing asset for an important character. If you got it in game\, report it!

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Beef tenderloin
description: Great meat suitable for many dishes. It is best served with a white cream sauce.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Dried wormwood
description: Abundant grows on roadsides and in fields.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Smoked deer rump
description: Delicious hind leg meat. The topside cut makes for the best roast. Dice the rest and boil it in salted water. Now to make a good sauce to go with it\, crumble some bread in beer\, add a little vinegar and cook it with some pepper and cloves\, if you have them. Pour the sauce on top of the cooked venison and garnish with baked apples. This is how Severin the Younger advises deer to be prepared.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Gold swap-out badge
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>reroll two dice with the same value</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Narrow straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is a bit narrower\, but it serves its purpose just as well.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
description: A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Silver nuggets
description: Small pieces of unprocessed silver.

name: Hand wrap
description: A hand wrap is a strip of cloth wrapped securely around the wrist\, palm and base of the thumb. It helps to protect the hand and wrist against injuries caused by blows\, serving both to keep the joints aligned and to compress and lend strength to the soft tissues of the hand during a fist strike.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Recipe for Lullaby potion
description: Reduces restedness to 0. Reduces stamina regeneration if good quality. Suitable for applying to weapons and for poisoning cooking pots.

name: Fine bolt
description: A bolt slightly better balanced than a regular bolt.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Strange potion
description: A strange tasteless and odourless liquid. I wonder what will happen if I drink it?

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Painted pavese
description: A riding pavese covered with linen without a noble coat of arms.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Brabant's chest key
description: The key to Brabant's chest.

name: Bloody stone
description: A bad omen and a witness to an evil deed.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cooked roe deer kidneys
description: Cooked roe dear kidneys are a true delicacy.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Sheep guts
description: Freshly extracted sheep guts. Carrying something like that around is a bit... disgusting.

name: Jester's disguise
description: A colourful coat decorated with jingle bells and an equally colourful jester's hood are worn by the minstrels in an attempt to attract the audience's attention. Be careful not to burst out laughing.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Maleshov fort map
description: A sketch of the Maleshov fortress\, given to me by Rosa Ruthard.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Golden cross with garnets
description: Very beautiful gold jewelry with dark red gems.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cooked trout
description: Tasty freshwater fish prepared with butter and herbs. It's simply a fairy tale.

name: Aranka's die
description: Aranka gave me this die to make it easier for me to play against her husband.

name: Bach moonshine
description: I expect the people who work at Bach have no choice but to keep this with them at all times.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Von Aulitz's house key
description: The key to the house where von Aulitz is staying.

name: Black powder keg
description: A keg filled to the lid with black powder. I shouldn't walk close to a fire with it.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Bandit's brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of forged slats hammerd on a leather vest is a slightly older form of protection than the fashionable metal cuirass. Both provide similar protection\, but the brigandine is a bit heavier\, but there are warriors who will not let it go. This one's been through a lot\, though\, and has had more than one owner. Most certainly haven't given her up willingly.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Saffron
description: One of the most expensive spices in the world. Less than a pinch is enough for any meal.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Simple bonnet
description: A simple bonnet is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Fur-lined hat
description: A fur-lined hat is favourite among the sholars andwise doctors.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Tin badge of might
description: Use it to add <strong>one extra die to your throw</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Wayfarer's map I
description: A map to a site where there's treasure.

name: Horned sword guard
description: A cross guard\, also known as quillon. It serves to protect the swordsman's hands from the opponent's blade. It can also be used to execute a grappling hold or strike to an unprotected face. In sword making\, it is put on the blade's tail before the hilt is made and the pommel is put on. In cheap weapons made by poor blacksmiths\, it will loosen over time and begin to clink unpleasantly.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Order of the cross knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Master's Studies III
description: A skill book on Scholarship. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Forgotten key
description: A key I found in a jug in an abandoned cottage.

name: Cooked perch
description: Perch or other fish are healthy\, you should eat a lot of them. You can season fish with spices and coat it in flour. Then fry it in butter. Finally\, sprinkle it generously with fried onion and serve with bread.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Chainmail gauntlets
description: Fingerless chainmail gloves with tempered sheet metal are an older type of armour and therefore cheaper to produce than plate gloves. Unfortunately for archers\, and especially archers\, they lack any advantages.

name: Sixer's braies
description: The very ripe braies of yacker Sixer.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Gold badge of might
description: Using it will allow you to roll <strong>one extra die</strong>. Can be used <strong>three times per game</strong>

name: Tournament practice sword
description: A wooden longsword that can bruise but not kill. For those who are serious about swordsmanship\, this is an invaluable tool for practicing.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Songs of the scoundrel's pupils
description: Good poems about women\, love and wine by pupils of the scoundrels.

name: Silver chalice
description: One day in the future\, people with battle with sticks for such a trophy… maybe on ice!

name: Wolf pelt
description: Wolf hide. Rumour has it that if you sleep in the woods under a cloak of wolf fur when the moon is full\, you'll gain supernatural powers or transform into one. But you don't know anyone who can confirm that.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Plain laminar gauntlets
description: Simple arm and forearm armour composed of individual lamellae supplemented with elbow guards called couters.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Lords of Nebakov kite shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Letter of admiration
description: A signed charter expressing admiration for the Bailiff Thrush from Troskowitz.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Plectrude
description: Biography of Plectrude\, the wife of Pepin II the Middle\, Duchess of Francia\, Regent of Neustrie.

name: Sheep remains
description: The remains of Siegfried's sheep\, which was torn apart by wolves. It may help Mutt to sniff them out.

name: Wysoka priest's alchemy book
description: A book by the Wysoka parish priest. So many years he spent working on it…

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Killer's helmet
description: The helmet of the notorious murderer and bandit Burkhard.

name: Ramhead hammer
description: A masterfully made war hammer with a ram's head shaped hammer that excellently smashes skulls and penetrates armour. The mercenary commander Andrew earned his nickname thanks to this weapon.

name: Sketch – Common longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Ci die
description: The second in the line of the demonic dice\, she likes to get lost\, but when she's with her sisters she's very strong.

name: Hare meat
description: Hare meat is very good\, healthy and tender. It's a welcome addition to the diet of many villagers. You can prepare it with onions by taking the whole hare and putting it in a baking dish. Salt it and pour some butter under it. Once roasted\, cut it into pieces\, put it in some beer and continue to cook with a little vinegar. Meanwhile\, fry some onion in fat until golden brown. Then add it to the sauce\, thicken with breadcrumbs or flour and cook until done. You can season it with any spice you have.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Aketon short
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Hauberk long
description: A long\, chainmail shirt with sleeves covering the arms and forearms.

name: Thunderstone
description: A finely smoothed stone of dark colour\, endowed with magical powers\, with a lightning hole in the middle. It's pleasant to the touch and slightly warm in the hand. It will bring me good luck and protect me from all evil.

name: Lightbringer's secret
description: Leather cover\, stamped corners. The mysterious book that the miller Kreyzl wants. The author is one Black Bertold.

name: Bohuta's map
description: Bohuta's map showing the place where he buried his equipment when he decided to redeem himself.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Master's Studies I
description: A skill book on Scholarship.

name: Satin
description: Smooth fabric in satin weave. The nightmare of anyone who foots the bill for a wedding dress.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Johnny the Gob's shield
description: A shield with the symbol of the infamous bandit\, Johnny the Gob.

name: Travelogue of the so-called Mandeville
description: On the wonders of the land of India.

name: Sack of supplies
description: A sack with supplies ready for travel.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: The Tale of Melusine I
description: The first part of the Luxembourg legend of the fairy Melusine.

name: Golden heraldic brooch
description: An exquisite piece of jewellery made of gold decorated with a nobleman's coat of arms. Such marked pieces pose a considerable danger to thieves and must therefore be sold or melted down quickly.

name: Hunting arrow
description: An arrow designed for hunting game. It is extra accurate\, and causes more damage.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Spined kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal and therefore slightly more durable\, but still unnecessarily heavy. Its spin makes it better able to withstand blows to the head\, but it needs to be supplemented with a quilted hood or collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's cheeks or neck on its own.

name: Wolfram's spade
description: This spade is like a gift from the heavens. Its blade is so sharp\, it could split the clouds. When you firmly grasp it in your hand\, you feel as if it wants to speak through you. The subtle cuts and scrapes on it are like the graceful strokes of the angels themselves. On its blade\, you can make out not only soil\, but also traces of clay\, calcium\, and charcoal left behind by its many years of service. With a spade like this\, you wouldn't even hesitate going up against the local invaders.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Lords of Nebakov kite shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Cooked beef kidneys
description: Tasty and healthy. Fry them in fat or roast them on the fire. Just like with other offal\, you need to take care not to consume too much and too often. They also make for an excellent dog feed.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Hunting bow from Hans Capon
description: A beautiful hunting bow\, given to me by Hans Capon as thanks for rescuing him from captivity at Maleshov fortress.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Victoria's herbs
description: A bundle of dried herbs from Victoria's house.

name: Simple headband
description: Coloured or embroidered strips of fabric or ribbons are a cheaper alternative to crowns and headbands\, popular especially among the poorer classes.

name: Chamomile
description: Most often it is found in fields and fertile land.

name: Sketch – Ataman's sabre
description: An unusual curved blade used by nomads on fast horses in the middle of the Hungarian steppes and remote Arabian deserts. It can be swift and excellent for offense and defense. Every good Christian should beware of losing his head to such a weapon.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Cooked crayfish
description: You can make crayfish soup as follows. Boil it in boiling water\, remove the claws and tail and take the meat out of them. Crack the shell\, add butter\, set the pot on the fire and let it simmer. When the dish turns red\, strain it through a cloth and make it into a soup or a sauce; finally\, add the meat you took out earlier.

name: Old straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is definitely past its prime\, though. It looks as if the wearer was chewed up by a goat.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Pieschel's sword
description: This weapon has been through a lot. Maybe too much. The owner seems to be using it more as a baton than a sword\, since its too blunt.

name: Painter's Guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The three bowls of paint are a well-known symbol of the Kuttenberg painters who decorated knights' shields and painted the frescoes in the royal palace.

name: Simple bonnet
description: A simple bonnet is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Vostatek's waterskin
description: Vostatek the gamekeeper's waterskin filled with pure spring water… or perhaps diluted with something.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Hynek's letter
description: A piece of paper carried by Hynek the 'Greaser'\, a former thief.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Praguers' waffenrock with buttons
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Sigismund's sausage
description: Sausages from Sigismund's personal store. They seem longer than Czech ones. Could the Emperor be compensating for something?

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Mortuary chest key
description: The key to the chest where the gravedigger stores the belongings of the dead.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: On Libusse and Premysl
description: How princess Libusse found a husband and thus began the Premyslid Dynasty.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Nutmeg
description: Rare eastern spice from the Silk Road for making delicious sauces.

name: Dried pork tenderloin
description: Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat\, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water\, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion\, add wine\, vinegar\, juniper\, caraway\, cloves\, pepper\, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil\, add the meat\, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time\, while basting with wine.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Sketch – Noble's sword
description: A sword for the noble and those who think they can pass themselves off as such. Its beauty slightly exceeds its combat qualities\, but it is still a superb weapon.

name: Weak Lion perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 3 for 3 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 7.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Master's Studies IV
description: A skill book on Scholarship. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Lu die
description: The first of the line of demonic dice.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Trosky armoury key
description: A new key to the armoury at Trosky.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Sketch – Nobleman's horseshoes
description: A blacksmith's horseshoe sketch. Because every master had to start somehow.

name: Dorothy's laundry chest key
description: A key of the owner of the Zhelejov baths\, which opens a chest containing washed and patched clothes.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Duelling longsword
description: A perfectly balanced sword with a slender blade for true sword masters. The longsword is a noble weapon for swordfighting and a quick way to send any fool to the other side.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Simple shoes
description: Simple shoes\, also called krpce\, tied around the ankles with a lace. Footwear mainly of poorer families.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Old hunting crossbow
description: An old\, homemade lightweight crossbow that is long past its prime. Its arms are made from a simple piece of wood. therefore it has little power\, but it can be drawn with the bare hand. It reloads quickly\, but is more suited to hunting small game and scaring off poachers and vagrants.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Couters
description: Simple elbow pads. You can suffer all sorts of injuries in combat\, so it's best to protect yourself however you can.

name: Roasted chicken leg
description: No one will refuse a juicy chicken leg.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Ash longbow
description: A long strong bow made of ashen wood. It has a decent range and thanks to its draw speed it is suited very well for fighting.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Tin cross
description: A simple cross made of plain pewter\, but it will certainly suffice for a supplication for a better tomorrow.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Woodsman's Journal III
description: A skill book on Survival in the wilderness. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: City of Prague heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Wooden duck
description: A wooden dog toy.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Sword for young Lord Semine
description: A good sword of Toledo steel\, made from the broken sword of a hermit.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Beet
description: Beet can be eaten even raw. It's really healthy.

name: Sketch – Basilard
description: A short sword that is said to have been given its special name because of its origin. Whether it really originated in the Swiss city of Basel is questionable\, but it is certainly a great weapon that can be carried\, unlike the sword\, even by non-noble townspeople.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Pinot Noir 1401
description: There was not enough sun and the autumn was rainy\, so the grapes did not have time to ripen properly.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Boar tenderloin
description: A prime piece of a boar meat\, juicy and tasty. Prague burgher Havel of Silberstein liked it very much and used to prepare it in a special way called wild boar on venison.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Love letter for Regina
description: A love letter whose contents only Regina understands.

name: Mary the Jewess\, Mother of Alchemy
description: One will become two\, two will become three\, and the third will become one as the fourth.

name: Buresh's safe conduct
description: A letter of safe conduts entitling the bearer to enter the smelters at Grund managed by Master Buresh.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Quilted coat
description: Quilted thick coat\, suitable for every splash and slots.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Strong broth
description: This broth's so strong it could wake up the dead.

name: Turqoise rosary
description: A pretty turquoise rosary\, which\, God knows why\, is the focus of attention of many in Trosky Castle.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Egg
description: It's not advisable to carry raw eggs into battle with you. Things could get messy.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Wounding bolt
description: A bolt with a serrated tip to increase damage and bleeding.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Training bludgeon
description: A soft wood bludgeon\, so that it doesn't hurt too much in a practice fight.

name: Wolf fangs
description: The fangs of an adult wolf. In their time\, they must have brought down many a doe or sheep\, and perhaps even drove some stray unfortunate from the world. Maybe I'll get some coin for them\, or I can carry them around for protection. Either way\, I should avoid doing any unfair witchcraft with them.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Tournament kettle hat
description: A kettle hat that was lent to me as part of the equipment for the famous Kuttenberg tournament.

name: Dagger of Astarte
description: At first glance\, an ordinary dagger that seems to beg for another soul hidden in the heart.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Bone rosary
description: One of the most common types of counting beads. It doesn't count coin\, but something quite different.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Strange strawhat
description: An odd straw hat I found lying under an old tree. I have a strange feeling about it. It seems to carry with it the will of those who wore it before me.

name: Simple shoes
description: Simple shoes\, also called krpce\, tied around the ankles with a lace. Footwear mainly of poorer families.

name: Worn Cuman bow
description: Cuman riding bows are one of the lighter bows\, easy to handle even from the horse's saddle. Their strength comes from the layering of different materials similar to better crossbows. This bow has been through a lot\, it's weaker\, and you can hear it creaking. It can still deliver a killing blow\, or at least one that hurts.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Stolen cup
description: A finely decorated silver cup. No wonder it attracted the attention of a thief.

name: Sketch – Hunting sword
description: The hunting sword is the faithful companion of every hunter or poacher. It is usually used to finish off hunted game\, but it's also handy for cutting kindling for a fire.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Oak bark
description: Well dried and ground\, it's an invaluable aid in tanning and dyeing. The bark is supplied by the millers\, who dry and grind it when they have nothing better to do.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the subjects and the army\, is decorated with Kuttenberg symbols.

name: Mail collar with badge
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Honey
description: Honey in a honeycomb\, useful to the apothecary\, cook\, candlemaker and brown bear.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Products of Skilled Hands III
description: A skill book on Craftsmanship. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Wine
description: Excellent wine\, the consumption of which can lead to fun\, song\, drunken blabbering\, loss of memory and empty purses.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Recipe for Lethean Water
description: If you want to put to rights the imprudent choices of your life\, all it takes is 1 mouthful\, and you can chose your perks anew. Beware\, though\, the procedure is irreversible and painful!

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Ye Wicked Blacksmiths
description: How the wicked blacksmiths help the dishonest craft and to all manner of theft.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Morgenstern
description: A crushing polearm weapon whose name may refer to the first morning star\, but for the enemy\, a blow from its blade is likely to be the last thing they will ever see. A seemingly clumsy weapon that can command respect in any brawl.

name: Jewish hat
description: A pointed yellow hat\, also called a Judenhut\, is a strange and hard to miss head covering for Jewish men.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Fresh milk
description: A jug of fresh milk.

name: Kvyetoslav's love poem
description: A love poem that a miner dedicated to me when I promised to help him write a letter. I don't think it's a very good love poem. It's a pretty nasty thing.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Mint
description: It is rarely found in nature\, but rather alongside houses and in gardens cultivated.

name: Noble's belt
description: A belt is primarily used to hold weapons\, which are then much easier and faster to access. Of course\, the amount of things that can be attached to the belt is limited.

name: Knight's belt
description: A belt is primarily used to hold weapons\, which are then much easier and faster to access. Of course\, the amount of things that can be attached to the belt is limited.

name: Hunter's belt
description: A belt is primarily used to hold weapons\, which are then much easier and faster to access. Of course\, the amount of things that can be attached to the belt is limited.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Enhanced long-range arrow
description: A well-balanced arrow with modified fletching designed for better accuracy at long range.

name: Bascinet with bretèche
description: An older form of the bascinet with a removable wide bretache\, complete with a chainmail aventail protecting the warrior's neck and shoulders.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Rondel scullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Tied jester's hose
description: These colourful trousers are worn by jesters and generally eccentric people. The higher quality suggests that whoever had them made was very serious about their insouciance.

name: Bloodied wedding dress
description: A woman's wedding dress full of dust with a dried bloodstain. The ruined dress has been lying here for a long time\, but it's still neatly folded. Interesting…

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Atalanta\, maiden to men equal
description: About the maiden Atalanta\, the huntress and favourite of the Greek goddess Artemis.

name: Samuel's hunting sword
description: Samuel's hunting sword that never leaves his hand.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Woodsman's Journal I
description: A skill book on Survival in the wilderness.

name: Godwin's longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Better hunting arrow
description: A well-balanced arrow designed for hunting game\, it is slightly more accurate and causes more bleeding.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Stolen dagger
description: A stolen dagger found on the arrested thief.

name: On Saint Adalbert
description: On Saint Adalbert\, his life and miserable death at the hands of the pagans.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Marble head
description: This head carved out marble must have fallen off a statue. Its strange features and remnants of old paint suggest it's quite old.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Gnarly's crossbow
description: The faithful companion of Captain Gnarly.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Cooked boletus
description: An estimable fruit of the Bohemian lands\, tasty boiled or roasted\, with meat or porridge.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Carpenter's axe
description: Heavy work axe used by carpenters for working beams. If there's no better weapon at hand\, it can become a tool of revenge.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Noble's spurs
description: Riding spurs\, also called rowels\, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal\, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.

name: Composite kettle hat
description: A simple kettle hat composed of several pieces of plate. It protects especially against blows from above and therefore it is good to wear it together with a padded coif or a full collar. The advantage is certainly its lower price.

name: Beef
description: This is how you make meat dumplings. Finely chop your beef\, or better yet\, crush it in a mortar\, if you have one. Add the parsley\, egg and salt\, knead well and add some flour for thickening. Then artfully form the dumplings and fry them in lard.

name: Basilisk egg
description: An egg laid by a black rooster and brooded by a frog. Perhaps it gained magical abilities\, or maybe just a slime shell.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Composite kettle hat
description: A simple kettle hat composed of several pieces of plate. It protects especially against blows from above and therefore it is good to wear it together with a padded coif or a full collar. The advantage is certainly its lower price.

name: Suchdol pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek\, owner of the Suchdol fortress.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Balshanka
description: A valued halberd of Sir Jan Posy of Zimburg\, which he lost when Cumans ambushed him.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Saxon brigandine
