description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Breviarium Romanum
description: The Breviary contains psalms\, prayers and stories from the lives of the Saints and is therefore an invaluable aid for the salvation of the soul of every Christian who can read.

name: St. Anthony's standard
description: The standard of the miners from the St. Anthony's mine in Kuttenberg. Such a standard is the symbol and the pride of every miners' gang!

name: Letter from Sokol of Lamberg
description: A short brief letter from Lord Sokol of Lamberg bearing a coat of arms with a goat head.

name: Flanged mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Song of the Merry Poor
description: On how the poor take no heed and sing merrily to themselves.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Horn
description: Cornucopia. The horns and hooves of animals are traditionally used mainly to make good glue. However\, good hornwood is also needed to make bows\, crossbows and even some jewellery.

name: Key from half-built cottage
description: A key I took out of a jug in the ruins of a half-built cottage near Slatego.

name: Golden crucifix
description: Looking at his disciples\, Jesus said: Blessed are you who are poor\, for yours is the kingdom of God.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Vidlak bandit's map
description: A map from the bandits that camped above the Vidlak Pond.

name: Marksman's hook gun
description: The hook gun is a much more massive weapon than the handgonne. The barrel is fitted with a hook on the underside\, which serves to wedge the weapon behind an obstacle and limit recoil when fired. This particular piece is cast from bronze by a master gunsmith\, therefore can be fired repeatedly without breaking.

name: Pork tenderloin
description: Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat\, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water\, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion\, add wine\, vinegar\, juniper\, caraway\, cloves\, pepper\, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil\, add the meat\, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time\, while basting with wine.

name: Breviarium Minorum
description: This breviary is a small but invaluable guide for daily spiritual consolation.

name: Short chainmail
description: Shortened chainmail shirt with long sleeves.

name: Common bolt
description: A regular crossbow bolt. It won't fail or surprise.

name: Punches\, Kicks and a Few Slaps II
description: A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Hroznata's rosary
description: It is said that work in the vineyard is as busy as in the church. And who should know more about it than Hroznata himself\, who devotes his life to both. Through the wine he finds the way to God\, and through God the way to the wine. One would think that the beads on the rosary would be the actual vine grapes.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: List for the feast
description: An unfinished list of food and drink needed for the wedding feast.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: A jacket of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, decorated with the coat of arms of the Lords of Semine.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Wreath
description: Wreath of meadow flowers. It looks nice\, it smells nice\, but it doesn't last very long. Plus\, it can attract bees.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Boar kidneys
description: Kidneys are healthy if you do not eat them too often. Stew them and serve with some mushrooms.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Cobbler's kit
description: A set of tools for repairing boots and other leather items. Includes a cobber's hammer\, pliers\, lard\, wire\, rivets and various small nails.

name: Spade
description: Spades are for digging graves\, shovels are for tossing sand.

name: Vidlak poacher's gear
description: The gear that the Vidlak poacher was carrying on him. Evidence for Gamekeeper Vostatek.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Mead
description: A quality mead that tastes great\, warms you up and gives you strength.

name: Tin badge of resurrection
description: After an unlucky throw\, use this badge to <strong>throw again</strong>. Can be used <strong> once per game</strong>.

name: Lord's overcoat
description: Long lord's overcoat made of fine fabric\, decorated with rows of buttons. Perhaps every person in it looks robust and dignified.

name: Farmer Matthew's pitchfork
description: A pitchfork left here by farmer Matthew. Everyone in Tachov knows that wherever Matthew and his pitchfork go\, merriment follows. It seems Matthew may have gotten a bit too merry\, as he left his pitchfork behind.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Trosky pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord von Bergow\, owner of Trosky Castle.

name: Three die
description: For some reason\, this die usually rolls a three. Why?

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Plain laminar gauntlets
description: Simple arm and forearm armour composed of individual lamellae supplemented with elbow guards called couters.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Waffenrock of the Lords of Garbow
description: Waffenrock bearing the coat of arms of the Lords of Garbow.

name: Old nail
description: The nail used many years ago by the Troskowitz bailiff to mark the border between Tachov and Zhelejov. Too bad he didn't tell anyone about it.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Huntsman's lost key
description: The lost key to the gamekeeper's house\, he must have lost it on his way home from the tavern.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Kettle hat
description: A simple iron helmet for all poor squires. It is usually a good idea to wear it with a quilted hood with a collar\, as the helmet alone does not protect the cheeks or neck of the warrior. But it's cheap and can be repaired literally on your knee.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Laxative for Alshik
description: Some concoction that Olbram gave me. If I put it in Alshik's food\, it should really send him running…

name: Mail coif
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Jitschine beer
description: In Jitschine\, they brew a thick full-bodied beer that will satisfy every lover of the golden beverage.

name: Bread
description: They say not to bite the hand that feeds you. And if you can feed yourself\, just stuff your belly and shut up.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Key to painted chest
description: The key to a painted chest in which the lost charter of the Prague soldiers is hidden.

name: Flute
description: I'd rather not whistle on it. I don't want to be annoying like the fools I see on every corner.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Picatrix
description: <paragraph>A copy of a mysterious Arabic grimoire filled with descriptions of magical rituals\, the creation of artefacts and the secrets of planets.</paragraph>

name: Marksman's kit
description: A set of tools for keeping your bow or crossbow in good condition. Includes lubricant\, replacement bowstrings\, and tools to repair other minor damage.

name: Exotic wood
description: Ebony\, Zebrano\, Rosewood and other exotic woods have been valued since ancient times for their extraordinary hardness and beautiful colour palette. It is used to make fancy furniture\, weapons or chess pieces.

name: Hare pelt
description: A hare pelt. A common but useful material used for skirt hems\, hats and coats. It'll fetch a few groschen for sure.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Dead dwarf's thumb
description: A talisman made from the thumb of a dead dwarf is said to help a woman conceive a son. +2 erection bonus.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Riding boots - high
description: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process\, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle\, such as messengers and grooms.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Bloody knife
description: It may look ordinary\, but it has ripped open a very important belly.

name: Heavenly Kingdom die
description: A miraculous playing die\, sent down from the Heavenly Kingdom to earth.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Ambrose's broken sword
description: An old broken sword made of otherwise fine Damascene steel.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Dragon claw
description: Such a curved piece of a dragon must surely be his claw\, right?

name: Knights of the Cross hood
description: A hood with the emblem of the famous Order of the Knights of the cross.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Treasure Map - Fourth
description: Heplful to a person in material need. And in a time of supreme need\, it can be used to wipe one's arse too.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Simple shoes
description: Simple shoes\, also called krpce\, tied around the ankles with a lace. Footwear mainly of poorer families.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Nuremberg gauntlets
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmiths. Finger gloves of hourglass shape made with metal decoration and brass lining.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: The Cat and the Poet
description: A book originally from the remote islands of the west.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Smoked mutton
description: An excellent meat from curly Bohemian sheep\, raised in open paddocks and guarded by a red-haired boy with a whistle.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Wanderer's robe
description: An overcoat is made of thicker fabric and is designed for long journeys in bad weather. It is recommended by nine out of ten wanderers who have reached their destination.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Silver badge of fortune
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>reroll up to 2 dice</strong> Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Canker's mace
description: A mace of the leader of the bandits from the Troskowitz gorge. A crude weapon that cracked many a skull and was never properly wiped clean afterwards.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Grimy die
description: One could say it will get you out of the frying pan into the fire. And sometimes it will let you stew in your own juice.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Wolf heart
description: Wolf heart may be useful for some evil sorcery\, but a true Christian should not eat such a thing even if he were starving.

name: The Art of Demosthenes IV
description: A skill book on Speech. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Vidlak Pond poacher's gear
description: Poacher's kit found in a secret stash in the woods near the Vidlak pond. Proof for the gamekeeper - my dog should be able to track down its owner.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Copper
description: In ancient times\, copper was a very rare metal for making jewellery and weapons. Today it is mainly used for the production of tinware and for the smelting of other metals.

name: Sir Zavish heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Halved pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Henry's Lion perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 10 for 10 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 7.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Miners' Underground Map
description: A map of the Kuttenberg underground\, used by the miners themselves.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Noble's bascinet
description: A helmet with a klappvisor in a fashionable round pattern. It is much better adapted to the face\, so it is easier to breathe and the knight has a better view to the sides through the folded visors.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Decree of Markvart von Aulitz
description: <paragraph>A letter from King Sigismund of Luxembourg to Captain Markvart\, in which he commissions him to pursue the miscreants from the Italian Court.</paragraph>

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Cellar key
description: I wonder what this opens? And why was it hidden?

name: Lavish warhammer
description: The war hammer is considered by many to be as noble a weapon as the sword\, since it is used where there is no room for swordplay and hard blows need to be dealt. The war hammer is therefore designed to penetrate armour and crush bones in the heat of battle.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Weak Mintha perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 1 for 20 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 5.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Spiked horseshoe
description: It doesn't seem magical\, but the spikes on could prove useful when riding on rocky terrain.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Cabbage
description: Cabbage is a common ingredient of meals - and a healthy one at that!

name: Lockpick
description: A tool used for picking locks. Just don't get caught doing it.

name: Life in the Tavern III
description: A skill book on Drinking and alcoholism. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Kuttenberg Court Book
description: One of the copies of the court book from the Kuttenberg Rathaus. It contains a list of municipal laws.

name: Couters
description: Simple elbow pads. You can suffer all sorts of injuries in combat\, so it's best to protect yourself however you can.

name: Bagel
description: Jewish pastry with a beautifully soft crumb and a crispy crust.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Noose remnants
description: Remnants of a rope\, likely a noose.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Cooked roe deer loin
description: A tasty and not too fatty piece. As with other game\, the best meat comes from younger animals. It is advisable to let it hang out for some time before butchering\, as there is still too much blood in a freshly killed animal\, which makes the meat unnecessarily tough.

name: Drowner's map
description: Rough sketch of a map of the site by the pond.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Gambeson worn
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Hair strand relic
description: These few strands of hair are said to have belonged to Saint Barbara\, who was cruelly punished by her pagan father for accepting faith in Christ. As she fled from him\, she hid in a rock crevice\, which is why today she is the patron saint of all miners. Only a certain shepherd revealed her hiding place to her pursuers\, and the young maiden was captured and cruelly tortured into renouncing her faith. Finally\, after she was whipped and her breasts were cut off\, she was led naked to the execution block where she was beheaded by her own father.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Lousy gambler's die
description: A shoddy loaded die. It's quite noticeably unbalanced.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Flushing from the barrel
description: Good enough for the Prague folk.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Woodsman's Journal II
description: A skill book on Survival in the wilderness. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Spearman Training III
description: A skill book on Polearm combat. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Hanged man's key
description: A key found on a hanged man above the pond near Horschan.

name: Records chest key
description: The key to the chest in the secret mint where Vavak keeps his records.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Blue crayfish
description: A blue-green crayfish\, you don't see that every day.

name: Embroidered heater coat
description: A coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons. It is decorated with the symbol of Kuttenberg.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Smoked trout
description: Smoked trout is not as tasty as freshly baked\, but it definitely lasts longer and is still better than dried.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Pear sword pommel
description: The end of the hilt of the sword. It is struck against an iron tang\, which is then hammered and the pommel is thus fixed. It serves mainly to balance the whole weapon and as a counterweight to the long blade. In swordfighting\, it prevents the weapon from slipping out of the hand\, but it can also be used to grip and extend the hilt of the sword. Some swordfighting techniques use the pommel to deliver crushing blows to the opponent's face.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the subjects and the army\, is decorated with Kuttenberg symbols.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Horseradish
description: Horseradish with a flavour so sharp\, it could cut your tongue.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Hare's Heart
description: It might look awful\, but offal and entrails are all healthy\, the heart most of all. You can fry or boil them or add them to soups. The main thing is to use everything and not waste any of the carcass.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Gemstone silver ring
description: Such a precious ring is intended for noble lords and prelates. A poor man should be careful not to hang for selling it.

name: Strange little verse II
description: A strange verse\, probably referring to a certain place in Kuttenberg.

name: Milanese cuirass
description: An excellent piece from the Italian armoursmiths. Thanks to the perfect tempering and fine surface cannulation\, the sheet metal used can be much lighter and yet just as durable. The cuirass is composed of two parts that fit together perfectly to form an impenetrable shell on the knight's body.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Punches\, Kicks and a Few Slaps I
description: A skill book on Unarmed combat.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Thigh bone
description: A human thigh bone\, or femur in latin.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Hourglass gauntlets
description: The most commonly used type of iron gloves whose name refers to their typical hourglass-like shape. It protects not only the hand\, but also part of the forearm of the fighter.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Walnuts
description: Eating walnuts helps keep your nerves strong and your mind sharp. It's no coincidence their kernels look like that thing you carry around in your head.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Tin pitcher
description: Drinks served from pewter dishes taste a little strange\, but the pitcher sparkles and that's all that matters!

name: Copper ewer
description: A copper ewer reserved for noble guests and special occassions.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: A jacket of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, decorated with the coat of arms of the Polner family.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Beaked kettle hat
description: Iron hat with a wide brim. It covers the head well and at the same time\, thanks to conveniently placed cut-outs\, does not restrict the view\, which is an advantage especially for foot marksmen.

name: Sketch – Bearded axe
description: The bearded axe is a battle axe which is a simple tool in its origin\, but it can chop down shields as well as trees.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Straw hat with ribbon
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. Decorated with a ribbon\, such headgear certainly looks more cheerful.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Iron
description: Good quality malleable iron. The iron is soft\, but nicely homogenous\, so it can be used well for most blacksmithing products.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Kettle hat
description: A simple iron helmet for all poor squires. It is usually a good idea to wear it with a quilted hood with a collar\, as the helmet alone does not protect the cheeks or neck of the warrior. But it's cheap and can be repaired literally on your knee.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Commemorative ring
description: A ring given to me by the refugees from the mill as a thank you for God's blessing.

name: Wedding beer
description: A festive beer brewed for the Semine wedding. Full-bodied flavour with a dominant bitterness and honey aftertaste.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Parsnip
description: To make you last a long time. Healing from root to green bud.

name: As Quiet as a Cat IV
description: A skill book on Stealth. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Trollbane hammer stub
description: Even a weapon against non-human creatures will eventually be destroyed\, even by killing mere humans.

name: Spined kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal and therefore slightly more durable\, but still unnecessarily heavy. Its spin makes it better able to withstand blows to the head\, but it needs to be supplemented with a quilted hood or collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's cheeks or neck on its own.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Ius regale montanorum I
description: An abridged copy of the Royal Mining Law on the people in the mines.

name: Bandit's brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of forged slats hammerd on a leather vest is a slightly older form of protection than the fashionable metal cuirass. Both provide similar protection\, but the brigandine is a bit heavier\, but there are warriors who will not let it go. This one's been through a lot\, though\, and has had more than one owner. Most certainly haven't given her up willingly.

name: Greasy die
description: A more reliable die than a normal one\, but it cannot be relied on for everything.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Vejmola's house key
description: The key to the Vejmola's house.

name: The Art of Demosthenes II
description: A skill book on Speech. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Aim and Fire! II
description: A skill book on Marksmanship. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: On Prague
description: On the City of a Hundred Spires.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Hungarian knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Scrap metal
description: Malleable iron of questionable quality. It is a mixture of various scrap and waste iron. But as every blacksmith knows\, no iron can go to waste.

name: Pasha's crossbow
description: The crossbow that was to bring Pasha invincibility and God's favour. Unfortunately\, it failed.

name: Dried mutton
description: It's a pity for such a delicate meat as lamb\, but if you're already getting sick of it and you really don't know what to do with it…

name: Minting die
description: Authentic die for minting the Prague groschen.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Couters with rondel
description: Simple elbow pads with round rondels. Unless one can afford better armour\, every protection counts.

name: Deer ribs
description: Best to make a roast out of it and serve it with a fruit sauce. However\, make sure to bake it just long enough and be careful not to dry out the meat too much.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Cooked sheep stomach
description: This may not be the most popular meal ever\, but what can you do. The best way to prepare it is to fill it with whatever you like or have on hand\, sew it up and then boil it for a long time. A dish prepared in this way is very compact and portable and therefore suitable for travelling.

name: Embroidered bonnet
description: A quilted cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Map of the Zhelejov marshes
description: A map that was clutched by the hand of a skeleton in the Zelejov marshes.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Wreath
description: Wreath of meadow flowers. It looks nice\, it smells nice\, but it doesn't last very long. Plus\, it can attract bees.

name: Suchdol pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek\, owner of the Suchdol fortress.

name: Treatise on Nought
description: A remarkable treatise on the mystery of numbers and the symbol of emptiness.

name: Finger bone relic
description: A tiny fragment of bone\, which is said to have come from the hand of St. Maurice\, is certainly a very precious holy relic. In ancient times\, Saint Maurice was the commander of a Roman legion  that was decimated by the Emperor for refusing to sacrifice to pagan gods before battle. The martyr is the patron saint of soldiers\, weavers\, armourers and the protector of vine. This bone may indeed be genuine\, as the entire arm was once brought back by the Czech King Vladislav II and later distributed to many Czech churches.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Smoked pork
description: Smoked pig tastes best on plum wood.

name: Bascinet with bretèche
description: An older form of the bascinet with a removable wide bretache\, complete with a chainmail aventail protecting the warrior's neck and shoulders.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Bell-shaped bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet protecting the whole head except the face\, so it looks a bit like a bell. Very often used by marksmen because the face is not covered by any visor and it is easy to see the target.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Physician's journal
description: Physician's notes.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Plain laminar gauntlets
description: Simple arm and forearm armour composed of individual lamellae supplemented with elbow guards called couters.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our joint handiwork.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Simple headband
description: Coloured or embroidered strips of fabric or ribbons are a cheaper alternative to crowns and headbands\, popular especially among the poorer classes.

name: Von Bergow knight shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Bandit's brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of forged slats hammerd on a leather vest is a slightly older form of protection than the fashionable metal cuirass. Both provide similar protection\, but the brigandine is a bit heavier\, but there are warriors who will not let it go. This one's been through a lot\, though\, and has had more than one owner. Most certainly haven't given her up willingly.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Dried deer rump
description: Delicious hind leg meat. The topside cut makes for the best roast. Dice the rest and boil it in salted water. Now to make a good sauce to go with it\, crumble some bread in beer\, add a little vinegar and cook it with some pepper and cloves\, if you have them. Pour the sauce on top of the cooked venison and garnish with baked apples. This is how Severin the Younger advises deer to be prepared.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Hungarian knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Letter for the Abbot
description: A letter addressed to the Abbot of the Sedletz monastery\, written by the monk Slava.

name: Knight's soap
description: Soap made according to a secret recipe from the musk of noble war horses\, just like Sir Tobias used to sell at his stall in the old days. Cleansing for the mind and body\, and great for when you don't want people recognising you by scent.

name: Silver scraps
description: Scraps of a silver plate or waste from the minting of groschen. I reckon it's worth something.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Ordinary coat with crest
description: A plain coat\, made in red and white and decorated with symbols of Kuttenberg.

name: Kuttenberg sausauge
description: Kuttenberg sausage\, best with some cabbage.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Lousy Mary's concoction
description: What's on the heart is on the tongue and worse.

name: Lords of Leipa heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Broken axe
description: It must have been a beautiful weapon once\, but years underground have left an indelible mark on it.

name: Key to wager chest
description: A key found near two dead marksmen.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Devil's head die
description: A die that feels hot to the touch. In place of a one it has a devil's head\, which is not something folk like to gaze upon…

name: Broadsword
description: A light sword with a wide blade and a thin tip\, it stings like a wasp sting.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Common war hammer
description: The war hammer is considered by many to be as noble a weapon as the sword\, since it is used where there is no room for swordplay and hard blows need to be dealt. The war hammer is therefore designed to penetrate armour and crush bones in the heat of battle.

name: Troskowitz Chronicle
description: The history of Troskowitz\, written down by the famous Bailiff Brada.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Dried poppy
description: It is found abundantly in fields and furrows as a bothersome weed.

name: St. John's wort
description: It is most fond of leafy woods\, glades and clearings.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Perch
description: Perch or other fish are healthy\, you should eat a lot of them. You can season fish with spices and coat it in flour. Then fry it in butter. Finally\, sprinkle it generously with fried onion and serve with bread.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Fake thunderstone
description: A smooth stone that Thomlin tried to pass off as the true thunderstone. Though it doesn't have the same power as its authentic counterpart\, maybe it will bring you some good luck anyway.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Beaked kettle hat
description: Iron hat with a wide brim. It covers the head well and at the same time\, thanks to conveniently placed cut-outs\, does not restrict the view\, which is an advantage especially for foot marksmen.

name: Riding boots - high
description: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process\, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle\, such as messengers and grooms.

name: Light mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Smoked deer ribs
description: Best to make a roast out of it and serve it with a fruit sauce. However\, make sure to bake it just long enough and be careful not to dry out the meat too much.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Saxon bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor of an older drop-shaped pattern. The helmet is fitted with a wide chainmail aventail\, so it protects the whole head and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Water for Trosky devils
description: Interesting... and yet it looks like ordinary water from the well.

name: Lost purse
description: Lost and found again.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Peter of Suchotlesky's sword
description: A sword of the late knight Peter of Suchotlesky. It is an excellent weapon with a decorated pommel in the shape of a clenched fist.

name: Pepa's Sauerkraut
description: Sauerkraut from Pepa the dimwit. I don't know how the lad does it\, but this sauerkraut can cure anything.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Dried cheese
description: Drying gives cheese a more distinctive flavour. With some bread and a bit of ham\, it's a fine substitute for a hot meal.

name: Life in the Tavern II
description: A skill book on Drinking and alcoholism. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Common longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Rooster feathers
description: Black rooster feathers. They seem more fallen than plucked out.

name: Tied jester's hose
description: These colourful trousers are worn by jesters and generally eccentric people. The higher quality suggests that whoever had them made was very serious about their insouciance.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Dried wolf meat
description: Only eat wolf meat in an emergency and always keep it in flames for a long time beforehand so that all the evil is burned away. Also\, you must never eat too much of it\, for then you may become afflicted by a bad disease or a cruel curse.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Shed key
description: The key to the shed at the mill.

name: Wreath
description: Wreath of meadow flowers. It looks nice\, it smells nice\, but it doesn't last very long. Plus\, it can attract bees.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Recipe for Hair o' the Dog
description: Reduces drunkenness or\, in better quality\, removes it completely. In better qualities it also helps with hangovers or alcoholism.

name: Village hazel bow
description: A homemade weak bow made of hazel wood. It's not very strong or accurate\, but it'll do for a rabbit or a fox.

name: Tailor's kit
description: A set of tools for repairing clothing and quilted items. Includes fabric for patches\, scissors\, needles and various threads.

name: Bandage
description: A longer strip of clean cloth that can safely stop bleeding.

name: Dry Devil's longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Bawdy Whistle Tune
description: That must have been a torture live.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Deer meat
description: Deer meat has its place on every Lord's table. It has a firmer texture\, yet is lean and easily digestible. The meat of younger animals up to three years of age is usually the most valued\, the meat of older animals is usually firmer and more aromatic\, especially suitable for making stews.

name: Tin badge of transmutation
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>change a die of your choosing to a 3</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Prokop's first wine
description: The young winemaker Prokop's first vintage. It's drinkable…

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Bascinet with bretèche
description: An older form of the bascinet with a removable wide bretache\, complete with a chainmail aventail protecting the warrior's neck and shoulders.

name: A treatise on the beauty of the crossbow
description: A treatise by the venerable Albrecht the Sharpshooter on why the crossbow is the new bow. Can be read from level 10 of marksmanship.

name: Merchant's coat
description: A simple merchant's coat with a flare and a wider skirt. It is intended to convey the traditional impression of the wearer's trustworthiness and wealth.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Dandelion
description: Grows everywhere as a weed\, but mostly on grassy slopes and meadows it is to be found.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Letter for King Wenceslas
description: Letter from Jobst of Luxembourg to Wenceslas IV

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Padded chausses
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Silver badge of might
description: Using it will allow you to roll <strong>one extra die</strong>. Can be used <strong>twice per game</strong>

name: Executioner's badge of advantage
description: You gain a new dice combination called <strong>The Gallows</strong>\, which consists of <strong>4\, 5 and 6</strong>.

name: Tin badge of headstart
description: You gain a <strong>small point lead</strong> at the start of the game.

name: Silver doppelganger badge
description: You <strong>double the score of your last throw</strong>. Can be used <strong>twice per game</strong>

name: Gold warlord's badge
description: You <strong>double the score of your turn</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Kuttenberg knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Aujezd beer
description: Weak beer with no taste\, almost indistinguishable from muddy pond water.

name: Broken bolt
description: Nothing can mend this irrepairable damage to the dignity of this once fine and dandy bolt.

name: As Quiet as a Cat I
description: A skill book on Stealth.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Deer skin
description: A well tanned deer skin. Fine and highly prized leather\, used for higher quality products and a wealthier clientele.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Player mark
description: A secret player mark to enter the lair of the All Saints.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Bacon
description: Fine smoked bacon\, filling and pleasing.

name: Suspicious relic
description: A silver cross with a reliquary said to hold the foot bone of St. James.

name: Belladonna
description: It grows in clearings and in leafy woods\, but it is best not to seek it at all.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Smoked dog meat
description: Meat from a cute little doggie. Slice it\, salt it lightly\, roast it… what a bliss.

name: Simple headband
description: Coloured or embroidered strips of fabric or ribbons are a cheaper alternative to crowns and headbands\, popular especially among the poorer classes.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Thistle
description: Thistle grows in roadside ditches\, in clearings and where there is shade and relief from strong sunlight.

name: Felt cap
