description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Couters with rondel
description: Simple elbow pads with round rondels. Unless one can afford better armour\, every protection counts.

name: Cave mushroom
description: A mushroom from a damp cave. It is not advisable to eat it alone\, but some alchemical recipes will definitely use it.

name: Dried marigold
description: Grows where the earth is fertile - on rubble piles and dung and abundantly too in pastures.

name: Wanderer's robe
description: An overcoat is made of thicker fabric and is designed for long journeys in bad weather. It is recommended by nine out of ten wanderers who have reached their destination.

name: Gnarly's club
description: The Semine captain's club looks as crooked and old as he does. So perhaps it'll be just as good at smashing enemies.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Tournament bolt
description: An excellent bolt for practice shooting\, but otherwise useless.

name: Chronicle of the Knights of the Cross
description: Old chronicle of the Knights of the Cross with a red star. The blank sheets of parchment at the end of the book reveal that its author never finished it.

name: Vineyard cellar key
description: The key to the vineyard cellar in Loretz.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: Charles IV
description: About the greatest ruler of the Kingdom of Bohemia\, Charles IV\, who excelled above all other kings and raised the country from the ashes.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Large copper kettle
description: A large copper kettle offers great pleasure... when it's full\, that is.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Boar's tusk
description: Nice trophy from the boar hunt\, who knows how many asses this boar's tusk has torn. Suitable for charming the ladies\, but also for various elixirs.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Competition hunting sword
description: Light\, perfectly balanced and sharp so that the feather is cut in half by its own weight when it hits the blade. That's what this hunting sword should be\, but...

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Brigandine gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Nuremberg plate gauntlets
description: Full arm and forearm protection made of precision-forged and perfectly aligned metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass lining on the edges. It is named after the famous armour workshops in Nuremberg\, Germany\, where it may have originated\, but is now commonly made in other cities.

name: Old notes on the fire investigation
description: Some old scribbled notes from Seneschal Ambrose on the fire investigation.

name: Foreign fragrant oil
description: A foreign oil that is added to baths to make the water smell nice. This one is particularly odorous.

name: Dried boar rump
description: You can serve boar leg with rosehip sauce or cabbage\, but never cook it the same way twice in a row.

name: Dry Devil's longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Rikonaris' sabre
description: A good sabre worthy of the Voivode's position. Its wielder is not to be underestimated\, for even the slightest cut can cause a terrible curse. At least to those who believe in such things.

name: Short chainmail
description: Shortened chainmail shirt with long sleeves.

name: Better piercing arrow
description: A well-balanced arrow with a heavy arrowhead designed to pierce armour.

name: Recipe for Scattershot gunpowder
description: Gunpowder for shooting scrap iron and other small projectiles. It'll pierce anyone at close range\, hit no one at a distance.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Mint master's key
description: The key to the treasury of the Italian Court.

name: Leaf-shaped couters
description: Simple knee pads called couters with a leaf to improve protection against slashing blows.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Feverfew
description: A plant that is widely cultivated and used to reduce fever. In many languages\, therefore\, its name refers precisely to this beneficial property.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Kuttenberg execution book
description: One of the copies of the execution book from the Kuttenberg Town Hall. It records the testimonies and statements of captured criminals.

name: On the Composition of Alchemy I
description: A skill book on Alchemy

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Ornate hunting crossbow
description: An tastefully decorated light crossbow that can be drawn with bare hands. It would be a shame to hunt with such a beautiful weapon!

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Noble's plate legs
description: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability\, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the subjects and the army\, is decorated with Kuttenberg symbols.

name: Dried chamomile
description: Most often it is found in fields and fertile land.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Caught thief's map
description: The map that the caught thief had in his possession. I wonder what it leads to?

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Noble quilted trousers
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Dried roe deer loin
description: A tasty and not too fatty piece. As with other game\, the best meat comes from younger animals. It is advisable to let it hang out for some time before butchering\, as there is still too much blood in a freshly killed animal\, which makes the meat unnecessarily tough.

name: The Art of Demosthenes I
description: A skill book on Speech.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Noble's bascinet
description: A helmet with a klappvisor in a fashionable round pattern. It is much better adapted to the face\, so it is easier to breathe and the knight has a better view to the sides through the folded visors.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Smoked boar rump
description: You can serve boar leg with rosehip sauce or cabbage\, but never cook it the same way twice in a row.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Mysterious map
description: A map marking the ambush site\, scribbled with charcoal.

name: City of Prague pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Noble's plate legs
description: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability\, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Lord Pisek heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Treasure map - First
description: The greatest treasure are the friends we have made along the way.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Rider's war hammer
description: The war hammer is considered by many to be as noble a weapon as the sword\, since it is used where there is no room for swordplay and hard blows need to be dealt. The war hammer is therefore designed to penetrate armour and crush bones in the heat of battle.

name: Sketch – Shell hunting sword
description: A beautiful hunting sword with a hilt made of deer antler will not disgrace even a nobleman. It is usually used to put out hunted game\, but it will also help against uninvited forest visitors.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Bane poison recipe
description: Depletes 110 health and therefore leads to certain death. In better quality\, it depletes health faster. It's better for poisoning cauldrons than applying to weapons.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Treasure map - Second
description: He who finds a friend finds a treasure. Usually in his pocket...

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Odd moonshine
description: Schnapps from the hidden stash. Judging by the smell\, it's bound to have the right kick.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Royal waiter's certificate
description: A certificate proving eligibility of a waiter to serve His Majesty\, King Sigismund of Luxembourg.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Shrinking die
description: A very lightly loaded die. One can barely differentiate it from an ordinary die.

name: Poacher's gear from Kopanina
description: Poacher's kit found in the woods of Kopanina. My dog should be able to track down its owner.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Recipe for Soap
description: You can't wash your own clothes without soap.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Aim and Fire! III
description: A skill book on Marksmanship. Can be read from level 10 of the skill.

name: Pinot Noir 1402
description: 1402 was an excellent vintage and the winemaker clearly had considerable talent. This is the best wine ever made here.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: As Quiet as a Cat III
description: A skill book on Stealth. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Hungarian pavese
description: A cavalry pavese with Hungarian symbols.

name: Smoked horse meat
description: It's a shame about a good horse\, but if there's nothing else to eat... And it'll taste better with a little smoke.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Painter's muse
description: A head full of ideas\, whispering into the artist's ear.

name: Most Faithful Friend IV
description: A skill book on Houndmaster. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Silesian cap
description: Scooped cap of linen cloth or felt with a wide raised hem\, split in two at the front. Especially popular north of Bohemia.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Marikľa
description: Roma bread made from flour\, water and salt.

name: Village elm bow
description: A homemade stronger bow made of elm. Elm wood is flexible and hard to split\, so it is excellent for making very precise bows.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Beggar's coat
description: A beggar's overcoat is all patch and almost falling apart. Still\, in a pinch\, it's better than nothing.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Lord Capon's longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Amanita muscaria
description: Commonly known as 'fly agaric'\, this brightly-coloured mushrooms attracts attention\, but consuming it is potentially life-threatening! However\, in small doses it can provide a variety of effects\, which alchemists commonly make use of.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Feast of the Dead
description: About food and death.

name: Revenant's coffin nail
description: A nail from the coffin of a revenant is said to protect its wearer from those who've returned from the dead. +3 damage to undead.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Deboned trout
description: A tasty freshwater fish\, ideal for frying\, baking\, or adding to a soup. How come this one doesn't have a single bone?

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Tin pitcher
description: Drinks served from pewter dishes taste a little strange\, but the pitcher sparkles and that's all that matters!

name: Broken Roman soldier's spear
description: Remnants of the spear that allegedly pierced Christ's body. The broken spearhead is covered in a dried black substance.

name: Soap
description: Soap\, a mix of fat\, ash\, and who knows what else. Combined with water\, it works miracles on dirty clothes.

name: Mended cuirass
description: This cuirass has been in a fight before... and not for the first time. Battered\, full of patches\, but still a piece of metal that can make the difference between life and death for an unheralded warrior.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Elderberry leaves
description: This plant has a wide range of uses. The berries can be made into juice or sweet wine\, its flowers and leaves are often used in folk medicine. Its flowers can also be covered in batter and fried. This flavourful dish is called 'Kosmatice'.

name: Marksman's bolt
description: A bolt with great range and high accuracy.

name: Ordinary arrow
description: A common arrow used to fire from a bow.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Lost farmhouse key
description: The lost key to the farmhouse\, found its place under the bridge at the Zhelejov tavern.

name: Excerpt from the horse registry
description: A tear-out sheet with the names of the horses and their sale price.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Sketch – Homemade hunting sword
description: A terrible skull opener or a mere figment of the tortured mind of a clumsy apprentice who abused the blacksmith's craft to create such wickedness and called it a hunting sword?

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Dried pork
description: Dried pig is excellent for long trips to the mountains...

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Yew hunting bow
description: Hunting bows are supposed to be strong enough to bring down larger game. This bow is made of yew\, and besides an inattentive deer\, it can also torment many a trapper\, if he is not wearing an iron skin.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Marathon I
description: A skill book on Vitality.

name: Plate knight gauntlets
description: Better hand protection is a must in combat because as they say: hands go first in any fight.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Secret gambling den die
description: This die will not only secure me an easy win but also grant me entry into select circles.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Saint Veronica's veil
description: The veil that Saint Veronica used to wipe the blood and sweat off the forehead of Jesus Christ.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Heavy mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Pitch
description: A thick black oil produced by the charcoal-burning process and used to fill barrels and treat ropes and fishing nets. Pitch-soaked fabrics are waterproof but also more flamable.

name: Decorated sword pommel
description: The end of the hilt of the sword. It is struck against an iron tang\, which is then hammered and the pommel is thus fixed. It serves mainly to balance the whole weapon and as a counterweight to the long blade. In swordfighting\, it prevents the weapon from slipping out of the hand\, but it can also be used to grip and extend the hilt of the sword. Some swordfighting techniques use the pommel to deliver crushing blows to the opponent's face.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: City of Prague pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Kuttenberg heater shield
description: A beautiful and solid knight's shield made by the master armourer Nicolas Krondel from Kuttenberg. It bears the colours of the mining town and is an example of excellent craftsmanship.

name: The Strength of the Knight I
description: A skill book on Strength.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Cooking scraps
description: Various leftovers from cooking all those delicacies for the wedding. It's just enough as a beggar's alms\, but the Semine cook is saving it for leaner times. She's definitely against letting it be eaten by the riffraff.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Map to the secret mint
description: Map showing the location of the secret mint.

name: Saxon bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor of an older drop-shaped pattern. The helmet is fitted with a wide chainmail aventail\, so it protects the whole head and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: City of Prague heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Open bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet forged from a single piece of sheet metal. In this basic form\, it has no bretache or klappvisor and therefore does not protect the warrior's face.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Dead rat
description: A rat carcass that barely resembles a rodent any more.

name: Tin badge of defence
description: Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's tin badge.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Sacrifice to the demon
description: A handful of food for the mine demon.

name: Wayfarer's map II
description: A map to a site where there's treasure.

name: Short chainmail
description: Shortened chainmail shirt with long sleeves.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Dried beef
description: Nothing goes better with everyday work in the fields than some good beef jerky.

name: Ordinary coat with crest
description: A plain coat\, made in red and white and decorated with symbols of Kuttenberg.

name: Recipe for Painkiller brew
description: Suppresses injury effects and reduces how much maximum stamina decreases with health.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Poacher's map
description: Map showing hunting spots around Suchdol.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Ockham's Razor
description: A dagger that can rid the world of superfluous entities and retain only the most essential - God.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Gold badge of defence
description: Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's gold badge.

name: Gold badge of resurrection
description: After an unlucky throw\, you can <strong>throw again</strong>. Can be used <strong>three times per game</strong>.

name: Cinnamon
description: Expensive foreign spice excellent for gingerbread and meat.

name: Strange little verse IV
description: A strange verse\, probably referring to a certain place in Kuttenberg.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Magic arrowhead
description: The magic arrowhead from Karel the Arrow's head.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Lute strings
description: Lute strings made of sheep gut.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cheese
description: A wedge of cheese. When it's properly aged\, it lasts a long time and is filling.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Scattershot
description: A pile of scrap iron and rocks tied up in a small bag. It'll shred anyone at close range\, but at a distance it's rather useless.

name: Gemstone rosary
description: A rosary embedded with a precious gem. May God forgive me for my vanity.

name: Quilted coat
description: Quilted thick coat\, suitable for every splash and slots.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Wayfarer's map III
description: A map to a site where there's treasure.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Sketch – Knight's horseshoes
description: A blacksmith's horseshoe sketch. Because every master had to start somehow.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Sweet pancake
description: A sweet pancake made of milk\, flour and eggs.

name: Boiled wolf meat
description: Only eat wolf meat in an emergency and always keep it in flames for a long time beforehand so that all the evil is burned away. Also\, you must never eat too much of it\, for then you may become afflicted by a bad disease or a cruel curse.

name: Cockerel recipe
description: Increases energy and in better qualities slows down fatigue.

name: Knight's sword
description: An older form of a knight's sword. Slightly heavier at the tip\, therefore best suited for fighting slower\, heavily armoured foes.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Die of misfortune
description: They say that when it rains\, it pours. But if you play with this die\, the only thing pouring will be your tears.

name: Fer die
description: The third and last in the line of demonic dice.

name: Sketch – Cuman fokos
description: Cuman long-handled fokosz. A fast and agile weapon of the Hungarian raiders. It can pierce light armour or the skull of a good Christian.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Elm longbow
description: A long strong bow made of elm. It can hardly be compared to the famous English longbows\, but it can still do a lot of damage both in the woods and on the (war) fields.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Life in the Saddle I
description: A skill book on Horse Riding.

name: Guild Longsword
description: Very bright was that sword when it was made whole again; the light of the sun shone redly in it\, and the light of the moon shone cold\, and its edge was hard and keen.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: Lords of Hradetz knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Henbane
description: It grows in sunny and warm places\, especially on dung and rubble.

name: Vrchlitz water
description: Water from the Bach stream that's been distilled and purified several times. It might even be drinkable now.

name: Jester's disguise
description: A colourful coat decorated with jingle bells and an equally colourful jester's hood are worn by the minstrels in an attempt to attract the audience's attention. Be careful not to burst out laughing.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Fur-lined hat
description: A fur-lined hat is favourite among the sholars andwise doctors.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Vagrant's hat
description: A simple felt hat with a wide brim protects your head from the sun and rain. For a poor vagrant\, it's often his only possession besides his own rucksack.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Historia Troiana
description: The story of the mythical Trojan War\, describing the siege of the wealthy ancient city of Troy by the Greek army and its ruthless conquest by the Mycenaean king.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Towards Flexibility of the Body I
description: A skill book on Agility.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: White buck's hide
description: A beautiful white hide taken from a buck. Found in the poachers' camp in the forest near Suchdol.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Map hidden at Vostatek
description: A map I found  hidden at Hunter Vostatek's.

name: Most Faithful Friend II
description: A skill book on Houndmaster. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Lord's overcoat
description: Long lord's overcoat made of fine fabric\, decorated with rows of buttons. Perhaps every person in it looks robust and dignified.

name: Blacksmith's chest key
description: An old\, dusty key.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Italian bascinet
description: A helmet with a fashionable italian klappvisor. It is a good middle ground between price and armour durability. Lately\, this helmet has become very popular among mercenaries.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Enhanced hunting bolt
description: A balanced bolt for hunting game.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Old field crossbow
description: An old war crossbow. It has considerable strength\, so its arms must be cocked by means of an iron lever called the Goat's Foot. Worn and repaired several times\, but still guaranteed to take down many enemies without proper armour.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Baker guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. Baking a crispy\, crunchy pretzel is a royal art. The Bakers and Millers Guild is one of the most influential in Kuttenberg.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Letter from Bishop Thomas III.
description: A few lines full of important reports from the Hungarian Bishop Thomas of the city of Erlau.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Bird king's badge
description: The badge of the rightful king of the birds will allow you to roll an <strong>additional die</strong>. Can be used <strong>twice per game</strong>.

name: Lord's overcoat
description: Long lord's overcoat made of fine fabric\, decorated with rows of buttons. Perhaps every person in it looks robust and dignified.

name: Carrot
description: A root vegetable\, healthy\, juicy\, and sweet. Good in soups and mash. Can be eaten raw as well.

name: Gnarly's shield
description: Gnarly's shield

name: Vineyard herbicide
description: A strange concoction smelling of oil and hemlock. If it's supposed to kill weeds\, it'll surely work on humans too.

name: Italian hauberk
description: Lightweight short chainmail shirt with shortsleeves.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Hunting sword
description: The hunting sword is the faithful companion of every hunter or poacher. It is usually used to finish off hunted game\, but it's also handy for cutting kindling for a fire.

name: Grund smeltery ledgers
description: A copy of the ledgers of the smelters in Grund.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Fitted coat
description: A fitted coat made of good fabric with a wider skirt will make its wearer look good in any better company.

name: St. Stephen's die
description: A die blessed by St. Stephen\, guaranteeing favourable numbers in the game and protection from loose stones.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Hired hand Ventza's map
description: Hired hand Ventza's map.

name: Sack of silver ore
description: A sack of mined silver ore isn't exactly the lightest thing in the world.

name: Poacher's squirrel tail
description: A squirrel's tail\, used to identify members of Mach of Marschowitz's band of poachers. The local huntsman is sure to pay a bounty for these.

name: Lard
description: Rendered lard for various alchemical recipes.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Gold badge of headstart
description: Using this badge will give you a <strong>large point lead</strong> at the start of the game.

name: Sage
description: Can be found in pastures and on hillsides.

name: As Quiet as a Cat II
description: A skill book on Stealth. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Salt
description: A mineral suitable for flavouring dishes. To some it's more precious than gold.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Tournament gauntlets
description: Iron gauntlets that were lent to me as part of the equipment for the Kuttenberg tournament.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Lute
description: A lute perfect for a wandering bard.

name: Pie die
description: Doesn't look particularly tasty\, but it's well balanced towards lower numbers.

name: Boar meat
description: Here is a good way for preparing wild boar meat. Cook the meat until tender. Crumble some bread and boil it in beer\, add a little vinegar and salt. Slice some apples and fry them in lard. Then serve everything together You can also prepare pork and beef this way\, but trust me that wild game meat is the most delicious.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Psalmi penitentiales
description: Petrarch's Book of Psalms.

name: Knight's key
description: A key found on the body of a knight in the mines near Old Kutna.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Darko's map
description: Map of the mercenary's hideout.

name: Old sword
description: This sword has been through a lot\, and with a little care\, could still be.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Gold wedding badge
description: A memento of Agnes and Olda's big day. Using it allows you to <strong>reroll up to three dice</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: oblehaniSuchdole_flag
description: May it be a light for you in dark places\, when all other lights go out.

name: White roebuck's hide
description: A white hide taken from a young roebuck. It's sad\, I reckon there aren't many white roebucks in the region.

name: Towards Flexibility of the Body IV
description: A skill book on Agility. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Straight sword guard
description: A cross guard\, also known as quillon. It serves to protect the swordsman's hands from the opponent's blade. It can also be used to execute a grappling hold or strike to an unprotected face. In sword making\, it is put on the blade's tail before the hilt is made and the pommel is put on. In cheap weapons made by poor blacksmiths\, it will loosen over time and begin to clink unpleasantly.

name: Sheepskin
description: A sheepskin. It'll take some time before it's processed into wool\, then into broadcloth\, but I'm sure it'll make a fine hat or skirt one day.

name: Cooked carrot
description: When cooked\, it becomes soft and sweet. You can use it to improve any dish\, or just eat it as is.

name: Livre du ciel et du monde
description: Or\, The Book about the Heavens and the Earth is an important work by the French philosopher and astronomer Nicole Oresme. In the book he speculates\, among other things\, that the visible movement of the heavenly bodies from the earth may be only apparent and its real cause is the movement of the earth through the cosmos.

name: City of Prague pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Burgher coat
description: A burgher overcoat made of fine fabric with rich embrodiery and decorated buttons.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Common ladies shoes
description: A common ladies leather shoes with a round toe\, also known as crocs. They are worn by women and girls from the whole society.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Wine from Loretz
description: The cream of Loretz vineyards and the pride of Kuttenberg burghers. People say it doesn't give a hangover.

name: Wanderer's robe
description: An overcoat is made of thicker fabric and is designed for long journeys in bad weather. It is recommended by nine out of ten wanderers who have reached their destination.

name: Crude bolt
description: A cheap\, homemade bolt. It's unbalanced and veers off\, but it's hard to tell exactly where.

name: Lords of Holohlavy heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Child's skull
description: A child's skull I dug up in the Sedletz cemetary.

name: Competition sword
description: Light\, perfectly balanced and so sharp that a feather is cut in half by its own weight when it hits the blade. That's what this blade should be\, but…

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Map of Maleshov tower
description: Sketch of the interior of the tower at Maleshov Fortress given to me by Rosa Ruthard

name: Broad axe
description: The battle axe\, called a broadaxe\, is related to the ordinary carpenter's axe\, but is much lighter and forged specifically for combat. It's a good weapon against shields and chain mail.

name: Milanese brigandine
description: Composite armour according to an Italian tradition. It is actually a fake plate cuirass sewn into cow leather. Its arched belly disperses blows better than ordinary lamellae. The armour is also fitted with a wide skirt at the bottom\, so that it covers the knight's groin.

name: Favourable die
description: A playing die that brings luck more often than you'd expect

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Lords of Holohlavy heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Saxon Hauberk
description: A long chainmail shirt with short sleeves covering only the arms of its wearer.

name: Knight's longsword
description: Original long swords have a slightly wider blade and a pronounced groove for durability. They are not weapons for decoration\, but noble blades to uphold knightly honour and family tradition.

name: Last Will of Charles IV
description: The last will of Emperor Charles bound in covers\, to be preserved for posterity.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Couters
description: Simple elbow pads. You can suffer all sorts of injuries in combat\, so it's best to protect yourself however you can.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Brass brooch with lettering
description: A beautiful jewel with a stone in the colour of the depths of a forest pool. Many girls' hearts will be enchanted\, but what can be done\, it's still just a polished brass.

name: Praguers' hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Wayfarer's map IV
description: A map to a site where there's treasure.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Fresh milk
description: Fresh milk that farmer Fowl was hiding away.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Simple headband
description: Coloured or embroidered strips of fabric or ribbons are a cheaper alternative to crowns and headbands\, popular especially among the poorer classes.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: A jacket of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, decorated with the coat of arms of the Lord of Nebak.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Marigold
description: Grows where the earth is fertile - on rubble piles and dung and abundantly too in pastures.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Beaked kettle hat
description: Iron hat with a wide brim. It covers the head well and at the same time\, thanks to conveniently placed cut-outs\, does not restrict the view\, which is an advantage especially for foot marksmen.

name: Radzig Kobyla's longsword
description: A sword forged by my father for Sir Radzig Kobyla\, which was later stolen by that scoundrel Istvan Toth.

name: Riding cuirass
description: Solid front plackart with a thin bar to prevent the tip of a polearm from slipping into the noble neck. The cuirass is made of tempered sheet metal to withstand the potential impact of a spear in a frontal collision of a knight's ride.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Metamorphoses IV
description: The fourth book of the Roman poet Ovid\, in which the hero Perseus tells how he beheaded the mythical Gorgon Medusa\, who had poisonous snakes for hair and whose terrible gaze turned her opponents to stone.

name: Half plate legs
description: Partial leg protection\, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who\, for some reason\, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea\, though.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Sketch – Lovarian horseshoes
description: A blacksmith's horseshoe sketch. Because every master had to start somehow.

name: Tin plate
description: Plate armour for a knight on a budget. (Disclaimer: Don't actually use it as armour.)

name: Fragments from the Bible
description: A skill book on Scholarship.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Butcher's apron
description: A long inner tunic joined with butcher's apron.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Hungarian heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Dog skin
description: Pelt from a dog. If anyone ever wanted it\, just don't tell them how you got it.

name: Parler's spectacles
description: Hours and hours spent hunched over drawings take a heavy toll on a person. With lenses like these\, however\, a master builder won't leave out a single gargoyle\, thin curve of a pointed arch\, or delicate outline of a pinnacle.

name: Frilled colourful dress
description: A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Hunting sword
description: The hunting sword is the faithful companion of every hunter or poacher. It is usually used to finish off hunted game\, but it's also handy for cutting kindling for a fire.

name: Horseradish
description: Horseradish with a flavour so sharp\, it could cut your tongue.

name: Cellar door key
description: The key to the cellar door.

name: Watermelon slice
description: A slice of ripe watermelon.

name: Spearman Training II
description: A skill book on Polearm combat. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Cook's specialty
description: It smells like regular ham\, so I don't know what's so special about it.

name: Frilled veil
description: Veils\, or also wimples belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Tournament arrow
description: An arrow designed for tournament shooting\, not suitable for combat.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Bone comb
description: Perhaps a beautiful maiden used it to comb her hair\, or maybe some filthy beggar combed lice out of his beard with it. You never know.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Carrion sack
description: The knacker's sack for carrying carrion. It smells just like you'd expect it to.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Adorned axe
description: The beautiful axe from the legend of the two woodcutters was lost for many years\, but Henry of Skalitz found it and restored it to its former glory.

name: Lepiota
description: You can easily recognise the lepiota even at a distance. It's tall and has a wide cap.

name: Veisar's doghouse key
description: The rusty key to the shed where the greengrocer Veisar locks his dog Monarch.

name: Grimey skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: The Art of the Sword III
description: A skill book on Sword combat. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Frilled colourful dress
description: A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Dried henbane
description: It grows in sunny and warm places\, especially on dung and rubble.

name: Pretzel
description: Pretzel\, with salt and caraway\, dried and hard.

name: Rooster's egg
description: An egg laid by a rooster\, or a very strange hen.

name: Mach's chest key
description: A key to a chest found in the possession of the poacher\, Mach of Marschowitz.

name: Von Bergow knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Saxon kettle hat
description: An iron hat forged from a single piece of sheet metal so that it is lighter and at the same time can withstand all kinds of blows. One of the finest helmets a simple squire can afford. Of course\, it must be worn with a quilted or chainmail collar\, as it does not protect the warrior's neck or shoulders.

name: Statuette of St. Barbara
description: A wooden statuette of St. Barbara made by an unknown wood carver.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Simple shoes
description: Simple shoes\, also called krpce\, tied around the ankles with a lace. Footwear mainly of poorer families.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Hunting coat
description: A simple hunting coat allows its wearer freedom of movement and sufficient comfort when wandering after prey.

name: Strange message
description: Why was Stephen Crow carrying this in his pocket?

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Weak Lullaby potion
description: Reduces Energy to 0 and decreases perception.

name: Knight's notes IV
description: Sir Taras Mura's notes\, found in the mines near Old Kutna.

name: The Rule of St. Dismas III
description: A skill book on Thievery. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Wounding arrow
description: An arrow with serrated arrowhead to increase damage and bleeding.

name: Wine from Casper's Vineyards
description: Wine from the vineyards of Casper Rudolf. It must be said that his product has greatly improved judging by its aroma\, but whether his Burgundy vine will achieve the fame of Burgundy wines? Who knows\, but there's only one way to find out.

name: Rocktower Pond poacher's kit
description: The gear the poacher from Rocktower pond was carrying on him. It'll serve as evidence for Gamekeeper Vostatek.

name: Old Town of Prague knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Recipe for Digestive Potion
description: Reduces Nourishment and cures food poisoning and in better quality any poisoning. In better qualities it also increases Vitality.

name: Grozav's lucky die
description: It is actually not all that lucky\, but don't tell anyone!

name: Falchion
description: An older cousin of the broad-bladed sword. A somewhat outdated weapon for some\, perhaps\, but there's nothing like tried and tested methods on the battlefield.

name: Halved pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Black feathers
description: You shouldn't brag about your own feathers\, but this isn't mine. On the other hand\, who would I brag to?

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
