description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Elm hunting bow
description: Hunting bows are supposed to be strong enough to bring down larger game. This bow is made of elm\, but it is still a bit stiffer than it should be. It's almost as if it was made to hunt two-legged vermin.

name: Schnapps
description: A strong booze will burn away all physical and mental ailments.

name: Zizka's mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Common mace
description: A mace with steel flanges is a formidable weapon\, yet it is still nimbler than a simple axe. It can crush and break bones even through quality plate armour.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Padded chausses
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Roe deer kidneys
description: Because they contains a lot of good tallow\, you can mash them and add them to other drier dishes or porridges to improve the taste.

name: City of Prague pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of the Old Town of Prague.

name: Plain troubadours' hose
description: These colourful hose are worn by troubadours\, jesters and generally eccentric people who like to play pranks on others.

name: Blacksmith's kit
description: A set of tools for quickly repairing your weapons. Includes a hammer\, whetstone\, small pliers and mineral oil.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Tunic
description: The lower linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as an essential part of their clothing. Of course\, if you're not exactly a craftsman at work\, it's polite to complement it with a woollen outer garment.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Henry's longsword
description: A sword forged by my father for Sir Radzig Kobyla\, which was later stolen by that scoundrel Istvan Toth.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Bezoar
description: A rare stone with supposedly magical powers that can cure poisoning and is even said to bring good luck. But how it ended up in an animal's stomach is a truly disturbing mystery.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Knight's notes II
description: Notes of Knight Taras Mura\, found in the mines near Old Kutna.

name: Aim and Fire! I
description: A skill book on Marksmanship.

name: Riding boots - high
description: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process\, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle\, such as messengers and grooms.

name: Enhanced piercing bolt
description: A balanced bolt with a piercing effect against a variety of armours.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Rounded pewter jug
description: Drinks served from pewter dishes taste a little strange\, but the pitcher sparkles and that's all that matters!

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Training longsword
description: A wooden longsword that can bruise but not kill. For those who are serious about swordsmanship\, this is an invaluable tool for practicing.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Broken guild longsword
description: The famous symbol of the Kuttenberg swordfighting hall is in two pieces due to disputes between Menhart and Jimram.

name: Roast duck
description: A quarter of roast duck will fill you up nicely.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Wreath
description: Wreath of meadow flowers. It looks nice\, it smells nice\, but it doesn't last very long. Plus\, it can attract bees.

name: Jester's disguise
description: A colourful coat decorated with jingle bells and an equally colourful jester's hood are worn by the minstrels in an attempt to attract the audience's attention. Be careful not to burst out laughing.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Staff
description: A wooden pole without reinforced ends\, so it wouldn't hurt so much during infantry training. It can also be used at any time to prove that there are no small men only small targets.

name: Dead man's ear
description: A talisman made from the head of a dead man\, buried under a full moon. It's said to protect a thief from dogs. +2 to howling at the moon.

name: Remedies for Fleas and Warts
description: How to get rid of fleas and cure warts.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: The Maidens' War II
description: About how the Maidens' war ended.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Fur-lined hat
description: A fur-lined hat is favourite among the sholars andwise doctors.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Rare fabrics
description: A bundle of rare dyed fabrics.

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Lords of Hradetz knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Fur-lined hat
description: A fur-lined hat is favourite among the sholars andwise doctors.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Rondel scullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Rose hip wine
description: Grapes of wine growing on a rose bush! Tastes miraculously and increases your health!

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Bread roll
description: A plaited\, crusty white bread roll\, smells wonderful and tastes just as good.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Von Bergow knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Offer of Hermes Trismegistus
description: A strange list of raw materials for Miller Krejzl.

name: Common sabre
description: An unusual curved blade used by nomads on fast horses in the Hungarian steppes and remote Arabian deserts\, this swift weapon excels at offense and defense alike. Every good Christian should beware of losing his head to such a weapon.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Apothecary guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. The ancient symbol of the god of medicine Apollo is the emblem of the Kuttenberg Guild of Apothecaries and Alchemists.

name: Sketch – Military sword
description: Although it looks quite ordinary\, this sword is well forged and perfectly balanced. This is the kind of weapon a swordsmith makes for battle\, not for show.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Wanderer's robe
description: An overcoat is made of thicker fabric and is designed for long journeys in bad weather. It is recommended by nine out of ten wanderers who have reached their destination.

name: Steel skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Hunting crossbow
description: A well-crafted lightweight crossbow. Its draw weight is adapted for hunting big game\, but it could still be drawn with one's bare hands. Hunting poachers with it is not recommended\, but it will do the job in a pinch.

name: Killer's helmet
description: The helmet of the notorious murderer and bandit Burkhard.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Suchdol pavese
description: A riding pavese with the symbol of Lord Pisek\, owner of the Suchdol fortress.

name: Painted pavese
description: A riding pavese covered with linen without a noble coat of arms.

name: Old straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is definitely past its prime\, though. It looks as if the wearer was chewed up by a goat.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: The pointed hunting hat decorated with a brooch is the badge of an experienced hunter. Poachers should be on the lookout if they see him.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Katherine's love potion
description: It is said Katherine will fall head over heels in love with whoever drinks the potion.

name: Lost wreath
description: Lost and found again.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Sir Bushek's vintner wisdom
description: A collection of interesting facts about wine\, winemakers and wine culture in general. From the most famous wine connoisseur of the Bohemian land\, Bushek of Velhartice\, who as is known taught Emperor Charles that even Bohemian wine can be drunk if given enough time.

name: The Groom and the Apprentice
description: An old Czech satirical poem about an argument between a scholar and a groom over who has it better in life.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Tomyris\, Queen of the Massagetae
description: On Tomyris\, the brave Queen of the Massagetae

name: Padded chausses
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Tournament gambeson
description: Gambeson\, which was lent to me as part of the equipment for the Kuttenberg tournament.

name: Vassal charter with von Bergow's seal
description: A Vassal charter from Lord von Bergow for the the Großskal custodian Otte Koch.

name: Bell-shaped kettle hat
description: The most common shape of kettle hat\, popular among the poor squires. It consists of two parts joined together by iron rivets\, and therefore isn't as expensive as a helmet forged from a single piece.

name: Half plate legs
description: Partial leg protection\, coverinng only the thighs and knees of its wearer who\, for some reason\, decided to save on armour cost. One should think twice whether this is a good idea\, though.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Else's perfume
description: Women's perfume with an exceptional and unusual fragrance.

name: Mail coif
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Master's hunting bow
description: The finest hunting bow you can get your hands on. It's strength and accuracy makes it perfect for hunting big game.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Rusty shackles
description: Shackles covered it rust. They don't exactly serve their purpose anymore.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Rowel spurs
description: Riding spurs\, also called rowels\, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal\, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.

name: St. Apollonia's tooth
description: The molar of the patron saint of all those afflicted by toothache - Saint Apollonia of Alexandria. Or maybe it's just a polished pig's tooth\, it's hard to tell.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Ordinary coat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut from regular fabric\, buttoned at the neck. It is available to villagers and burghers as well.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Red feathers
description: You shouldn't brag about your own feathers\, but this isn't mine. On the other hand\, who would I brag to?

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Cooked pork tenderloin
description: Here is a Hungarian way of cooking pork. Pound the meat\, put it in water and let it rest overnight. Take it out of water\, salt it and sear it. Fry plenty of onion\, add wine\, vinegar\, juniper\, caraway\, cloves\, pepper\, ginger and a little nutmeg too. Bring everything to boil\, add the meat\, keep the lid on and cook over a low heat for a long time\, while basting with wine.

name: Colourful headscarf
description: A colorful scarf will keep not only the hair off your forehead\, but also a bit of coin. Sometimes it can also serve as a gift for a loved one.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Trollbane hammer
description: A hammer made for killing trolls. These monsters are said to hide under bridges and ambush unsuspecting travellers and caravans. Or maybe it's just an excuse for bandits.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Chest key
description: The key to a chest in the rebels' camp.

name: Sketch – Knight's longsword
description: This sword has been through a lot\, and with a little care\, could still be.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Bandit's key
description: This key belonged to one of the bandits from the camp above Vidlak pond.

name: Tin pitcher
description: For particularly thirsty drinkers. In an emergency\, it can also be used to water the garden.

name: Short butcher apron
description: A short linen tunic complete with a butcher's apron.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Leather apron
description: A short linen tunic joined with a leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Wanderer's hat
description: The wide wanderer's hat with a raised front hem is pulled back to protect the back of the traveller's head from the inclement weather on the road.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Mail coif
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Kuttenberg bacon
description: Kuttenberg bacon\, so fine and lean\, not to share it would be mean.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Torch
description: May it be a light for you in dark places\, when all other lights go out.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Club
description: A wooden bludgeon for every street thug or bandit who waits by the roadside for an unsuspecting traveller.

name: On Saint Procopius and foundation of the monastery
description: A discussion about the monk Procopius and how he founded the monastery.

name: Ordinary sword guard
description: A cross guard\, also known as quillon. It serves to protect the swordsman's hands from the opponent's blade. It can also be used to execute a grappling hold or strike to an unprotected face. In sword making\, it is put on the blade's tail before the hilt is made and the pommel is put on. In cheap weapons made by poor blacksmiths\, it will loosen over time and begin to clink unpleasantly.

name: Cooked hare meat
description: Cooked wild hare meat. White and tender\, just like chicken.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Tournament padded coif
description: A quilted hood that was lent to me as part of the equipment for the Kuttenberg tournament.

name: Pomuk vicar's needle
description: The needle used to sew vicar Jan of Pomuk into a bag\, after which he was thrown into the Vltava river\, all on the orders of Wenceslas IV.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Recipe for Fever tonic
description: Fever and its complications can often end in death. This tonic will relieve and soothe the fever if given in time.

name: Felt cap
description: A felt cap with a curved hem\, a tight fit  to the head\, is a popular head cover\, especially among hard-working people.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Scapular with aperture
description: A tiny pendant\, usually worn around the neck or wrapped around the wrist\, is associated with the veneration of the Virgin Mary and other saints.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Steel skullcap
description: One-piece helmet of plain cut designed for plain squires.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Nebakov storage key
description: The key I found in Nebakov Fortress\, probably fits to some door there.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Hourglass gauntlets
description: The most commonly used type of iron gloves whose name refers to their typical hourglass-like shape. It protects not only the hand\, but also part of the forearm of the fighter.

name: Lady Jitka's kohlrabi
description: It is palatable to the simple peasants\, the poor and the cattle. The nobility often turn up their noses at it\, but Lady Jitka seems to be an exception.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Practice shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Roe-deer hide
description: A roe-deer hide does not reach the strength and quality of deerskin and is not suitable for tanning. It is therefore mainly used as fur.

name: Dogwood hunting bow
description: Hunting bows are supposed to be strong enough to bring down larger game. This bow is made of dogwood and is therefore one of the weaker hunting weapons.

name: Mail coif
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Lords of Nebakov kite shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Skull Crushers I
description: A skill book on Heavy weapon combat.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Common longsword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Battle arrow
description: An arrow made in large numbers ideal for military deployment in large numbers.

name: Rooster tail feather
description: You shouldn't brag about your own feathers\, but this isn't mine. On the other hand\, who would I brag to?

name: Magdeburg cuirass
description: The richly shaped two-piece cuirass with folded faulds protects the whole torso and groin very well. There are constant arguments among knights about whether a good brigandine or a hardened cuirass is better. In short\, both have their undeniable advantages and obvious weaknesses.

name: Prison chambers key
description: A key to the chambers in which Wenceslas' ally lords are imprisoned in the Italian court.

name: Laminar knight legs
description: Full leg protection\, consisting of laminar and plate armour\, made with an emphasis on lighter weight\, but also with an emphasis on the good looks of the wearer.

name: Key from below Trosky
description: An old rusty key I found in a cave beneath Trosky.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Bitten apple
description: A red apple\, like it was just picked. It sparkles beautifully.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Scribbled letter
description: A hastily scribbled letter addressed to Christian of Pisek.

name: Pillory key
description: The key to the pillory.

name: Wolf ear
description: The least dangerous part of the wolf and the easiest to carry.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Open bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet forged from a single piece of sheet metal. In this basic form\, it has no bretache or klappvisor and therefore does not protect the warrior's face.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Products of Skilled Hands II
description: A skill book on Craftsmanship. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Von Bergow knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Nuremberg bascinet
description: A helmet with a german klappvisor is an example of the highest armourer's art. It is easy to breathe in and through the widened visors it is much easier to see to the sides.

name: Dead child's bone
description: A talisman made from the boiled finger bone of a dead unbaptized child protects against unwanted conception. -5 erection bonus.

name: Lord von Bergow's sword
description: A good weapon that any average blacksmith can forge. It's not bad\, but at the same time it's not surprising.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Bonnet
description: The tied cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Most Faithful Friend I
description: A skill book on Houndmaster.

name: Milanese gauntlets
description: Fingered gauntlets in a typical hourglass shape. The individual fingers are protect a series of folded iron slats.

name: Golden cross with pearls
description: This piece is decorated with freshwater pearls of a beautiful cream colour.

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Nobleman's letter of the Captain Dub
description: Letter of nobility with the seal and signature of the lord of Straz with a commission for the Captain Dub.

name: Cuirass with falds
description: The metal cuirass with folded falds creates excellent protection for the torso and groin of the knight. The falds are also made from slats\, so they can be easily moved and worn on a horse.

name: Noble's gauntlets
description: Fingered guantlets made in brigandine style\, i.e. by layering lamellae and riveting them to the leather base. The division of the glove into individual fingers does not restrict crossbow loading or archery.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Milanese plate leg armour
description: Leg protection consisting of forged pieces of sheet metal. The front consists of plates equipped with a dorsal edge\, so the armour is harder to cut through and will even endure a crushing blow.

name: Wedding contract
description: Part of the draft of the marriage contract between the lord of Semine and bailiff Thrush\, a free farmer from Troskowitz.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Shell hunting sword
description: A beautiful hunting sword with a hilt made of deer antler will not disgrace even a nobleman. It is usually used to finish off hunted game\, but it will also help against uninvited forest visitors.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Short butcher apron
description: A short linen tunic complete with a butcher's apron.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Smooth cuirass
description: This type of armour provides less protection than any brigandine\, as it only protects its wearer's chest.

name: Quilted coat
description: Quilted thick coat\, suitable for every splash and slots.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Gold badge of fortune
description: After your throw\, you can <strong>reroll up to three dice</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Balshan's sword
description: A great blade of Sir Jan Posy of Zimburg\, which he would like to give to his younger brother Miroslav.

name: Frenzls' chest key
description: The key to the chest obtained from the wife of  Captain Frenzl of Suchdol.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Key from nest
description: A key I found in a bird's nest in an old willow tree in the swamp outside of Kuttenberg\, near Sedletz.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Rusty key
description: The key I found on a corpse in the pond outside of Bohunowitz.

name: Raven's beak
description: A type of war hammer\, often called a raven's beak for the shape of its spike. While its blunt end is great for crushing skulls\, its pointed end is perfect for piercing armour.

name: Long-range arrow
description: An arrow with modified fletching designed for better accuracy at long range.

name: The Strength of the Knight II
description: A skill book on Strength. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Gartered hose
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Dried comfrey
description: Grows most of all on banks by water and in ditches around fields.

name: Letter from Bishop Thomas I.
description: A few lines full of important reports from the Hungarian Bishop Thomas of the city of Erlau.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Sketch – Brunswick's poleaxe
description: A copy of the order of Sir George of Wartenberg for a beautiful poleaxe.

name: Dried beef tenderloin
description: Great meat suitable for many dishes. It is best served with a white cream sauce.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Kyiv helmet
description: A foreign helmet of a peculiar shape originating from the eastern steppes\, worn by the Cuman horsemen. It is feared because it is associated with raiders who have burned many villages.

name: Vassal letter of the Turnau bailiff
description: Vassal letter with the seal of the lord von Bergow for Hanko Goathead\, the bailiff of Turnau.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Bertha's potion
description: Bertha the cook's potion. Only she knows exactly what it does.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Cooked dog meat
description: Subtly spiced dog meat fills the stomach and satisfies even the most discerning palate.

name: Work boots
description: Unobtrusive boots that protect the foot and strengthen the ankle\, making them suitable for most jobs. They're not the most expensive\, which is why they're worn by every hired hand or craftsman.

name: Knight's spurs
description: Riding spurs\, also called rowels\, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal\, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.

name: Cuman shashka
description: The shashka is similar to a long knife\, and and its distinctive pommel is in the shape of a bird of prey. It originated in the steppes of Kyiv\, but was also favoured by the Cumans of Hungary.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Shaft owner's seal
description: Bronze seal of a rich mining magnate and shaft owner.

name: Decree of Bailiff Thrush
description: <heading>Commission from Sir Otto von Bergow for Bailiff Thrush</heading>

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Spectacles
description: An extraordinary invention of everyday use\, fitted with special glasses in wooden frames. This thing allows scholars and monks who have spent their lives squinting at books to regain the sharpness of their vision.

name: Empty vial
description: An empty bottle with a foul smell coming from it. If someone drank this\, it's no wonder they ended up the way they did.

name: Noble gloves
description: Noblemen's gloves made of finely tanned leather keep the hands of the highest class safe and also show their social status by their quality.

name: Diary of Knight Conrad
description: Diary entries of Conrad\, a correctional officer of the Knights of the Cross.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Simple waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Saxon Hauberk
description: A long chainmail shirt with short sleeves covering only the arms of its wearer.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Brunswick's map III
description: A map leading to a part of Brunswick's armour.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Strange little verse I
description: A strange verse\, probably referring to a certain place in Kuttenberg.

name: Noble's quilted hose
description: Thick wool trousers\, well made of honest fabric so they don't hinder movement and last a while.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: St. Anthony's standard
description: The standard of the miners from the St. Anthony's mine in Kuttenberg. Such a standard is the symbol and the pride of every miners' gang!

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Juniper schnapps
description: Juniper brandy\, a pick-me-up for proper lads from the Upper Hungary. Csaba's well-guarded treasure.

name: Thigh bone
description: A human thigh bone\, or femur in Latin.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Plate knight gauntlets
description: Better hand protection is a must in combat because as they say: hands go first in any fight.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Kolda's key
description: The key to Kolda's chest.

name: Hounskull bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor. It has been pejoratively nicknamed the dog's snout because of its strange shape\, but it is easier to breathe in it and is more durable than its older models.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Lord of Holohlavy heater shield
description: A heater shield with the family coat of arms of the lord of Holohlavy.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Worn gambeson
description: A heavily worn\, patch-covered quilted gambeson. Sadly\, adding more patches to it won't make it any better.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: King Sigismund of Hungary
description: About Sigismund.

name: Poet's gut
description: Many songs sound more like the end result of a sheep's digestive tract than a heavenly chorus. Finally I know why.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Life in the Tavern IV
description: A skill book on Drinking and alcoholism. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Hook gun
description: A hand cannon\, unlike a pistole\, is a much more massive weapon. The barrel is fitted with a hook on the underside\, which serves to wedge the weapon behind an obstacle and limit recoil when fired. This piece has a barrel made of wrought iron and therefore does not last as long as guns cast in bronze. It is therefore recommended to shoot with a smaller powder charge. Up close\, this gun cracks knights in metal like thrushes smash snails on a rock.

name: Parish priest's badgge of advantage
description: You gain a new dice formation called <strong>The Eye</strong>\, consisting of the values<strong>1\, 3 and 5</strong>.

name: Baggy cap
description: Overhanging fabric cap with hem protects head and hair in dusty environments. It is popular not only among millers.

name: Popular Flute Song
description: That must have been torture live.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Sketch – Broad longsword
description: A perfectly balanced long sword with a wide blade is the golden mean. What it loses in speed it makes up for in durability.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Dogwood village bow
description: A homemade weaker bow made of dogwood. It's a little stronger than a hazel bow\, but that's about it. It'll do for poaching small game\, though.

name: Cooked boar meat
description: Hunting boar is dangerous\, so boar meat is a show of strength\, courage and a well-deserved delicacy.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Cooked roe deer meat
description: Good red meat\, not as prized as deer\, but not everyone can tell them apart. Prepare it the same way you would any other venison. If you have both deer and roe deer meat\, cut up the roe deer meat into sauce and cook it\, roast the deer meat on the fire.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Beggar tunic
description: A tunic so worn that it almost falls apart\, yet it is often a beggar's only possession.

name: Towards Flexibility of the Body III
description: A skill book on Agility. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Sharkan's chest key
description: The key to the Cuman Sharkan's chest.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Poacher's bow
description: A bow I found in an abandoned poacher's hideout.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Königshof Manuscript
description: Supposedly part of the Königinhof manuscript\, though I have doubts about its authenticity.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Dried salami
description: Spicy dried salami. The longer you dry it\, the better it tastes.

name: Tournament waffenrock
description: Battle waffenrock\, which was lent to me as part of my equipment for the Kuttenberg tournament.

name: Punches\, Kicks and a Few Slaps III
description: A skill book on Unarmed combat. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Cleric's hood
description: Made of good woolen fabric\, nicely cut\, well stitched\, in short excellent quality. No wonder it has a name referring to the priestly state.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Noble brigandine legs
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Molar die
description: A die made out of a molar tooth. It's probably better not to know who it came from.

name: Chertan's key
description: I wonder what it's for?

name: Replica of the longsword Absolver
description: A well-made replica of the sword called Absolver. With a bit of luck\, even an experienced eye can't tell the difference.

name: Bavarian plate legs
description: A leg protection consisting of forged plates of sheet metal suitably fit together. Such armour protects the warrior's entire leg\, but its weight depends on the craftsmanship of the maker.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: High boots
description: A pair of mid-calf-high boots\, practical for most every day activities\, and can even be wornn to social events.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Tall kettle hat
description: A pointed helmet with a broad brim and a spinning torse in the colours of the lord or city in whose service the wearer fights. The kettle hat is made of a single piece of sheet metal\, making it slightly lighter and more durable to all slashing and crushing blows.

name: Alum
description: An excellent mineral suitable for stopping minor bleeding as well as tanning hides.

name: Sketch – Knight's sword
description: An older form of a knight's sword. Slightly heavier at the tip\, therefore best suited for fighting slower\, heavily armoured foes.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Holy nail
description: A nail brought back by workers as a souvenir from the renovation of the Sedletz monastery.

name: Cuman folded bow
description: Cuman riding bows are one of the lighter bows\, easy to handle even from the horse's saddle. Their strength comes from the layering of different materials similar to better crossbows. This piece is well made and will certainly serve well.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Comfrey
description: Grows most of all on banks by water and in ditches around fields.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Embroidered coat
description: The coat with embroidered hem and forearm is fastened up to the neck with decorated buttons.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Hauberk long
description: A long chainmail shirt with short sleeves covering only the arms of its wearer.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Fine wine
description: A quality wine harvested in late autumn\, full of flavour and beautifully coloured.

name: Courtiers boots
description: Low courtiers shoes with a raised curved toe\, a contemporary fashion fad. Worn mainly by the wealthier people\, the burghers or the nobility.

name: Recipe for Embrocation
description: Increases Agility and in better qualities reduces how much stamina sprinting drains.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Cooked boar tenderloin
description: A prime piece of a boar meat\, juicy and tasty. Prague burgher Havel of Silberstein liked it very much and used to prepare it in a special way called wild boar on venison.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Pepik's old bridle
description: The old bridle of Vostatek's horse Pepik. If I could teach Mutt to track and give him a sniff of the bridle\, I'm sure he'd lead me to him.

name: Sketch – Cuman shashka
description: Shashka is similar to a long knife and quite unmistakable with its pommel in the form of a bird of prey. It originated on the Kyiv steppes\, but was also favoured by the Cumans of Hungary.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Noble cuirass
description: A masterpiece from the best armoursmith workshops. Well-set metal parts decorated with brass bands\, possibly additionally suitably gilded. The two-piece cuirass is joined by folded plate faulds\, so that the armour perfectly covers the whole body and can still be worn while riding a horse.

name: Mitts
description: Mitts are good for keeping your hands warm and protecting your fingers from injury\, but aren't exactly suitable for anything requiring delicate handling.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Miner's hat
description: The festive miner's cap with sewn-on split brim\, decorated with a miner's patch\, is designed for special occasions.

name: Mail collar
description: A short chainmail collar\, called a gorget\, protects the neck and guards the warrior from being cut or penetrated by a blade under the visor of the helmet.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Crude arrow
description: A cheap\, homemade arrow. I've seen better.

name: Open bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet forged from a single piece of sheet metal. In this basic form\, it has no bretache or klappvisor and therefore does not protect the warrior's face.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Dried St. John's wort
description: It is most fond of leafy woods\, glades and clearings.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Strange little verse III
description: A strange verse\, probably referring to a certain place in Kuttenberg.

name: Colorful festive dress
description: A colourful dress is typical for dancers and troubadours. But wearing them is seen by many as an eccentricity and a blatant warning against decadence.

name: Boar hide
description: The hide of a sturdy wild boar. It is difficult and often dangerous to kill a wild boar\, which is why it is a prized trophy\, as well as a badge of a brave and skilled hunter. But if you're caught with it by the custodian of the local woods or his subordinates\, you'll have a lot of explaining to do.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Felt hat
description: Felt hats are generally popular for their durability and ease of shaping.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: A jacket of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, decorated with the coat of arms of Ulrich Vavak von Neuhaus.

name: Halved pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Cooked horseradish
description: The horseradish was so sharp it could cut your tongue. Once cooked\, its infernal taste is dulled.

name: About the coat of arms of the House of Ruthard
description: A legend about the origin of the noble coat of arms of the Ruthard family.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Smoked chicken
description: Smoked chicken doesn't look so reproachfully anymore.

name: Opatowitz mead
description: Nobody makes mead like that anymore.

name: Innkeeper tunic
description: A linen tunic is an essential part of any outfit. The innkeepers also wear a working linen apron around their waists.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Products of Skilled Hands I
description: A skill book on Craftsmanship.

name: Dollmaker poison recipe
description: Disables running and reduces weapon skills. In better qualities\, it also reduces Health. It's better suited to applying to weapons than poisoning food pots.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Saint Ludmila's veil
description: The veil that ended Saint Ludmila's life. Even the absence of blood didn't prevent her canonization.

name: Raborsch butcher's axe
description: A heavy work axe used by carpenters to repair beams. If there's no better weapon at hand\, it can become a tool of revenge.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Burgher's hood
description: There's an unwritten rule. Burghers are not to play the nobleman and definitely prefer good worsted wool to brocade. But what of it? When you have money\, you have to show it\, don't you?

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Low bugher shoes with buckle and decorative clip\, ideal for a short walk or into higher society.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Basilard
description: A short sword that is said to have been given its special name because of its origin. Whether it really originated in the Swiss city of Basel is questionable\, but it is certainly a great weapon that can be carried\, unlike the sword\, even by non-noble townspeople.

name: Ordinary coat
description: A simple coat with a full-length buttoned front will not put its wearer to shame on any occasion.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Secret preghaus key
description: A key to the secret mint's preghaus\, where the path of the stolen silver ends.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Set of paintbrushes
description: Extensions of an artist's hands\, used to capture the beauty of even the most fleeting moments.

name: Most Faithful Friend III
description: A skill book on dog handling. Can be read from level 10 of the Houndmaster skill.

name: Ranyek's bow
description: Very nice bow. It was the first and last thing Ranyek won in the dice.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Moravian schnaps
description: Some moonshine the Moravians brought to the Semine wedding.

name: Deserting soldier's key
description: A key from the Kopanina bandit.

name: Composite kettle hat
