description: A simple kettle hat composed of several pieces of plate. It protects especially against blows from above and therefore it is good to wear it together with a padded coif or a full collar. The advantage is certainly its lower price.

name: Burgher pourpoint
description: The Pourpoint is a handsome waist-length quilted coat\, often worn by wealthier townspeople.

name: Mended cuirass
description: This cuirass has been in a fight before... and not for the first time. Battered\, full of patches\, but still a piece of metal that can make the difference between life and death for an unheralded warrior.

name: Beggar's hose
description: No one makes hose for beggars - they have to be passed down from person to person\, each one poorer than the last\, until they reach the poorest of all.

name: Jester shoes
description: Jester's shoes\, with a bell on a toe\, jingle as he walks. Sometimes it's amusing\, sometimes infuriating.

name: Hose loose
description: Only nomads and Hungarian horsemen wear such strangely frilled trousers wrapped tightly around their calves.

name: Leminger's spectacles
description: Ordinary spectacles of a certain Kapihorian scholar E. Leminger.

name: Kyiv helmet
description: A foreign helmet of a peculiar shape originating from the eastern steppes\, worn by the Cuman horsemen. It is feared because it is associated with raiders who have burned many villages.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Lord Ruthard knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Old ring
description: Someone put it away for work. I don't think he's putting it back on.

name: Zdena's scarf
description: The scarf that Zdena left to Pint to use as a distraction. Hopefully\, it'll be enough for Mutt to track her down.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Burgher's hat
description: This elegant fashionable hat with a narrow hem is worn mainly by the burghers.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Saxon bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor of an older drop-shaped pattern. The helmet is fitted with a wide chainmail aventail\, so it protects the whole head and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Sketch – Broad axe
description: The battle axe\, called a broadaxe\, is related to the ordinary carpenter's axe\, but is much lighter and forged specifically for combat. It's a good weapon against shields and chainmail.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Cow skin
description: The tanned cowhide is the most common material for all shoemakers and saddlers. Cowhide is used to make good boots\, belts\, straps\, bags and even large saddles. Work with it wisely so that not a single piece goes to waste!

name: Piercing arrow
description: An arrow with a heavy arrowhead designed to pierce armour.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: Glaive
description: A simple pole weapon for those who aren't highborn enough to get their hands on something better. It's nothing more than a long blade with a sharp point on a long handle\, but unlike other pikes it doesn't have a hook.

name: Lambskin gloves
description: A pair of gloves made of fine lambskin. They're not of much use as far as warmth and protection\, but at least they look nice.

name: Lavish caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of men's clothing in many eastern cultures. This one has rich oriental decoration.

name: Old painted statuette
description: A small worn-down statuette of St Mary Magdalene. Beikovetz must have stolen it straight from some church or monastery.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Dead child's tooth powder
description: A talisman made from the teeth of an unfortunate dead child will protect a thief from capture. +3 luck bonus and -3 enemy speed.

name: Enhanced wounding bolt
description: A balanced bolt with serrated tip to increase damage and bleeding.

name: Lion perfume
description: Increases Charisma by 4 for 4 minutes. However\, if you use it in combination with another perfume\, it decreases Charisma by 7.

name: Military writ
description: A military writ of Sigismund's soldiers\, which they present as proof when collecting money.

name: Padded collar
description: Short quilted collar protecting the neck of the fighter.

name: Noble's hood
description: Once you are noble\, you must make sure that your manners match it. It's impossible to walk like a peasant! Only the finest worsted wool\, well cut and carefully stitched\, is really good enough to adorn your noble shoulders.

name: Nobleman's hat
description: A beautiful hat made of real rabbit fur\, lined with patterned fabric and decorated with a brooch with jay feathers\, deserves to be worn by none other than a nobleman.

name: Wreath
description: A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days\, such as the wedding day.

name: Fisherman's lost key
description: Lost key to the fisherman's house\, probably dropped on his way out of the tavern.

name: About Saint Dorothy
description: Virgin Dorothy and her martyrdom

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Felt cap
description: A simple felt cap without a hem covers only the top of the head.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Rocktower Pond poacher's kit
description: Poacher's equipment found in a ruin near the Rocktower pond. Evidence for the huntsman. A dog may be able to track down its owner.

name: Fastened waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Riding boots
description: Simple riding boots below the knees tightly encircle the shins and ankles and give the rider confidence in controlling the horse.

name: Old Town of Prague knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
description: A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Hemmed waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Halved pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Quilted coat
description: Quilted thick coat\, suitable for every splash and slots.

name: Legate's shoes
description: Legate's beautiful new shoes.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Hungarian spurs
description: Riding spurs\, also called rowels\, help control the horse when riding fast or in the heat of battle. Their purpose is of course not to torment the animal\, the individual spikes are therefore blunted.

name: Burgher's shoes
description: Tall leather boots with lacing and raised toe. They are popular especially among wealthy burghers.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Cuman leather hat
description: A cap made of raw leather and sewn with leather straps is an unmistakable headgear of the Cuman raiders.

name: Beaked kettle hat
description: Iron hat with a wide brim. It covers the head well and at the same time\, thanks to conveniently placed cut-outs\, does not restrict the view\, which is an advantage especially for foot marksmen.

name: House of Polner waffenrock
description: The Polner family of Kuttenberg is wealthy enough to afford a small military retinue. These soldiers then wear their coat of arms\, mainly for reasons of prestige.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Embroidered bonnet
description: A quilted cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Woodsman's Journal IV
description: A skill book on Survival in the wilderness. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Deer antlers
description: A valuable trophy that will bring glory to any hunter and a noose to any poacher who acquires it.

name: Firm boots
description: Comfortable lace-up leather boots that tightly wrap around the their wearers ankle are in fashion among nearly every class of society.

name: Training axe
description: A wooden longsword that can bruise but not kill. For those who are serious about swordsmanship\, this is an invaluable tool for practicing.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Master huntsman's hat
description: An elegant pointed hat with a wide brim\, decorated hem and badge is worn especially by master hunsmans and they are proud of it.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Miner's cap
description: A felt cap adjacent to the head has an extended brim at the back to prevent rock rubble\, dust and dirt from falling behind the neck when working in the mine.

name: The Maidens' War I
description: About how the Maidens' War began.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: A jacket of traditional cut\, designed especially for the lord's subjects and the army\, decorated with the coat of arms of the Lords of Pisek.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Pork liver
description: Raw pork liver should be eaten for some diseases\, but otherwise it is better to cook it.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Laminar hands with rondels
description: Full arm protectors consisting of forged slats mounted on solid cowhide leather\, supplemented by shoulder protection in the form of simple forged rondels.

name: Gallant coat
description: Unbuttoned at the neck\, sleeves rolled up... This is how every good jester who knows how to enjoy life wears his coat. Many a maiden and married woman looks back at it in secret and then has to examine her conscience in church.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Recipe for Quickfinger potion
description: Increases Thievery and Craftsmanship.

name: Silver-plated button
description: A silver-plated button from a dead miner's clothing.

name: Lord of Pisek knight shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Cap with peacock feathers
description: A narrow pointed cap is decorated with peacock feathers. It may look a little eccentric in company\, but as they say\, fortune favours the brave.

name: Saxon brigandine
description: One of the best folded armours you can get. The individual hardened plates overlap perfectly\, making the brigandine very durable. In addition\, a lower fauld is attached to the vest\, so the armour covers not only the torso\, but also the warrior's groin.

name: Chainmail gauntlets
description: Fingerless chainmail gloves with tempered sheet metal are an older type of armour and therefore cheaper to produce than plate gloves. Unfortunately for archers\, and especially archers\, they lack any advantages.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Lords of Zimburg knight shield
description: A shield with the coat of arms of the Lords of Zimburg.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Henik's cellar key
description: The key to Henik's cellar.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Pistole
description: A handgonne is a firearm that uses gunpowder to shoot small pieces of metal or stone. A thick metal barrel with a handle is attached to a wooden stock\, similar to a spear\, for example. Fire through the powder stopper detonates the main charge in the barrel and shoots the projectile out. It is fired by a lit cord\, a red-hot iron wire or in a worst case scenario\, a burning stick. This handgonne has a barrel forged from iron and is therefore less durable than those cast from bronze. Any living being hit with this weapon is sure to no longer be living.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Turnip
description: It is palatable to the simple peasants\, the poor and the cattle. The nobility often turn up their noses at it\, but they do not know what they are missing.

name: Coat of arms surcoat
description: An overcoat of traditional cut\, designed especially for the military\, is decorated with the coat of arms of the Kingdom of Hungary.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Sewing basket
description: A basket full of thread\, needles and pieces of embroidered designs.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Evil Morals in Bohemia
description: How the Czechs indulge in iniquity and sin.

name: Sigismund's letter to Wenceslas
description: Letter from Sigismund of Luxembourg to Wenceslas IV.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Old rusty sword
description: The old rusty sword is probably somehow connected with the dark past of the innkeeper Beikovetz.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Zimburg reliquary
description: The mysterious chest that Posy and Tugbone had been searching for so long. I wonder what's inside?

name: Old Town of Prague knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: Strange little verse V
description: A strange verse\, probably referring to a certain place in Kuttenberg.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Selection of amorous poetry
description: Must be owned by anyone who has been struck by Cupid's arrow.

name: Sour slop from Loretz
description: Well\, this swill isn't very nice.

name: Cleric habit
description: A habit\, or long\, single-coloured outer robe of coarse cloth\, is worn by priests and monks. Besides the shaved tonsure on the head and the bare\, beardless face\, it is a clear mark of a cleric.

name: Hungarian pavese
description: A cavalry pavese with Hungarian symbols.

name: Charcoal water
description: Throw into the cold water three coals of fire\, three crumbs of bread and three pinches of salt. Wash thy forehead and thy shoulder with the water\, that thou mayest wash away the evil from thee\, and put it upon the water.

name: Battle bolt
description: A bolt made in large numbers ideal for military deployment in large numbers.

name: Lower Semine poacher's kit
description: Equipment of a poaching bandit from the Lower Semine. Evidence for the huntsman.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Miner's chest key
description: The key to the well-chilled beer store for hard-working miners.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Round cap
description: A simple round cap is popular especially among the bourgeoisie.

name: Silesian brigandine sleeves
description: Arm and forearm guards composed of leather parts with hardened lamellae and plate couters and pauldrons.

name: Florian's letter from an admirer
description: Letter from a secret admirer to Knight Florian.

name: Surcoat
description: A surcoat is an outer dress with wide armholes\, revealing the lower layer of the garment. Evil tongues claim that such a cut attracts inappropriate attention. Perhaps because of this\, it is very popular.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Italian hauberk
description: Lightweight short chainmail shirt with shortsleeves.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Silver brooch enamelled
description: I don't know much about jewellery making\, but this is a really nice piece. The decoration is done in enamel\, which is like stained glass... And the silver underneath isn't bad either.

name: Man's best soup
description: Mutt-in-soup. You can’t disguise that bitter taste.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: A suspicious bag
description: This is a unique clothing asset for an important character. If you got it in game\, report it!

name: Dead man's left shoe
description: Dead miner's left boot. Boots for the grave are just for show\, they don't actually use them for walking. Hopefully.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Embroidered bonnet
description: A quilted cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Human skull
description: Dust you are and to dust you shall return. The skull serves as a reminder of the transience of human life.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Lord's overcoat
description: Long lord's overcoat made of fine fabric\, decorated with rows of buttons. Perhaps every person in it looks robust and dignified.

name: Pointed shoes
description: Pointed shoes with an eccentrically long toe are worn more in the city\, in the countryside they could be ridiculed.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Travel boots
description: Solid shoes with buckles that stand out for their durability and strength. They reliably protect your feet and give them a little comfort. A great choice for long-distance pilgrimages - to the Holy See in Rome\, to the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem or to the end of the world in Santiago.

name: Trosky Castle master keys
description: The bunch of keys of the Lord of Trosky Castle. One flew through a window and the other is somewhere behind the hills. So they are now in my custody.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Family heirloom
description: Wooden statue of an old man\, symbolizing the connection with one's ancestors.

name: Cuman fokos
description: Cuman long-handled fokos. A fast and agile weapon of the Hungarian raiders. It can pierce light armour or the skull of a good Christian.

name: Beggar's shirt
description: A short linen tunic\, dirty and ragged that only a beggar would wear it.

name: Stinking shirt
description: Someone spilled something on this shirt while drinking at the baths.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Wooden rosary
description: One of the most common types of counting devices. It doesn't count money\, but something quite different.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Sword for young Lord Semine
description: A good sword of Toledo steel\, made from the broken sword of a hermit.

name: Dried boletus
description: An estimable fruit of the Bohemian lands\, tasty boiled or roasted\, with meat or porridge.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Military sword
description: A good weapon that any average blacksmith can forge. It's not bad\, but at the same time it's not surprising.

name: Innkeeper's shirt
description: Short linen tunic with linen apron.

name: Riding gloves
description: Gloves made of fine deerskin are quite flexible and retain the touch in the fingers\, so they are perfect for riding.

name: Ornate waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Gartered hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing\, but garters are worn only by the nobility\, wealthy bourgeoisie or various freedmen. Nothing for the common peasant.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a folded hood put on backwards. A simple trick created an elegant and rather eccentric headdress.

name: Silver cross with garnet
description: Very nice cross with a deep red gemstone.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Ladies shoes
description: Women's embellished leather shoes with a sharp toe. They are worn mainly by bourgeois and noblewomen.

name: Kuttenberg heater shield
description: A beautiful and solid knight's shield made by the master armourer Nicolas Krondel from Kuttenberg. It bears the colours of the mining town and is an example of excellent craftsmanship.

name: Cooked pear
description: Cooked pear softens up and smells wonderful.

name: Reinforced heavy crossbow
description: A heavy siege crossbow is mainly used for shooting defenders on the walls. The strong steel arms have a considerable tension and therefore a hand pulley is used to cock it. In addition\, the body has been reinforced with steel to make its shot truly lethal. You just can't get a stronger ranged weapon.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Bandit's brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of forged slats hammerd on a leather vest is a slightly older form of protection than the fashionable metal cuirass. Both provide similar protection\, but the brigandine is a bit heavier\, but there are warriors who will not let it go. This one's been through a lot\, though\, and has had more than one owner. Most certainly haven't given her up willingly.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Lead ball
description: A lead ball. It rattles a little in the barrel\, but at least it's easy to load. Even the best plate armour can't stop it up close!

name: On Tournaments
description: On tournaments and jousting.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Milanese cuirass
description: An excellent piece from the Italian armoursmiths. Thanks to the perfect tempering and fine surface cannulation\, the sheet metal used can be much lighter and yet just as durable. The cuirass is composed of two parts that fit together perfectly to form an impenetrable shell on the knight's body.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Zizka's personal belongings
description: Zizka's stuff. There's a lot of rattling and ringing\, so it's probably not a butterfly collection.

name: Lower tower key
description: The key to the lower tower of Nebakov Fortress.

name: Miner hose
description: These aren't just any pants. These express their owner's affiliation with a respected craft and are therefore properly worn out from an honest work.

name: Gold badge of transmutation
description: After your throw\, <strong>change a die of your choosing to a 1</strong>. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Tin warlord's badge
description: Used to gain <strong>a quarter more points</strong> from your turn. Can be used <strong>once per game</strong>.

name: Training longsword
description: A long sword designed for practicing swordfighting techniques and training combat. Therefore\, it has no sharpened blade and its tip is blunted.

name: Letter from Bishop Thomas II
description: A few lines full of important reports from the Hungarian Bishop Thomas of the city of Erlau.

name: Frilled cap
description: A frilled round cap with a raised hem\, decorated with a simple brooch\, it is popular in towns and fortresses.

name: Hungarian heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Noble laminar hands
description: Excellent full arm protectors composed of sheet metal parts and supplemented by laminar shoulder pads.

name: Kastenbrust
description: An older form of the German cuirass\, square shaped to withstand both slashing and crushing blows. It has considerable durability\, but this is heavily compensated for by its weight.

name: Markvart von Aulitz's sword
description: If it wasn't for this sword\, my parents would have still been alive. I'm not sure I even want to carry it.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Horse collar
description: A discarded collar from a horse's harness. With it\, a dog might find a trace of the horse it belonged to.

name: Anvil
description: Anvil

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Narrow straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats. This one is a bit narrower\, but it serves its purpose just as well.

name: Leather gloves
description: Leather gloves that protect their wearer from abrasions and the cold. Suitable for horse-riding and hunting\, but don't provide much protection in combat.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Crude padded coif
description: Sturdy padded cap serving as a soft underlayer beneath the helmet. A good soft padding is simply essential\, even for tough guys.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Trout
description: A tasty freshwater fish\, abundant in flowing waters such as rivers and streams. Suitable to be fried\, roasted or added to a soup.

name: Captain's mace
description: A captain's mace is a great weapon expressing the status of the owner and the punishment that will befall anyone who opposes him. A single movement with the weapon in hand is enough to set in motion whole ranks of warriors!

name: Dried pear
description: When you have no idea what to do with all those pears.

name: Rikonaris' sabre
description: A good sabre worthy of the Voivode's position. Its wielder is not to be underestimated\, for even the slightest cut can cause a terrible curse. At least to those who believe in such things.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Miner's tunic
description: Short linen tunic with a simple miner's shirt for working in the mines.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Rusted plate
description: Damn it\, who let such a fine piece of armour rust so reprehensibly? It won't do much\, but it'll still protect you from death by stabbing.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Secret mint ledgers
description: Records of the secret mint's accounting. They prove royal silver fraud.

name: Bascinet with aventail
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a wide chainmail aventail that protects the neck and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Travel dress
description: An ordinary dress intended for daily wear for peasant and poorer bourgeois women. Also ideal for travelling.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Cuman boots
description: The Cumans are feared opponents especially for their mounted archery\, and they adjust their equipment accordingly. Their riding boots meet the demands for both comfort and confidence in riding.

name: Old quilted hose
description: A quilted hose that have been through a lot. They are rugged and have patches\, but can still be used on their own or as a bottom layer for the upper part of armour.

name: Milanese cuirass
description: An excellent piece from the Italian armoursmiths. Thanks to the perfect tempering and fine surface cannulation\, the sheet metal used can be much lighter and yet just as durable. The cuirass is composed of two parts that fit together perfectly to form an impenetrable shell on the knight's body.

name: Wheel grease
description: A greasy black liquid used to lubricate wagon wheels\, mill gears and mining equipment. It is made by mixing pitch\, tallow and crushed plaster so it stays nice and smooth.

name: Crusaders of the Red Star waffenrock
description: A waffenrock bearing the symbol of the Order of the Crusaders of the Red Star.

name: Billhook
description: An immortal weapon well known to mankind since the creation of the world. A simple long spear with an added hook for tripping the legs of enemies and pushing ladders off battlements.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Quilted hose
description: Simple quilted leggings. Not exactly the pinnacle of tailoring skill. Can be used alone or as a softening underlayer beneath better armour.

name: Lower Semine woodcutters' map
description: Lower Semine woodcutters' map.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Prayer to Saint Wenceslas
description: Two old prayers\, Lord have Mercy on Us\, and Saint Wenceslas

name: Simple hose
description: A long hose are a staple of men's clothing. The simple countryman\, however\, does not look for beauty\, but mainly to keep the wind off his knees.

name: Trophies from victims
description: In the young gentleman's chambers\, I found a collection of locks of hair he had kept as trophies. If this doesn't prove he's the killer\, I don't know what will.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Tragic Flute Song
description: That must have been living agony.

name: Cuman caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is heavily decorated with an embroidered hem.

name: On the Margraviate Wars
description: About the wars that Jobst and Procopius fought against each other in the Moravian March and how Sigismund emerged victorious.

name: Tall Cuman cap
description: A high cuman cap in the shape of a polyhedron made of coarse leather is an unmistakable headgear of the wild Hungarian horsemen.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Quilted caftan
description: A Caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one is also quilted for better durability.

name: Ash hunting bow
description: Hunting bows are supposed to be strong enough to bring down larger game. This bow is made of ashen wood and is therefore one of the stronger hunting weapons that are still easy to handle. Most experienced gamekeepers and poachers will rely on it.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: On St. Wenceslas
description: A book about Prince Wenceslas and how his brother had him killed.

name: Milanese gauntlets
description: Fingered gauntlets in a typical hourglass shape. The individual fingers are protect a series of folded iron slats.

name: Csaba's key
description: The key to Csaba's private chest in the kitchen of the Italian Court.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Crested Cuman helmet
description: A helmet of a peculiar pointed shape\, not used in our lands for a long time\, favoured by nomads on the eastern steppes. The Cumans are fond of adorning it with horsehair\, and some evil tongues claim that also with the hair of good christian virgins.

name: Tournament sword
description: A sword that was lent to me as part of the equipment for the famous Kuttenberg tournament.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Silver badge of defence
description: Use to cancel the effect of your opponent's Silver badge in the game.

name: Recipe for Saviour Schnapps
description: Saves your game\, and when brewed well also increases your Strength\, Vitality and Agility.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Bailiff's mace
description: Bronze mace cast in one piece with ground tips. It expresses both position and determination to make one's case\, even if one has to beat one's ideas into opponent's head with force.

name: Sewing needle
description: A secondary product of hay drying.

name: Dried nettle
description: It can be found abundantly by water\, on the edge of woods and in the furrows of fields.

name: Ordinary coat with crest
description: A plain coat\, made in red and white and decorated with symbols of Kuttenberg.

name: Broad battle coif
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Work scarf
description: A work scarf is worn tightened around the head and tied in a knot at the back of the head.

name: Chaperon with brooch
description: Elegant and slightly eccentric headdress decorated with a decent brooch.

name: Simple veil
description: Veils\, or also wimples belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.

name: Hanush's sword
description: The longsword is a perfectly balanced lethal weapon. Its price is not small\, because only a master of his craft can forge a thin yet flexible blade! The longsword is not meant for the heat of battle\, but for swift swordplay.

name: Knight's waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Brocade hood
description: Have you achieved success\, are you noble and rich\, or at least you want it to look that way? You can't go wrong with a brocade lining.

name: Servant's hood
description: Plain and poorly tailored\, but it protects perhaps more than the best wool. For everyone can see at a glance that the wearer is in the service of his master. And a servant can only be kicked with impunity by his master\, no one else!

name: Wreath
description: A festive beech leaf wreath is designed for big days\, such as the wedding day.

name: Dried lepiota
description: Why would anyone do that? What a shame! There's nothing like such nice round cuttings from a lepiota...

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: The Papal Schism
description: How two popes came together on the papal throne and what it means for Christianity.

name: Embroidered shirt
description: Extended linen tunic with delicate embroidered trimmed hems.

name: Broken round shield
description: Remnants of a shield from another era\, still good for kindling.

name: Tyrol brocade cotehardie
description: A fine dress that will make even an ordinary girl a lady worthy of a knight's favour.

name: Riding caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. This one has was made for more comfortable riding.

name: Lady's gemstone necklace
description: If the husband does not respect his wife\, she can appeal to the law and then\, along with her dowry and all the gifts she received during the marriage\, remove herself from the household.

name: Old brigandine legs
description: Protection of the entire leg formed by individual iron plates riveted to the honest cowhide leather. This is an older form of folded armour\, which can be seen especially in the shape of the knee pads.

name: Mail hood with a coat of arms
description: A quilted hood with a collar and wide mail hood.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Noble boots
description: Decorated high men's boots with a raised toe\, made of quality leather. They are designed for the richest.

name: Butcher's apron
description: A long inner tunic joined with butcher's apron.

name: Women's straw hat
description: When working hard in the fields\, men and women protect themselves from the sun by wearing straw or wicker hats.

name: Charcoal
description: Charcoal is wood burnt in kilns by pyrolysis without influx of air. It is used primarily in forges and smelting works\, and to a lesser extent in alchemy for its filtration properties.

name: Women's hood
description: A women's hood covers the head\, chest and shoulders. It protects from the cold and unwelcome stares.

name: Butcher's apron
description: A long inner tunic joined with butcher's apron.

name: Long gambeson
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Weighted die
description: A mysterious playing die found in a ruined house. Suspiciously\, it tends to land on 1.

name: Burgundian hat
description: A tall\, cylindrical hat\, also called a burgundian hat. The hem is decorated with a bird feather.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Map of game near Slatego
description: Map showing places where you can hunt game in the vicinity of Slatego.

name: Miner's hood
description: This isn't just any piece of cloth\, it's a sacred part of the miner's dress and yacker traditions.

name: Reinforced tempered gauntlets
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Jewish bread
description: A crispy unleavened bread\, also called Matzah\, which is typically square or round in shape. It is a traditional food for the Jewish holiday of Passover.

name: Lord's overcoat
description: Long lord's overcoat made of fine fabric\, decorated with rows of buttons. Perhaps every person in it looks robust and dignified.

name: Noblewoman's cotehardie
description: A light outer jacket\, popular among wealthy burghers and noblewomen. It is commonly adorned with pendants\, decorative buttons and embroidery. Long\, flared sleeves are also in vogue.

name: Carpenter's badge of advantage
description: You gain a new dice formation called <strong>the Cut</strong>\, consisting of <strong>3+5</strong>.

name: Copper jug
description: Can be used in various manners in the morning\, day\, evening and night. It just needs to be washed thoroughly.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Short pourpoint
description: An expensive and honestly made quilted coat from precious fabric for all noble warriors.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Magdeburg plate arms
description: Protection of the whole arm and forearm by precisely fitted metal plates. The armour is decorated with brass and artistic ornaments.

name: Simple brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of a number of forged plates hammered side by side under a leather vest of good cowhide. A well-made brigandine has the individual plates folded so that they overlap slightly. Compared to a plate cuirass\, it is a little cheaper to make\, but still a very expensive part of a warrior's armour.

name: Quilted coat
description: Quilted thick coat\, suitable for every splash and slots.

name: Plate knight gauntlets
description: Better hand protection is a must in combat because as they say: hands go first in any fight.

name: Saxon plate legs
description: A leg protection made from tempered sheet metal plates forged into the dorsal edge to better withstand slashing and crushing blows. The armour is not fitted with sabatons\, as its intended wearer is not a horserider and often must move on foot.

name: Bandit's brigandine
description: Folded armour made up of forged slats hammerd on a leather vest is a slightly older form of protection than the fashionable metal cuirass. Both provide similar protection\, but the brigandine is a bit heavier\, but there are warriors who will not let it go. This one's been through a lot\, though\, and has had more than one owner. Most certainly haven't given her up willingly.

name: Saddler guild knight shield
description: A guild shield. Two crossed wooden mallets and a saddle are the emblem of the Kuttenberg Saddler Guild.

name: The Strength of the Knight IV
description: A skill book on Strength. Can be read from level 15 of this skill.

name: Lavish rosary
description: One of the most common types of counting devices. It doesn't count money\, but something quite different.

name: Riding boots - high
description: Thigh-length boots that protect the horseman's legs against chaffing. Putting them on and taking them off is a rather lengthy process\, so they're worn more by folks who tend to spend the whole day in the saddle\, such as messengers and grooms.

name: Embroidered chaperon
description: A richly embroidered\, elegant headdress\, which is originally nothing more than an upside-down hood.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Liber Razielis Archangeli
description: A magical grimoire filled with centuries of strange\, ancient knowledge accompanied by cryptic symbols and drawings.

name: Earthworm
description: An earthworm for fishing.

name: Wanderer's hood
description: Whether the sun is shining\, it's raining or snowing\, this hood will never let you down. There was one who went all the way to Jerusalem wearing it\, and when his bereaved sold it\, he had a nice funeral out of it too.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: On the Composition of Alchemy III
description: A skill book on Alchemy. Can be read from level 10 of this skill.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Long pourpoint
description: A well-made long combat coat made by a real tailor\, so it doesn't restrict movement like ordinary quilted gambesons.

name: Gambeson short
description: A quilted combat coat made of several layers of plain linen. Can be worn alone or as a basic soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Festive dress
description: A buttoned dress with a long skirt is the ideal garment for formal occasions\, both for bourgeois and wealthier village women.

name: Battle shot
description: Ammunition for firearms\, suitable for immediate use. The powder is faded and the ball is a little conical.

name: Worn tunic
description: An inner linen tunic is a good base for any outfit. This one's a bit worn out.

name: Ripped hose
description: These miparti hose can't be used anymore unless a tailor looks at them. They're torn lengthwise.

name: Hunting cap
description: A hat of unmistakable pointed shape with a decorated hem is the pride of every good hunter. Its colourful shades guarantee that no one will mistake you for prey in the woods.

name: Frilled dress
description: A frilly\, tight-fitting dress with a raised skirt tip coquettishly revealing the petticoat are coming into fashion especially in cities.

name: Dried mint
description: It is rarely found in nature\, but rather alongside houses and in gardens cultivated.

name: Bell-shaped bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet protecting the whole head except the face\, so it looks a bit like a bell. Very often used by marksmen because the face is not covered by any visor and it is easy to see the target.

name: Saxon bascinet
description: A helmet called a bascinet with a fitted klappvisor of an older drop-shaped pattern. The helmet is fitted with a wide chainmail aventail\, so it protects the whole head and shoulders of the warrior.

name: Bohemian cap
description: A decent round cap with a high hem is a hot novelty in Bohemia and every burgher with a finger on the pulse of the times must have it.

name: Lord Ruthard knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noble's plate legs
description: A masterpiece of plate armour decorated with brass lining. The forged plates are further hardened to achieve higher durability\, while the metal sheet could be weaker and therefore lighter overall. The plate legs are completed with foot protection called sabatons.

name: Headscarf
description: A simple men's scarf\, skillfully tied around the head to keep it from untying.

name: Painted pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Hemmed hood
description: If you have a little more money\, it should be apparent. That's the decent thing to do.

name: Cooked deer rump
description: Delicious hind leg meat. The topside cut makes for the best roast. Dice the rest and boil it in salted water. Now to make a good sauce to go with it\, crumble some bread in beer\, add a little vinegar and cook it with some pepper and cloves\, if you have them. Pour the sauce on top of the cooked venison and garnish with baked apples. This is how Severin the Younger advises deer to be prepared.

name: Dead virgin's hair
description: A talisman made from the hair of a dead virgin. It's said to protect its wearer against venereal diseases. +8 gonorrhea resistance.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Simple hood
description: A hat is for show\, a hood is for the cold.

name: The Book of Poison
description: About abominable poisons\, their acquisition\, and the art of stopping the effects caused by them.

name: Cuman shield
description: A circular Cuman shield used by light Hungarian horsemen.

name: Hose joined
description: Long hose are a staple of men's clothing. They are worn by noble lords as well as simple folks. However\, they differ in quality of fabric\, cut or richness of colour. These hose are fashionably joined at the crotch by a separate flap.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Fastened caftan
description: A caftan is a long men's overcoat with long sleeves. It is a traditional part of the male dress of nomads from the eastern steppes. It fastens at the chest with a series of ornate buttons.

name: Dried boar tenderloin
description: A prime piece of a boar meat\, juicy and tasty. Prague burgher Havel of Silberstein liked it very much and used to prepare it in a special way called wild boar on venison.

name: Beggar's hood
description: Even a quality hood will turn into a worthless rag with time and wear\, but it's still better than nothing.

name: Decorated headpiece
description: Ornate headpieces are worn by young unmarried girls on their uncovered hair\, by married women under the veil.

name: Huge dragon bone
description: This bone is really huge. Good thing what it belonged to is long dead.

name: Pointy cap
description: A simple pointed cap with a narrow crepe is an interesting fashion choice even for less affluent people.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Relics of cloth scraps
description: A tiny fragment from the veil of Saint Ludmila is a piece of very fine batiste. Ludmila prayed sincerely to Christ and brought her grandson\, Prince Wenceslas\, the patron saint of the Bohemian Kingdom\, to faith. But she stood in the way of her power-hungry daughter-in-law Drahomira\, who sent two cruel Norsemen to kill her. It is said they did it to her with her own veil while the duchess was praying to God.

name: Work dress
description: An ordinary dress designed for daily wear in domestic and agricultural work. The apron is a typical accessory of a housewife or a maid.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Padded hood
description: A quilted hood with a wide collar protecting the neck and shoulders of the fighter.

name: Painted die
description: One of the dice coloured using modern techniques that hide the attempt to load it.

name: Ataman's sabre
description: An unusual curved blade used by nomads on fast horses in the Hungarian steppes and remote Arabian deserts\, this swift weapon excels at offense and defense alike. Every good Christian should beware of losing his head to such a weapon.

name: Hungarian heater shield
description: A shield made of wooden planks glued together and covered with thin rawhide. These shields are usually decorated with the coat of arms of a lord\, noble family or city.

name: Old Town of Prague knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Noble gambeson
description: Exquisitely tailored and fitted noble coat made of precious fabric designed as a soft undercoat for chainmail armour and plate armour.

name: Knight shield
description: A battle shield made of wooden planks joined glued together and covered with raw cowhide. Usually its outer side is decorated with the coat of arms of the lord or other symbol by which the warriors can recognize each other in the heat of battle.

name: Wolf meat
description: Only eat wolf meat in an emergency and always keep it in flames for a long time beforehand so that all the evil is burned away. Also\, you must never eat too much of it\, for then you may become afflicted by a bad disease or a cruel curse.

name: Map left by the deceased
description: A map the gravedigger found on a dead man.

name: Rosa's manuscript
description: A book of short stories secretly written in Lady Rosa's hand. The last part is our work together.

name: Protective axe
description: An axe forged from three protective talismans. Hidden in the attic of the house\, it will drive away every storm\, fire and hailstorm. Well\, perhaps…

name: Maleshov tower key
description: I have the key. The question is what door it opens\, what lies behind it\, and whether it is wise to find out.

name: Gambeson long
description: A quilted combat shirt made of several layers of plain linen. It provides some protection on its own\, but is primarily worn as a soft underlayer under all types of armour.

name: Simple shoes
description: Low-cut shoes come in a variety of designs. These simple\, comfortable shoes are popular among all societal classes.

name: Narrow headband
description: A narrow headband\, or also a crown\, made of more or less noble metal\, is usually decorated with semi-precious and genuine precious stones.

name: Tournament mace
description: An excellent mace\, which serves more as a symbol of a strict ruler over the tournament than for fighting.

name: Leather apron
description: A long linen tunic joined by a long leather apron for harder work in the workshop.

name: Godwin's personal belongings
description: A bunch of Godwin's stuff\, I'd rather not open the bag. Who knows what I might find in there.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: On the Composition of Alchemy II
description: A skill book on Alchemy. Can be read from level 5 of this skill.

name: Embroidered hood
description: Either you have someone skilled who likes you\, or you just have to pay extra for the embroidery.

name: Bonnet
description: The tied cap is worn by women and girls not only at work\, it is also a sign of their status. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not be seen in public without their hair covered.

name: Copper plate
description: Two out of three pieces of copper ware were made from copper mined in Falun\, Sweden\, where a large copper mountain is said to be located.

name: Cuman chief's bow
description: Cuman riding bows are one of the lighter bows\, easy to handle even from the horse's saddle. Their strength comes from the layering of different materials similar to better crossbows. This bow is a true masterpiece worthy of a famous Cuman chief.

name: Sunken chest key
description: The key I found in a skeleton by an abandoned cart on the riverbank.

name: Riding waffenrock
description: The Waffenrock is a loose outer garment\, usually linen\, worn over armour. It carried the colours of the lord\, town or ruler the wearer bore allegiance to\, and as such was the precursor of the military uniform. It also protects its wearers armour from dust and harsh sun.

name: Sapphire ring
description: Gold ring set with a small polished sapphire.

name: Astrolabe
description: An odd device full of cogs\, dials and other mechanisms I know nothing about. I hear it's called an astrolabe\, but that doesn't tell me much about what it's used for.

name: Undigested skull
description: A skull pulled from a pig's innards. It's been chewed on a bit.

name: Map of Kuttenberg underground
description: A map of the Kuttenberg underground\, which has been used for not entirely honourable purposes.

name: Weapon stub
description: The remains of a weapon. It used to be useful\, now it's useless.

name: Dog meat
description: Raw meat from a dog. It doesn't sound good because it's not very good. But it's still better than trying to eat shit. Actually\, it might be wisest to fast.

name: Bloodied broken arrow
description: I found this bloodied broken arrow near the place Natan told me about. Maybe Mutt can sniff out its owner.

name: Sketch – Executioner's axe
description: A lightweight\, well-forged battleaxe. The blade forged to a point replaces the spike\, which can be used to cut through chainmail and the belly underneath.

name: Dried boar meat
description: The taste of a poacher's long winter evenings.

name: Short aketon
description: A quilted coat sewn to the best fit\, so it is great to wear and does not restrict movement. An excellent soft layer under other types of armour.

name: Vejmola's medallion
description: The Vejmola's medallion. It flashes so brightly that no magpie can resist it.

name: Halved pavese
description: A skillfully painted riding pavese.

name: Vagrant's boots
description: Plain\, ankle-high lace-up boots with a raised toe\, suitable for wealthy travellers and poor vagrants alike.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: Coif
description: A simple linen headdress usually worn under a hat or cap.

name: Training sword
description: A wooden longsword that can bruise but not kill. For those who are serious about swordsmanship\, this is an invaluable tool for practicing.

name: Work headscarf
description: A work scarf hides the hair and protects it from dirt. According to the custom of the time\, married women should not appear in public without their hair covered.

name: Broken shield
description: The remains of the shield. Good as firewood.

name: A suspicious bag
description: What might be inside?

name: Beer tankard
description: A discarded tankard left at the baths after a great celebration.

name: Noble chaperon
description: A chaperon is originally just a hood worn backwards\, transformed into an elegant headdress by means of a special harness. This one is tailored to the best cut of good cloth and would therefore not be lost in a royal court.

name: Soft shoes
description: Soft comfortable shoes made of fine leather give the wearer the confidence that his steps will be less audible. Which sometimes comes in handy.

name: Christian's safe conduct
description: A letter of safe conduct entitling the bearer to move around in the royal mines near Horschan.

name: Frilled veil
description: Veils\, or also veils or shawls belong to the everyday clothing of married and widowed women. They are most often white or light-coloured and are fastened with pins and brooches.

name: Lord of Suchotlesky heater shield
description: A heater shield with the family coat of arms of Sir Peter of Suchotlesky.

name: Door and chest keys
description: The owner's keys to all his doors and chests.

name: Groschen
description: Groschen\, Groschen\, Groschen<br>My silver cushion<br>It's a merchant's world<br>Groschen\, Groschen\, Groschen<br>It's my passion\,<br/> now my goods are sold.

name: Bunch of keys
description: All the ordinary keys to the doors and chests in one nice bunch.

name: Keys to the shop
description: The key to every chest and door in the shop.

name: Short tunic
description: A short linen tunic is worn by rich and poor alike as a base for the rest of the outfit.

name: A book by the Wysoka parish priest.
description: A book by the Wysoka parish priest. He spent many years working on it…

name: Uncommon die
description: Test die.

name: Brunswick's bascinet
description: A large bascinet decorated with a gilded lion statuette\, excellent for jousting tournaments. According to legend\, it belonged to the Bohemian prince Brunswick.

name: Warhorse pourpoint
description: A fitted quilted coat that honours the colours of the Lords of Warhorse. It is suitable as a base layer under armour\, but one need not be ashamed even when wearing it just as it is.

name: Master huntsman's gloves
description: Hunting gloves provide a good grip on a bow or crossbow and those who don't want to get dirty when preparing game can keep them on. Although this pair may be a little too nice for the job.

name: Brunswick's chainmail coif
description: A  hood complete with a small hook. Provides decent protection while hiding under a large bucket helmet. According to legend\, it belonged to the Bohemian Prince Bruncvík.

name: Brunswick's dagger
description: A dagger worthy of a true knight. Its shape is perfectly suited to cut right into a gap between armour.

name: Master huntsman's hood
description: An essential piece of every hunter's kit\, a hood it protects its wearer from the harsh sun in open clearings\, cold winds on morning hunts\, and prickly thorns while stalking prey. This one is bedazzled with pearls for good measure.

name: Shield of Autumn
description: You'd rather go hunting with a crossbow than with a shield\, but this knightly shield with an autumn hunting motif will reliably protect you from the hit of your antlered enemies.

name: Brunswick's plate sleeves
description: Full arm and forearm protection with gilded shoulder pads in the form of targets. This is simply the pinnacle of knightly handsomeness. According to legend\, it belonged to the Bohemian Prince Brunswick.

name: Shield of Summer
description: A Cuman shield with a traditional symbol of the hot Hungarian sun.

name: Nimrod's coat
description: Nimrod was the great-grandson of Noah\, who\, according to legend\, possessed the mantle of Adam with which he lured animals into his traps. He is rightly called the greatest hunter of the ancient world. In the Bohemian lands\, his name Nimrod has become synonymous with hunter or huntsman. This coat may not attract animals\, but its colour makes the hunter blend in well with the surrounding vegetation.

name: Artemis' crossbow
description: Artemis - the ancient goddess of the hunt\, but also the guardian of virgin purity\, who can bring sudden death. So watch out!

name: Shield of Summer
description: A Cuman shield with a traditional symbol of the hot Hungarian sun.

name: Warhorse bascinet
description: An older form of the bascinet with a removable wide bretache\, complete with a chainmail aventail protecting the warrior's neck and shoulders.

name: Warhorse waffenrock
description: This waffenrock makes it clear to everyone where your allegiance lies!

name: Cutpurse's pourpoint
description: It's good to dress light for an event\, but you never know what can happen. This pourpoint provides at least basic protection while allowing you to remain unseen.

name: Shield of Spring
description: A true knight wields a rose more often than a sword!

name: Warhorse shield
description: This shield clearly displays the house to which its bearer gives allegiance.

name: Master huntsman's boots
description: You need proper footwear for the forest. The hardy hunter will find the terrain challenging. Treacherous rocks\, slippery mud and miles of forest undergrowth.

name: Shield of Spring
description: A true knight wields a rose more often than a sword!

name: Cutpurse's hose
description: Where hands fail\, strong legs must step in. These pants won't help you run any faster\, but at least they won't give you away when you're hiding in a pile of manure.

name: Cutpurse's shoes
description: Neat hands and quiet footwear are essential for success.

name: Brunswick's brigandine
description: A masterpiece from the best armourer. The folded armour is assembled from a number of small hardened slats attached to an upper vest of the finest cowhide\, which is covered with a precious fabric of excellent quality. The best protection and fashion taste in one! The armour is said to have once belonged to the legendary Bohemian Prince Brunswick.

name: Warhorse shield
description: This shield clearly displays the house to which its bearer gives allegiance.

name: Warhorse gauntlets
description: Finger gloves composed of small slats riveted to the leather and completed with a buckle\, so they fit like a glove. Compared to gloves made of cloth\, they last a little less\, but they are lighter and fit better.

name: Warhorse plate leg armour
description: A full leg protection of a newer type formed by the combination of lamerall and plate armour. While the thighs are protected by folded slats\, the warrior's shins are encircled by well-forged metal plates.

name: Brunswick's plate leg armour
description: The perfect leg protection made of hardened sheet metal that not just anyone can afford. The legendary Bohemian Prince Brunswick himself is said to have worn such armour.

name: Shield of Winter
description: For a proper totentanz of your enemies\, the death figure on this shield will play some serious totenmusik.

name: Brunswick's poleaxe
description: A knight's battle axe on a staff. This is exactly what George the Lion of Wartenberg wanted. In the end\, I made it according to the lost instructions.

name: Warhorse tournament caparison
description: A cape of thick cloth covering the entire body of the horse decorated with embroidery. It makes the animal much bolder\, but slows it down and limits its carrying capacity.

name: Brunswick's gauntlets
description: These aren't just perfectly forged pieces of sheet metal\, they're works of art! It's said that Prince Brunswick himself wore such gauntlets.

name: Shield of Autumn
description: You'd rather go hunting with a crossbow than with a shield\, but this knightly shield with an autumn hunting motif will reliably protect you from the hit of your antlered enemies.

name: Broken polearm
description: The rest of a polearm weapon. Just add a bucket for a head\, some old rags\, some other junk for hands\, and instead of villains\, the poor pole will be scaring away crows in the field.

name: Cutpurse's hood
description: Ordinary people wear hoods as protection from wind\, cold\, sun and rain. But some people wear hoods to protect themselves from the eyes of other people.

name: Brunswick's caparison
description: A cloth hood covering the whole body of a horse which\, according to an old Czech legend\, belonged to the brave knight Brunswick.

name: St. Hubert's hat
description: Legend has it that while pious people rushed to church on Good Friday\, Hubert\, the oldest son of the Prince\, went hunting. But instead of prey\, he saw a majestic stag with a glowing cross between its antlers\, which spoke to him. After this incident\, Hubert led a pious life - so pious that he was eventually canonized and became the patron saint of hunters.

name: Warhorse boots
description: They're just ordinary shoes\, don't look for the brand on them. But what kind of set would it be if it didn't have shoes?

name: Cutpurse's gloves
description: Bare hands are best for delicate work\, but sometimes it's better to protect them at least a little. And then thin gloves made of fine deerskin are ideal.

name: Shield of Winter
description: For a proper totentanz of your enemies\, the death figure on this shield will play some serious totenmusik.

name: Warhorse brigandine sleeves
description: Arm protectors consisting of overlapping hardened slats hammered on cowhide leather.

name: Alluring wreath
description: Wearing a wreath is the domain of single women. But it can look nice on a bachelor\, too.

name: Hungarian saddle
description: A simple wooden saddle with a sheep's wool cushion and a linen seat. It extends the horse's carrying capacity only modestly. But the effect on its speed is also negligible.

name: Tournament caparison decorated
description: A cape of thick cloth covering the entire body of the horse decorated with embroidery and crenellations. It makes the animal much bolder\, but slows it down and limits its carrying capacity.

name: Caparison á la peytral simple
description: A cloth cape covering only the horse's shoulders. It does not make the animal very brave and has a little effect on its speed and carrying capacity.

name: Plain tourney caparison
description: A cloth cape covering the entire body of the horse. It makes the animal more courageous\, but it also slows it down and limits its carrying capacity.

name: Norman saddle
description: Saddle with slightly raised cantle. It extends the horse's carrying capacity only modestly. But the effect on its speed is also negligible.

name: Prague saddle
description: Versatile saddle with reinforced cantle. It extends the horse's carrying capacity only modestly. But the effect on its speed is also negligible.
